This streamlined approach enhances the traveler experience while maintaining safety and security protocols.

The Axon Capture Application utilizes body-worn cameras equipped with artificial intelligence to transcribe and translate audio and video footage for the Transportation Security Administration (TSA). This technology significantly reduces investigative processing times and enhances accuracy by allowing law enforcement officers to rapidly access and categorize evidence. While the AI provides recommendations for data handling, TSA staff ultimately review and certify the final usable data.

The Contract Requirement Automation project aims to streamline the procurement documentation process for the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) by utilizing an AI-driven platform called Carver. This tool automates document generation and provides contextual recommendations, enhancing accuracy, consistency, and compliance while significantly reducing manual effort and associated errors. Additionally, it enables effective resource allocation and maximizes taxpayer dollars by allowing the agency to handle more procurement actions without increasing labor costs, although all outputs require human verification before finalization.

The TSA Case Handling Platform is a custom case management system designed for the TSA’s Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Office that utilizes AI technologies, including large language models, to automate the generation of reports and language for Equal Employment Opportunity claims. This tool significantly reduces manual tasks for case workers, allowing them to focus on case management instead of administrative duties, while enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of information collection and report generation. Additionally, the platform ensures that language recommendations are reviewed by human experts before implementation, optimizing the overall case handling process.

The TSA launched the "Stay Healthy. Stay Secure." campaign to implement safer screening measures at airports during the COVID-19 pandemic. A key component of this initiative is the CDC's Airport Hotspot Throughput, an AI model that uses historical travel data to identify domestic airports with the highest number of connecting flights during peak holiday travel. While TSA provides guidance, decisions regarding flight cancellations and airport closures are made by individual airlines and public health officials.

The Airport Throughput Predictive Model forecasts passenger volume by analyzing security checkpoint throughput data to optimize airport staffing. Monthly data ingestion and model training yield future throughput predictions, which are displayed on Business Intelligence dashboards for airport coordination centers. This model supports operational planning and staffing needs for Transportation Security Administration (TSA) security checkpoints.

2_use_case_name: Credential Authentication Technology with Camera System (CAT-2) and AutoCAT (CAT-2 in an e-gate form factor)
x2_summary_text: The TSA employs AI-based facial matching technologies at checkpoints to enhance traveler identity verification, increasing both speed and accuracy while detecting imposters. The system provides recommendations to Transportation Security Officers based on a comparison between the traveler's face and their presented ID photo. Images captured during this process are not retained, and participation is voluntary.

The TSA has implemented a voluntary Touchless Identity Solution (TIS) using facial comparison technology to enhance the identity verification process at security checkpoints. This system, which utilizes the CBP Traveler Verification Service, allows passengers and crew members to expedite their TSA PreCheck or ID verification while maintaining security protocols. Participants can opt-out at any time and choose standard verification procedures with a Transportation Security Officer.

2_use_case_name: Silicon Valley Innovation Program (SVIP) Language Translator
x2_summary_text: The Silicon Valley Innovation Program (SVIP) is developing a handheld voice translator for the US Coast Guard (USCG) to facilitate communication in high-tension situations where language barriers exist. This portable translator will enable USCG personnel to quickly gather crucial information during rescues, such as the number of individuals onboard and the status of life-saving equipment. By providing real-time, offline language translation, the device aims to enhance the safety and security of both the boarding team and vessel occupants, even in disconnected environments.

2_use_case_name: Adaptive Risk Model for Inspected Small Passenger Vessels
x2_summary_text: The Adaptive Risk Model for Inspected Small Passenger Vessels utilizes machine learning and expert input to develop a quantitative tool that assesses and categorizes the safety risk of U.S. passenger vessels. By calculating a risk score based on logistic regression and various safety factors, the model aids the US Coast Guard in prioritizing inspections and allocating resources effectively, thereby enhancing overall passenger safety. Additionally, policy efforts were implemented to establish inspection frequency and inspector qualifications, coupled with educational outreach to promote the model's adoption and usage.

2_use_case_name: Intelligent Document Processing (IDP) for I-539 Form Digitization
x2_summary_text: The Intelligent Document Processing (IDP) system for the I-539 form automates the identification, categorization, and separation of submitted documents, transforming a single scanned file into multiple digital files for each individual document. This innovation reduces case processing time for adjudicators and ensures compliance with National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) standards. Unidentified documents are escalated for human resolution, enhancing overall efficiency in managing I-539 benefit applications.

2_use_case_name: Large Language Models for an Officer Training Tool
x2_summary_text: The Large Language Model (LLM) for Officer Training tool utilizes Generative AI to create personalized training materials for immigration officers, tailoring content to meet individual needs and enhancing knowledge retention on relevant policies and laws. This AI-driven approach aims to improve understanding, decision-making accuracy, and reduce the necessity for retraining, while providing human-like conversational responses specific to Refugee, Asylum, and International Operations (RAIO) Officer training.

2_use_case_name: User Entity and Behavior Analytics (UEBA) for Security Operations (SecOps) Anomaly Identification
x2_summary_text: User Entity and Behavior Analytics (UEBA) is a tool developed to review USCIS system logs and identify anomalous actions by entities, including workstations, servers, and internal accounts. It analyzes logs using manually maintained models to assign risk scores that help Security Operations (SecOps) prioritize incidents for investigation. Enhanced by machine learning, UEBA improves the detection of potential threats such as credential compromises and risky behaviors, thereby increasing the efficiency of the USCIS Security Operations Center (SOC).

2_use_case_name: I-765 - USCIS Face Capture Mobile App
x2_summary_text: The I-765 USCIS Face Capture Mobile App allows users to fulfill biometric verification requirements without attending in-person appointments at Applicant Support Centers, thereby reducing both applicant burden and USCIS resource demands. The app utilizes face detection technology to capture quality photographs and employs the ELIS Photo Validation service to ensure compliance with USCIS standards, streamlining the processing efficiency for adjudicators. This mobile solution enhances convenience for applicants, especially those who face travel challenges or scheduling conflicts.

2_use_case_name: Case Processing Improvements in FDNS-DS NexGen
x2_summary_text: The FDNS-DS NexGen project aims to enhance case processing in USCIS by leveraging artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) to assist in investigative work, improve case prioritization, and detect duplicate cases. By integrating AI/ML into the predictive modeling for system enhancements, USCIS seeks to strengthen the integrity of the immigration system, combat fraud, and streamline investigative processes. Currently, the functionality of AI/ML within FDNS-DS NexGen is in the discovery phase, with future outputs expected to include recommendations and anomaly detection to aid in fraud management.

The USCIS Translation Service is leveraging AI and GenAI models to enhance the speed and accuracy of document translation and real-time interpretation for immigration services. The project aims to address key challenges such as limited translation capacity, accuracy variability, high costs, and accessibility issues by providing efficient AI-powered solutions for document translation and speech translation across various languages. It focuses on optimizing processes for US Refugee Admissions Program caseworkers and improving communication within the Department of Homeland Security.

The Verification Match Model enhances the USCIS verification matching process by utilizing AI and machine learning to improve system accuracy, minimize human error, and increase match volume beyond traditional methods. This model consolidates existing data verification tools for the E-Verify and SAVE programs into a single microservice, providing ranked match scores based on identifiers like names and dates of birth. The streamlined approach not only improves the accuracy of these systems but also reduces the need for manual case reviews, making the overall verification process more efficient.

2_use_case_name: Sentiment Analysis -FOD Field Offices Complaints and Reviews
x2_summary_text: The Sentiment Analysis - FOD Field Offices Complaints and Reviews system evaluates feedback from USCIS to determine the expressed sentiments, categorizing them as positive, negative, or neutral. The analysis is presented in an Excel dashboard and a Databricks graph, enabling the Field Operations Directorate to identify trends and areas for improvement in customer service without providing specific recommendations. The system leverages machine learning techniques to enhance the examination of complaints and reviews from various channels, aiding in the identification of key issues and trends.

The Asylum Text Analytics (ATA) project, managed by USCIS, aims to enhance the affirmative asylum program by leveraging machine learning and data graphing techniques to detect plagiarism-based fraud in asylum applications. The project focuses on analyzing the digitized narratives of Form I-589, which individuals file to apply for asylum, in order to identify common language patterns indicative of fraud. This initiative supports USCIS's mission to provide protection to qualified individuals who face persecution in their home countries.

2_use_case_name: Biometrics Enrollment Tool (BET) Fingerprint Quality Score
x2_summary_text: The Biometrics Enrollment Tool (BET) integrates the NIST Fingerprint Image Quality 2 (NFIQ2) algorithm to evaluate fingerprint quality by assigning scores ranging from 0 to 100. A higher score indicates better image quality and a greater likelihood of successful future matches. However, this specific use case is currently inactive.

USCIS has implemented a timeseries analysis and forecasting project to manage the influx of green card applications by utilizing exploratory data analysis and machine learning techniques. Specifically, they employed Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) models to predict the volume of Form I-90 submissions over a two-year period. This system, which has been in production for over a year, was later enhanced for improved performance and reusability.

2_use_case_name: Testing Performance of ML Model using H2O
x2_summary_text: USCIS utilized H2O machine learning models to analyze and predict workloads associated with the Form I-90, which is required for lawful permanent residents in the U.S. This project combined exploratory data analysis to determine prevalent applicant categories with machine learning to enhance operational efficiency amid a surge in green card applications. The initiative successfully identified the most accurate model for analyzing time series data and forecasting.

2_use_case_name: USCIS  Consular Consolidated Database (CCD) Facial Recognition (FR) On Demand Report (VISA Only)
x2_summary_text: USCIS utilizes the Facial Recognition (FR) on Demand report for visa applications to identify potential fraud among benefit applicants whose fingerprints are absent from the IDENT system. This process involves matching applicants' photos against those in the Department of State's Consular Consolidated Database (CCD) to ensure the integrity of the visa issuance process. Responses from this system indicate whether there is a match or no match with existing photos.

The Sentiment Analysis - Employee Satisfaction Surveys project utilizes Natural Language Processing (NLP) to categorize survey responses into sentiments ranging from strongly positive to strongly negative. While the technical feasibility has been demonstrated through a proof-of-concept, concerns about privacy prevent the implementation of the system in any business unit. Recommendations or decisions based on the analysis have not been provided, and the project remains unoperationalized pending resolution of privacy issues.

The Sentiment Analysis project for ELIS Case Notes utilizes a machine learning model to classify adjudicative officers' notes into positive, negative, or neutral sentiments. Although not yet in production, it aims to enhance case processing efficiency by providing sentiment insights that support decision-making. The results are visualized through an Excel dashboard and a Datanricks graph, though no specific recommendations or decisions are provided.

The Predicted to Naturalize model forecasts the eligibility of Legal Permanent Residents for naturalization and identifies their current addresses. Although the model has the potential to facilitate communication with USCIS customers regarding their residency status and available benefits, its use case is currently inactive.

I-485 Family Matching aimed to develop AI models to connect family members with their respective I-485 petitions, addressing the challenges of matching them due to limited available data, such as the unreliable Alien-number and common addresses. The project sought to enhance the grouping of I-485 filings by family members and associated forms for more efficient processing. However, after initial ideation, no viable AI model was created, as the desired outcomes were deemed infeasible with the existing technology.

2_use_case_name: Topic Modeling on Request For Evidence (RFE) Data Sets
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on topic modeling applied to Request For Evidence (RFE) data sets, aiming to uncover themes and classify documents based on those themes. By employing techniques for automatic organization and summarization, it enhances the ability to understand and search through text data. Although currently inactive, the project is designed to reveal hidden insights within the data.

The I-539 approval prediction project utilizes topic modeling to create models that identify and classify documents based on related themes. This approach facilitates the automatic organization, understanding, searching, and summarizing of text data, enabling the discovery of hidden themes within the document collection. However, this particular use case is currently inactive.

2_use_case_name: Text Analytics Data Science Sentence Similarity Model
x2_summary_text: The Text Analytics Data Science Sentence Similarity Model is a research tool that enhances the identification of potential fraud, national security, and public safety concerns in the immigration process by analyzing narrative sections of applications for common language patterns. While it does not make predictions or decisions, it assists trained staff in evaluating and validating potential concerns, ultimately improving the integrity of immigration programs and reducing customer wait times. This capability employs machine learning techniques to facilitate cross-jurisdictional identification of relevant patterns without making determinations on their significance.

The Biometrics Enrollment Tool (BET) enhances fingerprint quality assessment for USCIS by utilizing machine learning to provide real-time feedback on whether fingerprint submissions meet FBI standards. It integrates with existing USCIS systems to improve data accuracy and reduce redundancy in data entry, ultimately aiming to maximize successful FBI submissions while minimizing the need for resubmissions. BET generates a Numerical Fingerprint Quality score that aids in determining compliance with FBI specifications.

2_use_case_name: ELIS Evidence Classifier Machine Learning (ML) Tagging Solution
x2_summary_text: The ELIS Evidence Classifier Machine Learning Tagging Solution streamlines the navigation of evidence documents in the Electronic Immigration System (ELIS) by automatically tagging specific document types, such as marriage certificates and border crossing cards. This enables users to quickly access relevant pages through clickable bookmarks, significantly reducing the time adjudicators spend sifting through large PDF files. The system processes scanned images and outputs labels for recognized documents, enhancing overall case processing efficiency.

2_use_case_name: Automated Name and Date of Birth (DOB) Harvesting from Existing Records
x2_summary_text: The Automated Name and Date of Birth (DOB) Harvesting project aims to streamline the process of extracting aliases and DOBs from Identity History Summary (IdHS) reports, significantly reducing adjudicative time during case processing. It utilizes a named-entity recognition (NER) model and conditional logic to identify and retrieve valid names and DOBs, while minimizing the need for manual review. Although it automates much of the process, it still involves human oversight, allowing users to accept or reject the suggested data.

2_use_case_name: Automated Realtime Global Organization Specialist (ARGOS) for Company Registration Submissions to E-Verify
x2_summary_text: The Automated Realtime Global Organization Specialist (ARGOS) enhances the E-Verify company registration process by conducting sentiment analysis and keyword extraction on publicly available data, generating risk scores and identifying relevant information for management and program analysts (MPAs). This innovation streamlines investigations, significantly reducing the man-hours required for open-source research and enabling faster processing of potentially fraudulent applications. The system presents findings on a user-friendly dashboard, allowing VAC personnel to make informed decisions regarding referrals for further investigation by the Fraud Detection and National Security (FDNS) team.

2_use_case_name: ELIS Card Photo Validation via myUSCIS
x2_summary_text: USCIS has implemented a Photo Validation Service within its ELIS system to ensure that ID photos meet required standards before the production of ID cards, thereby reducing delays in processing immigration requests. The service utilizes computer vision and machine learning techniques to evaluate the uploaded photographs and provide feedback to users, who can choose to ignore any warnings. This innovative solution aims to facilitate a smoother application process by addressing photo issues upfront.

2_use_case_name: I-765 - USCIS Facial Recognition through IDENT (1:1 Face Recognition/Validation)
x2_summary_text: The I-765 project implements facial recognition technology through IDENT to streamline the biometric verification process for employment authorization applications. This innovation eliminates the need for applicants to attend an appointment at an Applicant Support Center, thereby enhancing processing efficiency, reducing resource demands, and ensuring compliance with new FBI regulations. The system provides a match or no match response to improve identity verification and integrity in immigration processing.

The Person-Centric Identity Services (PCIS) Deduplication Model utilizes machine learning to enhance entity resolution for comprehensive immigration history management. It organizes an individual's immigration records, including identifiers and full history, into a single platform, providing a summary view with the latest photo and reverse chronological ordering of addresses. The model employs a high-threshold likelihood score to accurately ascertain record ownership, ensuring a reliable means of deduplication across multiple source systems.

2_use_case_name: Person-Centric Identity Services A-Number Management Model
x2_summary_text: The Person-Centric Identity Services (PCIS) A-Number Management Model project aims to enhance the accuracy of individual identity associations linked to unique A-numbers assigned to noncitizens by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) through machine learning techniques. This initiative generates numerical likelihood scores to ascertain the validity of presented A-numbers, ensuring reliable access to comprehensive immigration histories and statuses for authorized DHS personnel. Ultimately, the project seeks to improve the efficiency and reliability of the PCIS system by providing high-confidence matches for individual identification.

2_use_case_name: Identity Match Option (IMO) Tool for Record Compilation
x2_summary_text: The Identity Match Option (IMO) tool developed by USCIS is designed to streamline person-centric research and analytics by creating a single identity for each applicant across multiple systems. By utilizing various algorithms and a user-friendly dashboard, the IMO tool helps identify duplicate identities within datasets and enables USCIS personnel to access a comprehensive interaction history for each individual. However, the dashboard only displays results without offering predictive or decision-making capabilities.

The Criminal Investigations (OBIM) AI project enables USSS INV personnel to submit probe images, such as photographs or video stills, to other government agencies for comparison against known image galleries. This system assists in generating investigative leads to identify both victims of crimes, like identity theft, and suspects involved in criminal activities undermining U.S. financial systems. Additionally, USSS INV can request one-to-one comparisons of images to enhance the investigative process.

The GitHub Copilot for Code Modernization project aims to enhance the efficiency and quality of code modernization at BEA. It automates the initial conversion of legacy code into modern programming languages, which is subsequently reviewed and refined by human developers before being implemented in applications.

The Azure OpenAI Chat Prototype enables staff to interact with a large language model (LLM) similar to ChatGPT, while ensuring that all data remains within the BEA's network boundary. This project focuses on text and data analysis, facilitating efficient communication and insights for the staff.

Sentinel One Purple AI enhances the BEA cybersecurity program by accelerating and improving incident response times. It utilizes advanced log analysis techniques to ensure comprehensive and efficient handling of security incidents.

2_use_case_name: Real Time Classification for the Economic Census
x2_summary_text: The project utilizes two machine learning models, BEACON and SINCT, to enhance the real-time classification of Primary Business Activity (PBA) and Products during the Economic Census. By automating the classification process, the project successfully reduced the number of NAICS and NAPCS write-ins by 58% and 78%, respectively, in the 2022 Census compared to previous years. This improved accuracy and efficiency streamline responses and minimize the need for manual processing.

The Census Bureau's Geography Division is utilizing AI for Automated Change Detection to identify updates in the built environment twice a year in preparation for the 2030 Decennial Census. By analyzing Sentinel-2 imagery through Google Earth Engine, the project extracts geographic features like roads and building footprints to enhance national coverage and inform the use of high-resolution imagery.

2_use_case_name: School staff information extraction from web page text
x2_summary_text: This project focuses on extracting school staff information from publicly available web pages, specifically targeting staff rosters at public and private schools. The AI system predicts links to staff directories and extracts names and titles of teachers and principals, enhancing the quality and coverage of educational staff data.

2_use_case_name: Census Bureau Demographic Frame Person-Place Model
x2_summary_text: The Census Bureau's Demographic Frame Person-Place Model (PPM) utilizes machine learning to accurately associate individuals with their residential locations, generating predicted probabilities for person-address records. This innovative approach enhances data precision for demographic analyses and population estimates, supporting the Census Bureau's mission to deliver reliable data. By accommodating diverse data sources, the PPM improves the accuracy of governmental operations and informs policy-making and service delivery for the public.

The Race and Ethnicity Autocoding project focuses on creating an automated system for coding write-in entries related to race and ethnicity. Its objective is to enhance the quality and efficiency of this coding process by providing standardized concept codes that correspond to the written responses.

2_use_case_name: Information extraction for web scraped data for Group Quarters frame enhancement
x2_summary_text: This project focuses on extracting information from publicly available web data to enhance the quality and coverage of the Group Quarters (GQ) frame. The initiative aims to identify specific elements such as the capacity, address components, and concepts like dates and building names using pretrained Named Entity Recognition (NER) models.

2_use_case_name: Current Population Survey (CPS) Name Screening Tool
x2_summary_text: The Current Population Survey (CPS) Name Screening Tool utilizes AI to analyze and classify survey data entries to determine the validity of names provided. The objective of this tool is to improve the efficiency and accuracy of data processing and future data collection by identifying invalid name responses.

The Linkage and Matching Program (LaMP) utilizes probabilistic record linkage to connect various person-level datasets, facilitating research on economic, demographic, and other subjects. The AI model predicts potential matches between records by generating pairs that exceed a set similarity threshold, along with a score reflecting their similarity. This process enhances the quality and efficiency of multiple Census operations.

2_use_case_name: Census Research Exploration and Analysis Tool (CREAT)
x2_summary_text: The Census Research Exploration and Analysis Tool (CREAT) is an experimental data tool developed by the Center for Economic Studies (CES) at the US Census Bureau, employing natural language processing to analyze and categorize economic research from CES working papers. Its primary objective is to facilitate connections among research, foster new collaborations, and organize papers by various criteria using NLP techniques for tag extraction and similarity determination. CREAT enhances the accessibility and interconnectedness of economic research publications by allowing users to sort and explore papers effectively.

Dr. NAICS LLM is an AI tool designed to accurately classify business descriptions by suggesting appropriate NAICS codes based on incoming emails and voicemails. It addresses the complexity and nuance of the NAICS classification system, helping businesses effectively identify the correct codes for their activities. The output consists of recommendations for the most suitable NAICS codes corresponding to the provided text descriptions.

2_use_case_name: Automating Multilingual Census Data Processing: An AI and Transformer-Based Pipeline for Efficient Language Detection and Translation for Short-Text
x2_summary_text: The project develops an AI-driven pipeline that automates the processing of multilingual, short-text census data, focusing on language detection, translation, and entity recognition. By leveraging transformer-based models and natural language processing techniques, the system enhances accuracy and efficiency, reducing reliance on human translators while ensuring inclusive representation of diverse populations. The output facilitates streamlined data processing, delivering validated translations and improved demographic insights for better resource allocation and policy-making.

The FAQ search tool for the 2025 Census Test is designed to help the public find accurate Census Bureau answers to common questions using a machine-learning model that incorporates semantic similarity to enhance search effectiveness. Building on previous small-scale tests, this tool will provide over 50 FAQs on its landing page, offering support for users who may not use exact terms. If successful, it could be applied in future Census Tests, enabling better access to official information for the public.

2_use_case_name: Statistical package syntax development and debugging
x2_summary_text: The project involved the development and debugging of SPSS syntax for various statistical analyses, including the generation of interaction terms for moderated multiple regression and the creation of racial codes based on participant self-identifications. The use of AI facilitated the production of complex regression analysis syntax and allowed for comparison of self-identified race across surveys, marking consistency for protected class standings. The final deliverables included SPSS syntax and recommendations for its configuration.

The DSD Python Code Translation project aims to facilitate the conversion of SAS code to Python for DSD data processing, supporting the Census's mission to adopt enterprise-wide solutions and decrease reliance on expensive proprietary software. The project will produce translated Python code that accurately mirrors the original SAS code, followed by a comparison of outputs to ensure correctness until the desired results are attained.

The Census API GPT aids users in retrieving statistical information by guiding them on how to formulate accurate API requests for various data categories, including demographic and economic data. It provides clear explanations of datasets, parameters, and methods, ensuring users can access relevant information easily while emphasizing the importance of specificity in their queries. Additionally, it displays the returned data directly, helping users understand the outcomes of their API calls.

The project aims to enhance the search functionality of data.census.gov by implementing a natural language search interface powered by a large language model (LLM) using a retrieval augmented generation (RAG) architecture. This new system will allow users to pose queries in natural language, leading to more accurate and accessible retrieval of statistics, datasets, and filters. Ultimately, this will improve the overall search experience for users of varying backgrounds.

2_use_case_name: ACES CAPEX (structures, equipment, other) Machine Learning
x2_summary_text: The ACES CAPEX project utilized machine learning to improve the classification of capital expenditures items, specifically structures, equipment, or "other." Although the survey is no longer active and the machine learning system has been discontinued, it aimed to enhance the accuracy of categorizing items as either structures or equipment.

2_use_case_name: FirstNet Authority OCIO MS CoPilot Project
x2_summary_text: The FirstNet Authority OCIO MS CoPilot Project aims to enhance content creation and user productivity through the implementation of Microsoft 365 Copilot in Microsoft Office applications. This technology is designed to help users generate and improve content more efficiently, enabling them to communicate their ideas with less effort while maximizing the use of existing organizational knowledge.

2_use_case_name: FirstNet Authority Communications Topaz Labs Photo Editing
x2_summary_text: The FirstNet Authority project involves the use of AI tools from Topaz Labs to enhance the quality of digital photo and video files. It focuses on improving picture clarity, smoothing video, and scaling images without loss of quality. This initiative aims to leverage advanced editing technology for superior visual content.

The Global Business Navigator Chatbot, developed by ITA, leverages artificial intelligence to provide clear and accurate responses to common export-related questions. It helps users navigate Export Solutions resources and directs more complex inquiries to trade specialists for tailored assistance. Additionally, the chatbot offers multilingual support, enhancing accessibility for a diverse range of users.

2_use_case_name: Generative AI Tools Pilot - Global Markets
x2_summary_text: The Generative AI Tools Pilot in Global Markets aims to enhance report production by automating the generation of initial drafts of market research reports using public data sources. This initiative allows analysts to concentrate on strategic tasks, reduces costs, and improves overall efficiency, leading to superior client service and quicker decision-making. Additionally, the project integrates seamlessly with existing workflows, assisting analysts in refining and finalizing actionable reports.

2_use_case_name: Generative AI Tools Pilot - Enterprise & Solutions Architecture
x2_summary_text: The Generative AI Tools Pilot in Enterprise and Solutions Architecture aims to minimize manual effort in architecture documentation by automating the drafting of technical documents and reference models using standardized templates. It seeks to accelerate solution design, improve operational efficiency, and enhance service quality while summarizing complex data sets for quicker decision-making. Additionally, the project will facilitate compliance checks by applying relevant frameworks and standards.

WAWENETS is a project focused on developing a comprehensive network for collecting, analyzing, and sharing data related to specific themes and topics. It aims to enhance collaboration among stakeholders and improve decision-making processes in various fields. The project's infrastructure supports efficient information exchange and fosters innovation through data-driven insights.

The project aims to enhance the efficiency of the NTIA Office of Spectrum Management (OSM) by streamlining processes and improving federal spectrum management using Azure and CoPilot capabilities. OSM CoPilot will facilitate general office productivity, streamline current spectrum management functions, and accelerate processes by reducing unnecessary steps, all under the oversight of spectrum stakeholders.

Spectrum Visualizations is a project that focuses on creating visual representations of spectral data. The aim is to enhance understanding and analysis of various types of spectrum information through clear and insightful graphical displays. This initiative presents a valuable tool for researchers and practitioners in fields that rely on spectral analysis.

2_use_case_name: Use of Lexis. Other searches for legal research
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on utilizing Lexis, a comprehensive legal research tool, to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of legal research processes. It explores various search techniques and strategies to optimize results and improve the thoroughness of legal investigations. The aim is to equip users with the necessary skills to leverage Lexis and other legal databases for better-informed legal decision-making.

The Grants Program Administration team is investigating the use of AI to enhance their processes, focusing on knowledge management for internal collaboration. Additionally, they aim to utilize machine learning and compliance-based analytics to review post-award reports, identifying trends and inconsistencies in technical, progress, performance, and financial data.

Grammarly enhances the quality of written communications by offering grammar, punctuation, and style improvements. It also aids in idea generation and helps refine tone and style for better clarity and effectiveness. The tool focuses on delivering content generation assistance to elevate overall writing quality.

The Science Data Portal Autosuggest Search project aims to enhance user experience by facilitating the discovery, access, and reuse of scientific, engineering, and technical information from the bureau. It features dynamically generated terms that are filtered and ranked based on their frequency to assist end users more effectively.

FathomNet is a project focused on the annotation of ocean images to create datasets for training machine learning models. It aims to enhance understanding of marine environments by providing accurate labels and categorizations for various marine species and habitats. The project contributes to advancing marine research and conservation efforts through improved image recognition technology.

The Coastal Change Analysis Program (C-CAP) focuses on developing high-resolution land cover data for the United States. This initiative aims to enhance the understanding of coastal land use changes and inform decision-making related to environmental management and conservation.

2_use_case_name: CoralNet: Ongoing operational use, improvement, and development, of machine vision point classification
x2_summary_text: CoralNet is a project focused on the operational use and enhancement of machine vision for classifying points in coral reef monitoring. It leverages computer vision technology to support conservation efforts by providing accurate assessments of coral health and biodiversity. The project aims to continuously improve its methodologies to better serve the needs of reef conservation.

Coral Reef Watch utilizes remote sensing data to monitor and predict coral reef health and conditions. The project focuses on interpreting satellite imagery and environmental data to provide insights into coral bleaching and other threats facing marine ecosystems. Its aim is to support conservation efforts and inform stakeholders about the status of coral reefs globally.

The project involves using a U-net model, developed in R with the TLC package, to identify and track sightings of Steller sea lions. The objective is to enhance monitoring and conservation efforts for this species through advanced image processing techniques. The model's application focuses on improving accuracy in detecting and analyzing sea lion populations.

2_use_case_name: CoralNet: Ongoing operational use, improvement, and development, of machine vision point classification.
x2_summary_text: CoralNet is focused on the operational use and enhancement of machine vision technology for point classification in coral reef monitoring. This project utilizes Fully Convolutional Neural Networks (FCNN) to improve accuracy and efficiency in analyzing coral health and biodiversity. Ongoing development efforts aim to refine the machine learning models and expand their applications in ecological studies.

2_use_case_name: BANTER, a machine learning acoustic event classifier
x2_summary_text: BANTER is a machine learning model designed to classify acoustic events. It analyzes audio data to identify and categorize different sounds, improving the understanding and processing of acoustic information. The project aims to enhance applications in various fields such as surveillance, environmental monitoring, and user interfaces.

2_use_case_name: Operational satellite product quality monitoring AI-ready training data
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on developing AI-ready training data for operational satellite product quality monitoring, utilizing NOAA's NDE and NCCF environments. By leveraging advanced AI technologies for anomaly detection in satellite products, the initiative aims to automate and enhance the accuracy of quality assessments, reducing the reliance on manned monitoring that is currently labor-intensive and stressful. The implementation of AI will enable efficient identification of satellite product anomalies through pattern recognition and automated alert systems.

LightningCast uses artificial intelligence to predict lightning events, offering advanced warnings before the threat materializes. It enables users to assess the probability of lightning occurring at a specific location within the next 60 minutes, allowing for proactive measures to safeguard life and property.

The CyberSecurity Hardening & Automation project focuses on the analysis of cybersecurity architecture, documentation, and vulnerabilities to improve security measures. It aims to identify remediation and automation opportunities while ensuring continuous monitoring and effective responses to data calls. Additionally, the project includes conducting architectural risk assessments and generating necessary documentation for ongoing risk management.

2_use_case_name: AI based Community Radiative Transfer Model
x2_summary_text: The AI-based Community Radiative Transfer Model enables rapid radiative transfer calculations to support enhanced weather forecasts and the creation of satellite products. It simulates satellite radiances and provides sensitivity analyses (Jacobian) for satellite data, addressing the growing demands for accurate satellite information.

The Operational Enterprise Cloud Mask project focuses on developing internal ECM algorithm classifiers to enhance cloud detection capabilities across various surface types and atmospheric conditions. This initiative aims to improve the accuracy and efficiency of cloud detection processes.

2_use_case_name: AI Snowfall Detection and Snowfall Rate estimation
x2_summary_text: This project focuses on developing artificial intelligence algorithms to detect snowfall and estimate snowfall rates. By leveraging advanced data analysis techniques, it aims to improve the accuracy and efficiency of snowfall monitoring to enhance weather forecasting and related applications.

The AI Rain Rate Estimation project focuses on utilizing artificial intelligence techniques to accurately estimate the rate of rainfall in real-time. By leveraging machine learning algorithms and historical weather data, the project aims to improve the precision of rain forecasts, which can enhance weather monitoring and inform decision-making in various sectors.

The AI Total Precipitable Water estimation project utilizes artificial intelligence techniques to accurately measure and predict total precipitable water in the atmosphere. This involves analyzing various meteorological data inputs to enhance forecasting and understanding of water vapor distribution. The objective is to improve weather prediction models and support climate research.

The AI Cloud Liquid Water estimation project focuses on developing advanced algorithms to accurately measure liquid water content in clouds using artificial intelligence techniques. This project aims to enhance the understanding of cloud properties and improve weather prediction models by leveraging data analytics and machine learning approaches. By utilizing satellite imagery and atmospheric data, it seeks to provide valuable insights into cloud dynamics and precipitation forecasting.

The project focuses on developing an AI-driven tool to enhance patent searches for examiners. It analyzes both published and unpublished applications to recommend relevant prior art areas, allowing users to sort results based on concept similarity. This augmentation aims to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the patent examination process.

The project focuses on utilizing AI to automate the assignment of Cooperative Patent Classification (CPC) symbols to patent utility documents, enhancing efficiency in the classification process. This system aims to decrease classification time, reduce agency costs, and ensure greater consistency in classification practices by predicting relevant CPC symbols for each inputted utility patent document.

2_use_case_name: AI retrieval for TM design coding and image search
x2_summary_text: The project involves developing an AI retrieval system for trademark design coding and image searches using Clarivate's COTS solution. This system will aid examiners in identifying similar trademark images, assigning appropriate design codes, and assessing the acceptability of goods and services identifications. It will process both incoming and registered trademark images to produce relevant design codes and related images.

The Enriched Citation project is a data dissemination system that identifies and extracts references cited in patent application office actions, including their bibliographic information and relevant claims. By utilizing AI to summarize unstructured text, the system not only streamlines information retrieval but also generates operational cost savings. The extracted data is accessible through a structured public-facing API.

The Inventor Search Assistant (iSAT) is an online service designed to assist inventors in conducting novelty searches by offering relevant documents, figures, and classification codes based on a brief description of their invention. This tool aims to ensure uninterrupted access to public search capabilities during COVID-19 closures, facilitating the innovation process for inventors. It allows users to select from a curated set of resources tailored to their specific needs.

DesignVision is a SaaS AI-driven image search tool designed to assist in the examination of design applications. It analyzes uploaded images and generates results based on similarity, facilitating access, search, and retrieval of information from Industrial Design collections.

The USPTO Virtual Assistant is a public-facing chatbot designed to provide answers to inquiries related to trademarks and patents. It assists users by addressing common questions about trademark and patent processes, enhancing accessibility to essential information.

The project focuses on the automatic determination of document codes for patent applications, aiming to enhance the quality control of customer-applied document labels. It seeks to ensure accurate labeling and organization of documents related to patents. This automation process is designed to improve efficiency and reduce errors in document management.

The project aims to utilize AI to automate the assignment of Skill Group designations to patent applications, facilitating a more efficient classification system than the outdated US Patent Classification (USPC). This automation is expected to reduce costs related to Skill Group designation workloads, enhance metrics data availability, and improve management of unexamined patent inventory and workforce allocation. Additionally, the AI system will provide predictions for the appropriate Skill Group for each patent application, accompanied by a confidence score reflecting the accuracy of these predictions.
The groundwater modeling project focuses on predicting the flow of contaminants in underground groundwater. It emphasizes parameter estimation to enhance the accuracy of groundwater models.

The OpenText for Records Management project focuses on automating the classification of email records to streamline the process. By leveraging OpenText's capabilities, each email message will be automatically categorized into the appropriate category, significantly reducing the time required for manual classification.

2_use_case_name: Applications of Natural Language Processing and Similarity Measures for Similarity Ranking
x2_summary_text: This project focuses on showcasing the capabilities of artificial intelligence by applying natural language processing and similarity measures for similarity ranking. It aims to achieve cost savings through the sharing of algorithms, methodologies, and insights from evaluations and deployments in the ES&H DAMaL Tools. The project will also deliver customized outputs, such as ranked records based on the analysis.

2_use_case_name: Data Analytics and Machine Learning (DAMaL) Tools to enhance the analysis of Environment, Safety and Health (ES&H) data:  Classification, Robotic Process Automation and Data Visualization
x2_summary_text: The DAMaL project focuses on developing tools that leverage data analytics and machine learning to improve the analysis of Environment, Safety, and Health (ES&H) data. Key features include AI-driven data visualization, enhanced efficiency in extracting insights from ES&H data, and the creation of dynamic data visualization charts. The initiative aims to streamline processes and provide better analytical capabilities in the field of environmental, safety, and health data management.

2_use_case_name: Data Analytics and Machine Learning (DAMaL) Tools for Analysis of Environment, Safety and Health (ES&H) data:  Similarity Based Information Retrieval
x2_summary_text: The DAMaL project focuses on developing tools for the analysis of Environment, Safety, and Health (ES&H) data using data analytics and machine learning techniques. It aims to enhance the efficiency of information retrieval through AI by implementing similarity-based methods to rank records effectively, thereby facilitating easier access to relevant data.

2_use_case_name: Data Analytics and Machine Learning (DAMaL) Tools to enhance the analysis of Environment, Safety and Health (ES&H) data:  Unsupervised Machine Learning Text Clustering
x2_summary_text: The DAMaL project focuses on utilizing data analytics and machine learning tools to analyze Environment, Safety, and Health (ES&H) data through unsupervised machine learning text clustering. It aims to enhance the efficiency of report grouping by identifying and highlighting significant data trends and topics within ES&H records. The outcome will facilitate improved insights and decision-making by clustering records based on key terms and themes.

2_use_case_name: Fast AI for real-time/online diagnostics and calibration; AI-based autonomous system control/operation optimization (including anomaly/failure detection)
x2_summary_text: This project focuses on developing AI and machine learning techniques for real-time diagnostics and calibration of accelerator-based scientific user facilities, such as light sources. It aims to enhance operational efficiency, optimize control systems, and detect anomalies, ultimately increasing scientific throughput, energy efficiency, and enabling new capabilities at these facilities. Additionally, it predicts accelerator beam behavior and guides adjustments to controllable variables to improve performance.

2_use_case_name: AI for system design optimization (e.g., detector, accelerator)
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on leveraging AI and machine learning for optimizing system designs, such as detectors and accelerators, by modeling small data sets within complex, high-dimensional parameter spaces. The AI system acts as a non-parametric data fitting model, providing accurate predictions of future data points and associated uncertainties, which enhances the efficiency of optimization algorithms and reduces the time required for design processes.

PARSGPT enables PM Analysts to safely engage with LLM technology through a user-friendly chatbot that offers free-form text responses to inquiries. This tool enhances accessibility and streamlines interactions with advanced language models.

CrowdStrike utilizes advanced predictive technology to forecast malicious behavior and offers actionable recommendations. The platform effectively blocks harmful activities, ensuring enhanced cybersecurity.

The SCMC AWS Data Infrastructure project focuses on automating various manual processes to enhance data quality and governance. It will leverage machine learning to identify inconsistent data and predict optimal data organization methods.

The ServiceNow Predictive Intelligence project focuses on improving the accuracy and consistency of ticket data classification within the ServiceNow platform. By leveraging predictive analytics, it aims to enhance the field classification of incoming data, resulting in more efficient ticket management and service delivery.

The AI-Enhanced Lab Assist project aims to improve operational efficiency and information sharing in lab activity planning by incorporating lessons learned and best practices. It utilizes AI technology to detect trends in planning and control data, fostering a culture of continuous improvement within the organization.

Microsoft 365 Copilot is being implemented at PNNL to enhance productivity by streamlining workflows and improving efficiency. The tool will enable researchers to concentrate on innovation rather than administrative tasks, ultimately accelerating scientific research and operational effectiveness. Key benefits include improved document quality, insightful data analysis, enhanced collaboration, and automated workflows.

2_use_case_name: NLCOO AI for Lessons Learned tool
x2_summary_text: The NLCOO AI for Lessons Learned tool enhances the ability to search and extract insights from existing lessons learned documents. This improvement aims to optimize work processes by leveraging valuable information. The tool provides a search functionality to access a comprehensive list of relevant documents.

2_use_case_name: Spot for automated sensing, inspection, and capture
x2_summary_text: Spot is a mobile robot designed for automated sensing, inspection, and data capture in hazardous or difficult-to-access environments. It utilizes advanced sensors and cameras to perform inspections, aiming to enhance efficiency and improve the accuracy of sensor research data.

2_use_case_name: Microsoft Power Platform capability that provides AI to automate processes in Power Apps and Power Automate
x2_summary_text: The Microsoft Power Platform integrates AI to automate processes in Power Apps and Power Automate, allowing PNNL to streamline routine tasks like data entry, reporting, and workflow management. This automation enhances productivity, minimizes human error, and optimizes the management of research projects and resources, enabling researchers and staff to concentrate on more valuable activities.

CAISY is an AI-powered platform that offers interactive, scenario-based learning experiences where users can practice skills in a safe and personalized environment. Learners engage with an AI-generated avatar and can interact through text or speech, receiving adaptive feedback and evaluations to enhance their development. The platform focuses on creating immersive learning experiences that foster skill acquisition and growth.

The ServiceNow Virtual Agent is designed to deliver troubleshooting assistance to employees for IT-related issues through a chat interface. It provides automated responses to common inquiries and helps streamline the support process. The goal is to enhance employee experience by offering quick and effective solutions to technical problems.

2_use_case_name: Databricks AI for Cloud Data Warehouse
x2_summary_text: The "Databricks AI for Cloud Data Warehouse" project focuses on enhancing efficiency in analytics and the deployment of artificial intelligence and machine learning models. It aims to provide recommendations based on analytic input, streamlining data-driven decision-making processes.

The project focuses on improving the quality and accuracy of the Department of Energy's (DOE) technical standards to enhance safety excellence. It involves gathering recommendations and feedback to support continuous improvement in these standards. The initiative aims to ensure that the DOE maintains high safety standards across all operations.

Microsoft Copilot for Security is designed to proactively identify, mitigate, and respond to threats within an organization. It enhances security through real-time monitoring, automated incident responses, and thorough vulnerability management, ultimately providing outputs such as improved threat detection, compliance reports, and reduced cyber risk. The implementation of this tool at PNNL aims to ensure sustained operational continuity and enhanced data protection.

The project involves an AI tool that generates MP4 audio files for training content, facilitating faster development to meet company demands. This approach results in cost savings during initial development and future modifications.

The Lex Natural Language Interface is designed to allow users to easily query project data, including funding, allocation units, project focus, and fiscal years, using natural language prompts. It executes queries against a PostgreSQL database and provides an LLM-generated textual summary of the queried records, along with the generated queries themselves.

Scopus AI assists researchers by streamlining the process of finding relevant research, thereby reducing the time needed for literature searches. It enhances the quality and accuracy of identified citations, abstracts, and summaries, ultimately improving the research experience.

EnerGPT is a project designed to improve user productivity by generating answers to questions, thereby minimizing time spent on repetitive tasks. It focuses on streamlining workflows and enhancing efficiency for users.

MAPPRITE is an AI-driven project designed to automate the data mining, ingestion, and indexing of disparate organizational data sources related to safeguards and security (S&S) information. Its implementation aims to enhance EHSS-51 business workflows by making S&S support data easily accessible and searchable for policy subject matter specialists, thereby facilitating informed decision-making and improved policy management. Ultimately, the application will eliminate the need for manual searching, streamlining access to relevant information.

The MI8 Collimators Surrogate Model project aims to develop a machine learning surrogate model for the existing MI8 collimation system to optimize its settings for accelerator operations. The model will provide predictions on the performance of the collimation system based on its settings and beam characteristics, with plans to extend these techniques to other sub-systems and a new MI8 collimation system.

SEPA is utilizing artificial intelligence and machine learning to improve metadata tagging and ensure quality control in the records digitization process. This includes precise metadata assignment that adheres to SEPA's NARA-approved file plan and records schedule.

2_use_case_name: Machine Learning components within Splunk Enterprise Security
x2_summary_text: The project involves integrating machine learning components into Splunk Enterprise Security to facilitate big data analysis and trend identification in large datasets. SLAC aims to utilize these capabilities for data clustering, trend analysis, classification, and regression, leveraging prediction and clustering models to enhance their analytical processes.

CrowdStrike employs machine learning to analyze security events, generating notifications for detections and incidents for the SLAC Cybersecurity team. This integration enhances SLAC's visibility and ability to assess potential security threats effectively.

AskOEDI aims to enhance data accessibility and user-friendliness for the public by utilizing Retrieval-Augmented Generation technology. This system effectively identifies semantically relevant content and uses AI to summarize it for users, providing clear insights within the data catalog.

The Hanford Search project aims to create a unified application that enhances the existing Hanford Search functionality by utilizing AI for improved search results. It enables users to interact using natural language, making queries more intuitive and efficient. The system generates text responses based on user inquiries related to information in the Hanford Search Index.

2_use_case_name: AI Chat Bot for IT User Services
x2_summary_text: The AI Chat Bot for IT User Services is an interactive retrieval-augmented generation model designed to assist users with tier 1 IT issues. It is trained on existing, updated, and new IT resource documentation, providing user-friendly recommendations and instructions based on input from IT administrators. This platform aims to enhance user support by guiding them to the appropriate resources and solutions.

The Hanford Popfon Search is designed to consolidate employee lookup functions into a single, secure application, enhancing user experience by allowing natural language queries. It replaces an older system, providing a cost-effective and safer alternative while delivering text responses that pertain to employee contact and organizational information. This project aims to streamline information retrieval for users.

The project focuses on leveraging generative AI to enhance manual work processes by automating comparisons and decision-making based on established procedures and documents. Humans will retain the role of final validators and approvers, ensuring quality control. This initiative aims to improve both the timeliness and quality of workflows.

The Hanford Ai Liaison tool is designed to offer a secure prompt-to-text interface, allowing users to ask questions and receive generative responses through a trained model. This tool addresses the needs of users who previously relied on external ChatGPT tools by providing a safe environment where prompts and document data remain within an accredited boundary. It utilizes large language modeling techniques to generate text responses based on user input.

The Tritium Accountancy project focuses on enhancing data accuracy and predictive capabilities for tritium management in commercial fusion power systems. It aims to provide real-time tritium data with minimized uncertainty, facilitating adaptive learning for the operation of continuously functioning fusion plants. This framework is designed for comprehensive application across full system operations.

ServiceNow Now Assist enhances the efficiency and quality of service desk transactions by optimizing incident search, resolution processes, and incorporating AI-assisted workflow coding. The project aims to deliver outputs that align with industry standards for commercial service desk products, focusing on the effective search, creation, and closure of service requests.

2_use_case_name: Enhancing ClimRR Capabilities to Better Support Electric Utility Applications and Technical Assistance
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on enhancing the capabilities of ClimRR by integrating CALLM (Climate Action through Large Language Models), which simplifies complex climate projections and scientific literature for electric sector stakeholders. This tool aims to improve communication of climate science, empowering stakeholders to effectively address climate change impacts and enhance climate resilience planning. The AI-generated outputs, based on vetted data and research, provide accessible information, including risk summaries and tailored adaptation strategies, thereby facilitating better-informed decision-making and potential cost savings.

WCD-AI is a project that recommends keyword-based searches to find pertinent Lessons Learned available on DOE OPEXShare. It generates suggested keywords for searching, which are tailored based on the content of user-authored Work Control Documents.

2_use_case_name: OpenText for Records Management (File share auto-classification)
x2_summary_text: The OpenText for Records Management project aims to streamline the classification of legacy records accumulated over the past 20 years. By utilizing OpenText's capabilities, the project will automatically categorize files stored on network drives, significantly reducing the time required for manual classification.

OPQ-AI automates the review process for incoming people registrations by recommending the most likely matches with existing database records, significantly reducing the time required for manual reviews. It provides suggestions for either matching existing records or creating new person records when no match is found. This technology enhances efficiency and accuracy in managing registrations.

The Funding Finder is a tool that compiles Funding Opportunity Announcements (FOAs) from various Department of Energy (DOE) sources. It allows users to ask questions to help identify potential funding opportunities and supports them in the proposal development process. Additionally, it provides answers to inquiries regarding DOE FOAs.

PDF Analyzer is a tool designed for teams within the DOE to upload large PDF documents and interact with them by asking questions and generating content. It provides users with answers to their inquiries while highlighting the relevant sections of the PDF that support those answers.

The Hanford Service Ticket Lookup is designed to streamline customer inquiries by offering a centralized interface for accessing service ticket information without complex navigation. It aims to integrate service tickets from various platforms, allowing users to interact using natural language queries for ease of use. The system generates text responses based on user prompts related to service ticket requests.

The INL AI Virtual Assistant (AiVA) is a chatbot designed to answer questions, coach users on processes, enhance communication, and generate code in multiple formats. Starting in 2025, INL plans to incorporate internal non-CUI data using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) technology, including documents like the employee handbook. The outputs produced by AiVA align with those of commercial chatbot products, such as ChatGPT.

2_use_case_name: Unleashing AI Transformer Models on FPGAs for Accelerating LHC and Particle Physics
x2_summary_text: The project aims to implement AI Transformer models on Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGAs) to enhance particle physics experiments, particularly for the CMS level-1 trigger at the High-Luminosity LHC and real-time magnet quench detection. By integrating advanced AI techniques, it seeks to overcome the limitations of conventional event identification methods. The AI system will serve dual purposes: representation learning for the LHC Trigger and developing multi-modal magnet quench detection algorithms.

The Hanford Procedure Search project aims to enhance the efficiency of employees searching for relevant procedures by providing an AI-driven interface. This system allows users to pose questions in natural language, resulting in more relevant and accurate search results. The tool outputs informative text responses based on user prompts related to the Hanford Procedure System.

The LLM EV project aims to enhance the accessibility of NREL's electric vehicle (EV) data for researchers, thereby accelerating research in this area. It provides analytical results from relevant studies, including findings published in a ScienceDirect article.

AskPRIMR is a project aimed at enhancing public access to data by utilizing Retrieval-Augmented Generation technology. This system identifies semantically relevant content, which is then summarized by an AI language model to make it more user-friendly and comprehensible within the data catalog.

Coupa incorporates AI functionality to enhance search capabilities and improve the efficiency of sourcing and procurement processes. Additionally, the platform utilizes predictive analysis to further streamline operations.

2_use_case_name: GitHub Copilot with the OpenAI Codex
x2_summary_text: GitHub Copilot, powered by OpenAI Codex, enhances productivity for developers by streamlining coding tasks. This enables researchers to concentrate on innovation and speed up the creation of high-quality software solutions for scientific purposes.

First Alert DataMinr AI enhances situational awareness and emergency reporting for the NNSA and DOE Sites by automating incident monitoring and response operations. This AI service reduces the need for a large development team, ultimately resulting in cost savings for the Federal government. It effectively aggregates data and provides insights for more efficient emergency management.

The Yurts AI search function is designed to enhance data accessibility for users at SLAC by efficiently locating relevant information across various data sources. By implementing this technology, SLAC aims to provide data summaries and personalized recommendations, ultimately improving the user experience.

2_use_case_name: Interactive platform to help review and create "Promoting Inclusive and Equitable Research" Plans
x2_summary_text: This interactive platform utilizes a trained AI model to review and enhance "Promoting Inclusive and Equitable Research" (PIER) plans. It provides revision suggestions to ensure accuracy and consistency while aligning with specific PPPL Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Accessibility (DEIA) goals. Additionally, the platform guides users in creating research plans that are cohesive with previously submitted and approved plans.

Energy Wizard enhances the accessibility of NREL data for researchers by employing Retrieval-Augmented Generation technology. This system identifies semantically relevant content and utilizes AI to summarize key information from selected publications and research profiles, thereby facilitating accelerated research efforts.

The LANL AI Portal provides democratized access to open-source Large Language Models (LLMs) aimed at enhancing office productivity and facilitating research in AI, software development, and operational efficiency. It features interactive text chat responses to user prompts, document summaries for Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), and replies to API queries from both enterprise and scientific applications.

The Position Description Tool project aims to streamline the creation of position descriptions, which are essential for hiring federal employees. Requirements for the tool are currently being collected to enhance the efficiency of generating these descriptions. The ultimate goal is to improve the hiring process for federal roles.

ChatGPT Enterprise enhances business productivity and AI model research by providing interactive text chat responses based on user prompts. It allows users to submit open, public, or unrestricted documents for Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) through CustomGPTs, facilitating efficient information retrieval and summarization.

Argo is a tool designed for the Argonne community that utilizes text-based generative AI to provide tailored responses based on Argonne-specific information and sensitive data, including Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI). It enables users to interact with a large language model to generate prediction-based outputs in response to their prompts.

2_use_case_name: AI Chat Bot for Facility Sustainability Practices
x2_summary_text: The project involves developing an AI chat bot that provides guidance on facility sustainability practices, specifically focusing on recycling, composting, and trash disposal. This interactive model aims to reduce confusion around waste disposal practices and enhance the proper recycling of items at PPPL by offering tailored recommendations and instructions based on its training data.

AskGDR is a project aimed at enhancing data accessibility and user-friendliness for the public. It utilizes Retrieval-Augmented Generation to identify semantically relevant content and employs an AI language model to summarize this information for users, effectively describing pertinent material within the data catalog.

The project involves developing a topic modeling system to automate the categorization of 100,000 webpages from Energy.gov. The system will generate a list of five relevant tags for each webpage, significantly reducing the manual effort required for reading and tagging. This approach aims to enhance efficiency in managing the vast amount of online content.

2_use_case_name: In-Situ Monitoring of Additively Manufactured Parts
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on in-situ monitoring of additively manufactured parts to identify print defects during the printing process. It aims to produce layerwise annotated images of defects on the print bed, which can be used for post-print analysis or to prompt corrective actions, potentially preventing material waste.

The Boston Dynamics Spot Robotics project focuses on automating the movements of robotic systems. It involves the development and testing of robots for security and emergency response applications, with an emphasis on optimizing their navigation and decision-making processes to determine the most effective paths for movement.

The project focuses on leveraging Elastic Stack Technology (ELK) to enhance media cataloging for improved data discovery. It utilizes ElasticSearch for efficient content searching and integrates Logstash and Kibana for data processing and visualization. This approach aims to streamline the collection and retrieval of media content.

The Raytheon Multimedia Monitoring System (M3S) facilitates off-cloud transcription of pre-recorded video media to enhance data discoverability. This system utilizes voice-to-text technology to convert spoken content into text format, making it easier to access and analyze video information.

The Cognitive Prescreen Tool (CPT) functions as a recommender for Derivative Classifiers, enhancing document review by improving accuracy and efficiency. It focuses on detecting sensitive information in accordance with Department of Energy classification guidelines, aiming to minimize information loss and reduce the risk of inadvertent disclosure.

2_use_case_name: Machine Learning for Linac Improved Performance
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on improving the performance of the Linac by addressing daily fluctuations in Ion Source conditions and environmental changes that impact beam quality. It employs AI-based optimization techniques, including Bayesian Optimization, to develop real-time RF compensation solutions aimed at stabilizing beam energy and reducing beam loss. The anticipated outcome includes proposed adjustments to RF system parameters to enhance overall accelerator efficiency.

2_use_case_name: Next-Generation Beam Cooling and Control with Optical Stochastic Cooling
x2_summary_text: The project aims to improve the real-time control of circulating particle beams using optical stochastic cooling, enhancing performance and operational flexibility at DOE accelerator facilities. An AI system will continuously assess beam distribution and implement reinforcement learning-based control strategies to optimize beam dynamics. This innovative approach is expected to expand the scientific capabilities of future accelerator technologies.

2_use_case_name: high level synthesis for machine learning (previously hls4ml)
x2_summary_text: High level synthesis for machine learning, formerly known as hls4ml, facilitates the implementation of specialized AI algorithms in embedded hardware to enable real-time processing. This capability enhances scientific discovery and accelerates research timelines, resulting in significant cost savings and increased prestige for the Department of Energy. The technology supports various AI applications, including prediction, data compression, and decision-making control.

The project focuses on developing AI tools for real-time embedded inference in scientific experiments like sPHENIX and the upcoming EIC. These intelligent detectors aim to enhance scientific discovery, reduce time to results, and achieve significant cost savings while elevating the prestige of the Department of Energy (DOE). The AI algorithms span tasks from prediction to data compression and decision-making.

2_use_case_name: In-pixel AI for future tracking detectors
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on integrating AI algorithms directly into tracking detectors' on-board electronics to minimize data size and facilitate high-speed processing. It proposes using AI classifiers to determine data retention and offers rapid inference of track parameters to enhance selection efficiency in data handling.

2_use_case_name: SONIC: AI acceleration as a service
x2_summary_text: SONIC is an AI acceleration service designed to enhance AI workloads on coprocessors for scientific experiments. By improving efficiency in areas such as prediction, data compression, and decision-making, SONIC accelerates scientific discovery and reduces costs, ultimately contributing to the prestige of the Department of Energy (DOE).

2_use_case_name: READS: Real-time Edge AI for Distributed Systems
x2_summary_text: The READS project focuses on implementing real-time Edge AI for distributed systems within particle accelerators. It includes two sub-projects: the first streams live beam loss monitor data to an AI model on an FPGA for real-time identification of beam loss sources, and the second enhances resonant beam extraction regulation using AI to optimize the Spill Duty Factor in the Fermilab Delivery Ring and Mu2e. The outcomes provide insights into beam loss origins and recommendations for improved regulation.

2_use_case_name: Extreme data reduction for the edge
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on developing AI tools for embedded inference in real-time processing systems, specifically designed for scientific experiments. By providing capabilities such as prediction, data compression, and decision-making, these tools aim to enhance scientific discovery, reduce time to science, and ultimately lead to significant cost savings and increased prestige for the Department of Energy (DOE).

2_use_case_name: Machine Learning for Accelerator Operations Using Big Data Analytics / L-CAPE
x2_summary_text: The L-CAPE project utilizes machine learning models for fault detection and labeling in the FNAL Linac, enhancing operational efficiency and preventive maintenance. This system also features a dashboard that displays fault labels, predicts downtime, and suggests possible corrective actions. It is noted as the first global implementation of a machine learning system for accelerator operations.

The Soil Moisture Modeling project aims to forecast soil moisture levels using existing data, eliminating the need for additional monitoring wells. This approach enhances efficient resource management and provides valuable insights for agricultural and environmental applications.

The DOIChatGPT AI Chatbot is a secure chat application designed for DOI users, enabling them to interact with a Large Language Model while maintaining security boundaries. It is a customized implementation of Microsoft's Govchat repository, deployed as an Azure App Service within the internal network, and utilizes Entra authentication, with DOIChatGPT APIM serving as the backend AI service provider.

The DOIChatGPT project involves creating a secure Azure OpenAI instance managed through an Azure API Management layer within the internal network. This setup ensures secure access through subscription keys while enabling cost tracking for various projects. Outputs are currently undocumented, with plans for the DOI to update use cases based on forthcoming data from the submitter.
