x2_summary_text: The project involves leveraging AI to enhance metadata tagging for the CDC's Enterprise Data Catalog, which serves as a centralized inventory of datasets for internal staff. By automating the tagging process, the initiative aims to improve the consistency and completeness of metadata, ultimately increasing the usability of the catalog and enabling staff to more easily discover relevant datasets for their tasks. This approach addresses the previous inefficiencies of manual tagging while standardizing metadata fields.

2_use_case_name: Malaria parasites DNA barcode geography classification
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on using genetic barcoding of malaria parasites to classify their geographic origins, aiding epidemiological investigations into domestically acquired malaria cases in the US. An algorithm is developed to analyze genetic sequences and assign the malaria genotype to specific geographic regions, enhancing the understanding of the strain's entry into the country. This methodology could potentially be adapted to analyze other pathogens if appropriate training datasets are available.

The School Closure Awareness System utilizes AI to efficiently identify unplanned school closures by analyzing publicly available Facebook posts from around 40,000 school or district accounts. This system, which categorizes closures related to various events and monitors status changes, has yielded significant cost savings of nearly 2 million dollars and reduced manual labor by 200 hours compared to previous methods. Regular data validation ensures accuracy and relevancy in capturing closure information.

2_use_case_name: Using Generative AI for Stance Analysis of Public Comments on CDC’s Proposed Rules
x2_summary_text: This project aims to enhance the review process of public comments on CDC's proposed rules by implementing generative AI for stance analysis and topic modeling. By utilizing open-source Python libraries and LLMs, the initiative seeks to organize and analyze a large volume of diverse public feedback efficiently, ultimately saving time for policy experts. This generative AI approach allows for more adaptable stance detection across different rule contexts, improving the accuracy and speed of manual review efforts.

2_use_case_name: A reusable NLP pipeline for clinical narratives preprocessing and characterization
x2_summary_text: This project aims to develop a reusable Natural Language Processing (NLP) pipeline for preprocessing and characterizing clinical narratives from health records. It focuses on cleaning unstructured data formats such as HTML, RTF, and XML, and employing pre-trained Named Entity Recognition (NER) models to efficiently extract signs and symptoms from deidentified electronic health records. The outcome is intended to enhance the identification of novel insights and improve the utility of clinical data for analysis by the CDC.

2_use_case_name: Autocoding to Support Adverse Drug Event Surveillance
x2_summary_text: The project involves developing a model to assist CDC surveillance epidemiologists in evaluating reported adverse drug events from the National Electronic Injury Surveillance System. This model will expedite the coding of drug event reports, enabling quicker production of prevalence estimates for the surveillance system, and will analyze de-identified free-text descriptions of patient encounters to output the likelihood of meeting surveillance criteria.

2_use_case_name: Automating LIMS Bioinformatics Workflow Configuration and Enhancing Lab Quality Management with AI
x2_summary_text: The project aims to automate the configuration of bioinformatics workflows in the Clarity LIMS for the Core Laboratory's Genomics Sequencing Lab, significantly improving the efficiency of tracking and processing Next Generation Sequencing samples. By utilizing a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) framework, the tool converts natural language lab protocols into XML workflows, making customization easier for laboratory scientists and bioinformaticians. Additionally, it serves as an interactive knowledge base to enhance team learning about quality management and regulations, ensuring adherence to best practices.

The DGMH AI Chatbot is designed to generate initial draft responses to inquiries that can be answered using information found on the CDC's website, streamlining the process for staff and allowing them to focus on higher priority tasks. By utilizing Retrieval-Augmentation Generation (RAG), the chatbot will produce relevant and consistent responses while still undergoing the CDC clearance process. This project aims to reduce response turnaround times and improve efficiency in handling inquiries related to CDC-INFO and media.

2_use_case_name: Distiller SR: AI to screen research articles for Community Guide reviews
x2_summary_text: The Distiller SR tool utilizes AI to streamline the screening process for research articles that inform recommendations by the Community Preventive Services Task Force (CPSTF). By employing machine learning, this technology aims to enhance the efficiency and speed of systematic reviews, thereby expediting the evaluation of public health programs for CPSTF recommendations.

2_use_case_name: Evaluating Generative AI for polio containment.
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on evaluating Generative AI tools to enhance polio containment by improving data extraction from scientific publications, thereby identifying poliovirus in areas previously considered polio-free. Additionally, the AI assistant aims to assist HIV researchers by providing efficient data retrieval and generating analytical code, streamlining their research processes. This initiative will broaden the Polio and Picornavirus Branch’s surveillance capabilities and potentially support CDC’s polio containment efforts.

2_use_case_name: Respiratory Virus Response (RVR) Data Analysis Concept
x2_summary_text: The Respiratory Virus Response (RVR) Data Analysis project aims to enhance the efficiency of disseminating essential information by using AI to summarize subject matter expert (SME) interpretations during public health responses. By evaluating the limitations and uncertainties of AI methods, such as bias and hallucinations, this project seeks to improve the understanding and implementation of AI in public health communications. The initial focus will be on generating key takeaways from SME input, with future iterations planned to refine contextualization and response quality.

2_use_case_name: School LLM initial abstract review process
x2_summary_text: The project utilizes a large language model (LLM) to streamline the abstract review process for research related to school readiness science, specifically focusing on school closure outcomes. This AI-driven approach allows for efficient categorization of thousands of abstracts into a user-friendly dashboard, facilitating access to relevant resources from 2012-2022 for health scientists. Future funding could expand this one-time product into a modifiable tool for ongoing article abstraction across various settings and populations.

2_use_case_name: ChatCDC - CDC Enterprise Generative AI Chatbot (Content Editing)
x2_summary_text: ChatCDC is an internal generative AI chatbot designed to assist CDC staff with content editing tasks, such as refining emails, reviewing documents, and correcting formatting errors. By leveraging Azure OpenAI's capabilities, the chatbot provides recommendations for text improvements while ensuring no data security risks arise from uploads. The tool aims to enhance productivity and communication quality among CDC employees, all while adhering to established accuracy and review protocols.

2_use_case_name: ChatCDC - CDC Enterprise Generative AI Chatbot (Data Extraction)
x2_summary_text: ChatCDC is a generative AI chatbot developed for CDC staff to efficiently extract key information from large documents, significantly reducing the time and effort required to find specific data. It operates under existing internal AI guidelines, allowing for tailored policies by individual CDC centers or offices to ensure safe usage. The chatbot utilizes Azure OpenAI large language models to generate relevant responses based on user inquiries, facilitating easier access to important action items and discussions.

2_use_case_name: ChatCDC - CDC Enterprise Generative AI Chatbot (Ideation)
x2_summary_text: ChatCDC is a generative AI chatbot designed for CDC staff to assist with idea development and overcome writer's block by generating responses to user queries. It leverages Azure OpenAI Large Language Models and offers a secure alternative to third-party chatbots, incorporating CDC-specific guidelines to ensure responsible AI use. The chatbot allows staff to organize their thoughts and actions efficiently while providing a platform for exploring and refining their ideas.

2_use_case_name: ChatCDC - CDC Enterprise Generative AI Chatbot (Software Development)
x2_summary_text: ChatCDC is a generative AI chatbot developed for CDC staff to assist in software development and coding tasks, enhancing productivity and efficiency across various roles such as data analysts, software engineers, and scientific researchers. The chatbot, powered by Azure OpenAI, provides coding guidance, serves as a learning tool for novice programmers, and helps streamline complex analytical tasks, ultimately improving agency operations and workflows. It operates within the framework of existing internal AI guidelines, ensuring safe and responsible usage.

2_use_case_name: ChatCDC - CDC Enterprise Generative AI Chatbot (Summarization)
x2_summary_text: ChatCDC is an internal generative AI chatbot designed for CDC staff to efficiently summarize and synthesize information from extensive documents like meeting transcripts and research articles. This tool allows users to create concise summaries while ensuring data security by avoiding uploads to third-party platforms. Utilizing Azure OpenAI Large Language Models, ChatCDC enhances productivity by providing quick, digestible content that staff can easily integrate into their workflows.

2_use_case_name: DCIPHER (SEDRIC) AIP for Advanced Foodborne Outbreak Investigation (AI Summarization)
x2_summary_text: DCIPHER (SEDRIC) is an AI-powered platform designed to enhance the investigation of foodborne disease outbreaks by streamlining data analysis for CDC epidemiologists. By utilizing a centralized data platform, SEDRIC enables faster access to essential information from grocery receipts and other records, significantly reducing the time required for data parsing and enhancing the ability to track common food item names. This improvement allows public health officials to respond more efficiently to outbreaks and informs decision-making through automated summarization of investigation data.

2_use_case_name: DCIPHER (SEDRIC) AIP for Advanced Foodborne Outbreak Investigation (Receipt Reading)
x2_summary_text: DCIPHER (SEDRIC) is an AI solution designed to enhance the investigation of foodborne disease outbreaks by streamlining data processing through the System for Enteric Disease Response, Investigation, and Coordination (SEDRIC). The platform allows CDC epidemiologists to efficiently extract structured data from grocery receipts, shopper card records, and free-text responses, facilitating faster identification of outbreak sources and improving collaboration among agencies. This AI system reduces manual data entry errors, saves time for investigators, and standardizes reporting across involved organizations.

The DFWED Food Vehicle Investigation Module (FVIM) enhances foodborne outbreak investigations by utilizing NLP and text classification tools to identify potential food vehicles and generate hypotheses quickly. By analyzing historical outbreaks with similar demographics and temporal characteristics, FVIM streamlines the response efforts and reduces operational burdens in tracking foodborne illnesses. The module categorizes reported food exposures and compares them statistically to population survey data, improving the accuracy of outbreak identification.

2_use_case_name: Genetic distance computation method for comparing complex multi-locus parasite (Cyclospora) genotypes
x2_summary_text: The project develops an AI-driven method for computing genetic distances among complex multi-locus genotypes of the parasite Cyclospora, facilitating the comparison of infections during epidemiological investigations of cyclosporiasis outbreaks. This method enables the clustering of large datasets, identifying closely related infections and supporting public health efforts in tracking and analyzing outbreaks. While primarily focused on Cyclospora, the approach has also been applied to other parasites like malaria and certain parasitic worms.

2_use_case_name: MedCoder - Coding literal text cause of death information reported on death certificates to ICD-10
x2_summary_text: MedCoder is a subsystem of the CDC's National Vital Statistics System that automates the coding of causes of death on death certificates to ICD-10 codes. It has improved the coding accuracy from 70-75% to over 85%, resulting in significant cost savings and enhancing the timeliness of public health data. By employing natural language processing, MedCoder effectively standardizes cause of death statements, streamlining the coding process and aiding in the identification of urgent health trends.

2_use_case_name: NCIRD SmartFind ChatBots - Public and Internal
x2_summary_text: The NCIRD SmartFind ChatBots project focuses on managing internal email correspondence through the development of an internal Knowledge-Bot and maintaining a knowledge base of cleared FAQs. Public-facing chatbots for flu and COVID-19 vaccinations have been discontinued, but the internal system aids program staff in efficiently handling inquiries from partners by providing agency-approved responses. This initiative leverages Microsoft technologies and tools to enhance communication and information access.

2_use_case_name: NIOSH Industry and Occupation Computerized Coding System (NIOCCS)
x2_summary_text: The NIOSH Industry and Occupation Computerized Coding System (NIOCCS) automates the coding of industry and occupation text into standardized codes, enhancing speed, accuracy, and consistency. By leveraging machine learning models, it reduces the costs associated with manual coding, facilitating improved research and analysis capabilities.

The Nowcasting Injury Trends project aims to develop an internal dashboard that provides real-time estimates of injury rates and associated deaths by integrating various traditional and non-traditional datasets. This initiative utilizes a multi-stage machine learning pipeline to enhance situational awareness and streamline injury surveillance, enabling quicker identification and investigation of emerging injury trends. Ultimately, it seeks to improve the understanding of injury trends and expedite related research activities.

2_use_case_name: Risk Assessment Module (RAM) for the National Diabetes Prevention Program (National DPP) Operations Center.
x2_summary_text: The Risk Assessment Module (RAM) for the National Diabetes Prevention Program (National DPP) is a machine learning tool designed to analyze organization-level data to identify entities at risk of program failure or inactivity. By synthesizing participant enrollment records and risk factors, RAM helps program managers make informed decisions, ultimately aiming to enhance participation and health outcomes for participants. Future plans include granting external State Quality Specialist users access to RAM outputs to further support organizational success.

SANDS is a specialized large language model designed to facilitate the review of open-ended survey responses by identifying and filtering out clear non-responses, thereby reducing the manual workload for researchers. It provides scoring for responses to streamline the curation process, allowing for quicker compilation of high-quality datasets for qualitative research. Developed by the CDC's National Center for Health Statistics, SANDS enhances survey data quality and helps improve questionnaire design using a fine-tuned natural language processing model.

2_use_case_name: Sequential Coverage Algorithm (SCA) and partial Expectation-Maximization (EM) estimation in Record Linkage
x2_summary_text: The CDC's National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) Data Linkage Program has integrated machine learning techniques, specifically the Sequential Coverage Algorithm (SCA) and partial Expectation-Maximization (EM) estimation, to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of their record linkage process. These methods reduce manual processing, automate the development of blocking groups, and enable the program to adaptively refine their algorithms based on new data. As a result, this advancement significantly improves the scalability and scientific value of linked health data for research on various health factors.

2_use_case_name: TowerScout: Automated cooling tower detection from aerial imagery for Legionnaires' Disease outbreak investigation
x2_summary_text: TowerScout is an AI-driven tool designed to automate the detection of cooling towers from aerial imagery, significantly enhancing the efficiency of identifying potential sources of Legionnaires' Disease during outbreaks. By detecting cooling towers approximately 600 times faster than manual methods, it allows the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases (NCIRD) to respond more swiftly and effectively. The system employs advanced object detection and image classification models to streamline the outbreak investigation process.

2_use_case_name: Creation of synthetic Survey-like Insurance Names for use coding NHIS private insurance responses
x2_summary_text: The project aims to create synthetic, survey-like insurance names to streamline the manual coding of private insurance responses in the National Health Interview Survey. By addressing the complexities and inaccuracies of open text fields, this solution could potentially save over 100 staff hours annually, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in determining insurance coverage rates among the US non-institutionalized population. The initiative will integrate AI and Machine Learning to further improve the coding process.

2_use_case_name: Development of in-silico genomic and patient datasets using generative ML algorithms
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on developing in-silico genomic and patient datasets using generative machine learning algorithms, which will streamline the process of finding reference genomes and reduce the development time for custom tools. By utilizing NLP generative AI tools like ChatGPT to generate code for bacterial and viral genomic sequences, the project aims to test the viability and accuracy of the generated datasets against established pipelines while evaluating factors such as code licensing and potential advantages or drawbacks. Ultimately, this solution will facilitate advancements in bioinformatics by providing valuable datasets for testing and development purposes.

2_use_case_name: Mastering Metadata: AI-Powered Governance for Data Insights
x2_summary_text: The "Mastering Metadata" project aims to enhance data quality and governance on the data.cdc.gov platform by utilizing AI to automate the management of the CDC's National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases data. This initiative will ensure that accurate, reliable, and timely public health data is readily available for researchers, policymakers, and the general public, thereby maximizing its impact across diverse audiences. Through automated tasks such as metadata validation and monitoring, the project seeks to significantly improve the magnitude and quality of datasets accessible via the platform.

The project focused on implementing a PII detection system using the Private AI tool to identify personally identifiable information (PII) and protected health information (PHI) in sensitive data sources, enabling broader data sharing. Although the tool performed well in detecting and redacting PII, its licensing expired after a year, and there are no plans to renew it. The effort aims to automate the PII detection process to reduce human review time and facilitate quicker dissemination of essential public health information from the CDC.

2_use_case_name: Reddit Post Analysis for Sexual Health Using Large Language Models
x2_summary_text: The project utilizes large language models to analyze Reddit posts related to sexual health, aiming to understand users' online advice-seeking behavior. By automating data extraction and analysis, the initiative seeks to identify gaps in sexual health resources, highlight underserved populations, and track changes in sexual health behavior over time. This approach not only enhances public health insights but also reduces administrative burdens associated with traditional analysis methods.

The project focuses on enhancing the accessibility and visibility of CCQDER's Q-Bank research publications related to question evaluation for surveys through a Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) approach. By implementing an LLM-based search tool, it aims to streamline the process of finding relevant reports, alleviating administrative tasks like tagging and organizing. The initiative leverages the already publicly available and manageable size of the reports to create a prototype AI tool for improved research navigation.

2_use_case_name: Using generative AI to gain insight of older adult falls
x2_summary_text: This project aims to enhance the extraction of insights related to older adult falls by employing generative AI, transitioning from traditional manual and rule-based methods. By analyzing medical narratives from Emergency Departments using the National Electronic Injury Surveillance System (NEISS) data, the solution seeks to provide a deeper understanding of fall circumstances, which can inform targeted public health interventions.

The AI-assisted comment triaging tool is designed to streamline the review process for the thousands of public comments received during the annual Physician Fee Schedule rulemaking. By utilizing AI technology, the tool aids the PFS team in efficiently identifying and categorizing comments, including recognizing form letters, thereby reducing their workload.

The Bankruptcy BOT is a proactive system designed to identify bankruptcy cases that affect Medicare's debt recoupment efforts. It ensures timely identification of filed provider bankruptcies, enabling Medicare to secure recovery rights before the deadlines for filing claims expire. This initiative enhances the oversight capabilities of the Bankruptcy/Overpayment Division of IFM.

2_use_case_name: Central Data Abstraction Tool-Modernized (Modernized-CDAT)- Intake Process Automation (PA) Tool
x2_summary_text: The Central Data Abstraction Tool-Modernized (Modernized-CDAT) Intake Process Automation (PA) Tool automates and modernizes the medical record review functions in the MA RADV audit process using advanced technologies like NLP, OCR, AI, and ML. This tool eliminates the manual review of medical record submissions, expedites the intake process, and generates cost savings in both time and resources by replacing manual functions for steps 2 and 3 of the RADV audit process. The PA-BOT ensures that the MAO Medical Record submissions meet RADV audit intake requirements before moving on to MR abstraction and coding.

2_use_case_name: CMS Enterprise Portal Services (CMS Enterprise Portal-Chatbot)
x2_summary_text: The CMS Enterprise Portal Services project implements an AI-driven chatbot to enhance process efficiency and knowledge management for users. This automated text-based system reduces the burden on help desks by enabling users to resolve inquiries and troubleshoot issues independently, while also utilizing machine learning to improve the accuracy of responses. Overall, it streamlines customer support processes and provides valuable insights for improving design and functionality.

The Enhanced Direct Enrollment Outlier Detection project aims to ensure the integrity of the Enhanced Direct Enrollment program by using machine learning to identify anomalies and quality issues in data submitted by partners. As partners gain more control over their application processes, this initiative focuses on maintaining a reliable interface between these partners and the FFE APIs. Overall, the project enhances data quality and safeguards the enrollment process.

The Exchange Complaints Review Categorization project utilizes machine learning and artificial intelligence to automate the categorization of consumer complaints received by the ECRC from the FFE call center. This technology expedites the process from weeks to minutes, enabling faster routing of complaints to the appropriate CMS caseworker or Issuer for resolution. The system is trained continuously on thousands of complaints to improve its accuracy in categorization.

The Feedback Analysis Solution (FAS) is a system that leverages Natural Language Processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) tools to analyze public comments and stakeholder feedback from various sources, including CMS and Regulations.Gov. By aggregating and sorting data, FAS creates efficiencies in the review process while identifying key topics, themes, and sentiments that influence program and policy decisions. Different groups within CCSQ utilize FAS to process unstructured data, ensuring effective interpretation and structuring for further analysis.

The IT System Utilization Optimization project aims to improve the FFE application's performance by automating resource scaling through Machine Learning. This will enable the system to adapt to varying usage patterns more efficiently, eliminating the need for manual scaling and ensuring immediate responsiveness to changes in system volume.

The Knowledge Management Platform enhances data-driven decision-making by efficiently accessing and utilizing both structured and unstructured data sources. It employs advanced technologies like natural language processing and knowledge graphs to simplify knowledge accessibility, ultimately supporting CMS's mission and improving return on investment.

The Risk Adjustment Outlier Analysis project aims to maintain the integrity of the Risk Adjustment (RA) program by utilizing Machine Learning to identify outliers in issuer data and behavior that could adversely affect risk adjustment payments. The project focuses on managing financial risk for issuers by ensuring that RA payments are accurately calculated based on population risk levels. By monitoring and analyzing data patterns, this initiative seeks to prevent undue influence on annual calculations.

The Agent/Broker Fraud Analysis project aims to enhance the oversight and integrity of Marketplace applications and enrollments facilitated by Agents and Brokers by leveraging machine learning to detect suspicious behaviors. This initiative assists CCIIO in identifying potential fraud, allowing for referrals to the Consumer Protection Initiative (CPI). Ultimately, the project seeks to safeguard the consumer enrollment process in the Marketplace.

CCSQ ServiceNow AI Search enhances the search capabilities within ServiceNow by replacing the traditional Zing search tool with a more versatile and relevant search function. It promotes self-service by allowing users to find information independently, potentially reducing the number of support cases. The AI Search includes features like result prioritization, synonym support, auto-corrections, and analytics to improve overall search experiences.

The MSP Assignment Bot automates the retrieval of records from a contractor's system and imports them into an internal OPOLE Access database for review by staff. This automation increases efficiency by allowing the bot to pull and assign cases from BCRC faster than human analysts, thereby maximizing the time available for staff to process cases and reducing response times. The Medicare Secondary Payer Operations Group (MSPOG) utilizes this bot for handling compromise cases within their Management Information System (MIS).

2_use_case_name: Relationships, Events, Contacts, and Outreach Network (RECON)
x2_summary_text: The Relationships, Events, Contacts, and Outreach Network (RECON) project utilizes AI for recommender systems and sentiment analysis, allowing for faster data analysis. Currently, it relies on native Salesforce AI capabilities, which are not being fully utilized within the RECON framework.

The Complaint Analysis POC utilizes data science techniques and a language model to analyze complaint data for the OPOLE team. This AI solution aims to identify key issues and root causes of complaints, enabling the team to address them more efficiently and effectively.

CMS is modernizing its Load-Extract-Transform-Load (L-ETL) pipelines by building a Security Data Lake to facilitate future machine learning model development. This initiative aims to enhance agency security by centralizing system, telemetry, and program data under a unified governance model. The groundwork laid in this project will enable decision-making based on inferences from time series data within the next 1-2 years.

The FOIA Document Review/Redaction Automation project is a collaboration between OIT and OSORA aimed at streamlining the internal review and redaction process for CMS business documents subject to FOIA requests. By employing GenAI technology, the project automates the review and redaction tasks, significantly reducing the manual workload for FOIA staff.

The Division of Issuer Management and Operations plans to collaborate with their contractor, LMI, to implement an AI tool for the Help Desk contract. This AI feature will streamline the process of generating responses to frequently asked questions from issuers and external organizations, ultimately reducing the time staff contractors spend on creating answers for review and approval.

The project focuses on automating the review and correction of 508 accessibility issues in documents for individual CMS employees. By leveraging GenAI technology, it significantly reduces the burden of ensuring compliance with 508 accessibility rules, streamlining the document correction process.

The project aims to analyze the market share trends between brand and generic drugs within the context of Medicare Part D to enhance financial forecasting accuracy. By examining the shift of beneficiaries from brand to generic medications, the Drug Data Processing System (DDPS) will provide insights to predict changes in related costs. Forecasting future market shares based on Part D claims volume will help optimize financial estimates.

The Chat Client - Resource Library project aims to enhance the user experience by streamlining access to information within the QPP's Resource and Webinar Libraries. Utilizing Amazon Bedrock, the Chat Client will create a comprehensive knowledge base that allows users to receive accurate, multilingual responses to their inquiries by scanning existing program documentation. Continuous assessment and refinement of the content will ensure the site's effectiveness as it evolves.

The project aims to develop a chatbot within Hub to automate various help support activities currently managed by personnel, such as answering personalized FAQs, clarifying onboarding questions, and handling inquiries about file or request statuses. The chatbot will access an internal knowledge base, enable interaction with a live agent, and offer features like a chat and talk interface, along with the ability to query custom data sources. This initiative is designed to enhance support efficiency and improve communication with external partners.

The Drug Cost Anomaly Detection project focuses on monitoring Prescription Drug Event (PDE) data to identify outliers and inaccuracies. It allows the CMS Division of Payment Reconciliation to correct these anomalies through outreach to Part D plans, ultimately preventing overpayments related to drug costs. The initiative enhances the integrity of Part D claims by highlighting and addressing discrepancies in drug pricing.

The Drug Data Processing System (DDPS) is developing a machine learning model to forecast changes in Medicare Part D costs by analyzing historical drug cost increases and current market conditions. This predictive system aims to enhance decision-making regarding drug pricing and budget forecasting for Medicare Part D.

2_use_case_name: Medicare Part C/D Marketing Material Review
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on improving the review process of Medicare Part C/D marketing materials, which are currently time-consuming and resource-intensive for the Drug and Health Plan Operations (DHPO) staff. By integrating AI into the review process, the project aims to enhance efficiency and quality, while ensuring compliance with Medicare Marketing Guidelines and reducing marketing misrepresentation complaints. A proof of concept for the AI tool is still in development, with the goal of allowing the AI to learn the requirements for marketing materials effectively.

2_use_case_name: Medicare Part C/D Plan Oversight of AI Used for Prior Authorization and Utilization Management
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on overseeing the use of AI in Medicare Part C/D plans to ensure beneficiaries access benefits, services, and prescriptions effectively. It aims to analyze extensive data sets to identify compliance issues and outliers in claims and payments, while also assessing the impact of AI on beneficiary health outcomes. By refining AI results with subject matter expertise, the project seeks to uphold the integrity of the Medicare program.

The project focuses on assisting in the negotiation of drug prices for select high-expenditure, single-source Medicare Part B or Part D drugs as authorized by the Inflation Reduction Act. It involves utilizing historical drug data to forecast costs and claim volumes for the drugs chosen for negotiation by the Secretary.

The QPP Admin Bot enhances reporting and analysis by addressing the analytics needs in the QPP cycle, including providing feedback to providers and calculating scores. Utilizing Amazon Bedrock, it ensures easy access to data from QPP's Universal Data Set, empowering users to make informed decisions through a user-friendly communication platform.

The Operational Efficiency Analytics project aims to enhance the appeals adjudication process for Marketplace consumers through predictive analytics. This involves identifying operational trends, forecasting the volume of appeals during open enrollment, and analyzing regional or demographic factors affecting appeal complexity and outcomes. The project also includes developing a model using data from the future Eligibility Appeals Case Management System (EACMS) to support these predictive capabilities.

The ICPG Governance Tool is designed to automate the processing and analysis of acquisition plans, classifying them as IT-related or non-IT. By streamlining the manual steps currently involved in validation and classification, it will significantly reduce time and effort required for these tasks.

2_use_case_name: Innovation Center Investment Proposal (ICIP) Model Analysis POC
x2_summary_text: The Innovation Center Investment Proposal (ICIP) Model Analysis Proof of Concept (POC) focuses on enhancing the process of analyzing ICIP documents. By utilizing a RAG-based architecture, the project aims to extract relevant insights and recommendations, which will be presented through a user-friendly natural language interface for easier access and interaction.

The OAGM Rate Card project aims to analyze historical price trends for labor categories in business proposals to improve decision-making on future contracts. By providing a standardized view of historical price data, it will help normalize labor categories and enable the OAGM team to identify relevant labor categories despite naming variations.

CCSQ Now Assist for CSM is a ServiceNow product that integrates generative AI with Customer Service Management to enhance agent productivity and efficiency. By utilizing the ServiceNow native Large Language Model, it provides tools such as case and chat summarization, as well as auto-generated resolution notes, enabling agents to respond more swiftly and effectively to customer inquiries.

The AI Workspace project facilitates AI experimentation by offering a safe and secure environment that reduces barriers and supports strategic AI infrastructure. It provides teams with hands-on experience to understand the risks and benefits of AI, utilizing data science tools and approved AWS services like Sage Maker and Bedrock for prototype development.

2_use_case_name: Citation Analysis and Survey Assistant (CASA - Nursing Home Survey CMS 2567)
x2_summary_text: The Citation Analysis and Survey Assistant (CASA) enhances the monitoring and review of nursing home surveys in the U.S. by utilizing advanced natural language processing and machine learning to analyze deficiencies reported on CMS Form 2567. This system enables real-time interaction with survey data, allowing the Quality, Safety, and Oversight Group to identify discrepancies and follow up on citation cases, ultimately supporting CMS’s mission to maintain high standards of care in nursing homes.

2_use_case_name: Hazards & Threats Awareness Data Processing Automation
x2_summary_text: The Hazards & Threats Awareness Data Processing Automation project aims to enhance the efficiency of situation report generation for EPRO by automating the processing of open web and email materials. The implementation of an AI system will reduce the manual processing time from 2-3 hours per day to approximately 30 minutes by scraping relevant websites, monitoring resource mailboxes, and summarizing significant events. This automation will facilitate faster delivery of actionable insights to decision-makers across the agency.

2_use_case_name: Independent Dispute Resolution (IDR) Eligibility Rules Engine
x2_summary_text: The Independent Dispute Resolution (IDR) Eligibility Rules Engine project aims to automate the manual and time-consuming IDR Technical Assistance process, thereby increasing throughput and consistency in the workflow. By using artificial intelligence models, the tool will streamline the eligibility review process by quickly identifying and storing essential data points from documentation, leading to more efficient and predictable analyst reviews.

2_use_case_name: Medicare Fee for Service Requirements Modernization (MFRM)
x2_summary_text: The Medicare Fee for Service Requirements Modernization (MFRM) project utilizes AI LLMs to parse, curate, and simplify Medicare coverage and coding requirements by medical condition. The project aims to enhance operational efficiencies for CMS and healthcare providers by organizing guidance documents and identifying complexities for further resolution. Rigorous testing will ensure the accuracy of the AI-generated outputs before integration into the MFRM application.

The Division of Issuer Management and Operations is evaluating the use of an AI tool by contractor AIR to analyze comments in the Letter to Issuers (LTI) and Notice of Benefits and Payment Parameters (NBPP). This implementation aims to streamline the review process, potentially reducing the time and resources required by 25%, while also identifying trends in stakeholder responses regarding CMS policy and operational issues.

The project focuses on enhancing data quality checks to improve consumer experience by implementing an asynchronous solution that offers near real-time feedback and reduces return cycle time without necessitating UI changes. Additionally, a proof of concept classifier model will be developed to identify incorrect document uploads and low-quality images using optical character recognition (OCR) technology.

The project focuses on developing a Certification Recommendation Model that leverages natural language processing (NLP) and classification techniques to analyze trends and patterns in plan certification justification templates. The goal is to create a supervised machine learning model based on historical data to enhance the efficiency of the plan certification review process and provide recommendations to the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS).

The AI-Assisted Data Entry project aims to enhance the efficiency of data entry by utilizing AI technology to convert paper forms into digital datasets. This process reduces human error and streamlines the overall data intake workflow.

This project focuses on providing transcription services for meetings conducted on Zoom and Teams. It enables live transcription during meetings or generates transcripts from recorded sessions, thereby enhancing communication among participants. The end product is a text document that captures the spoken content of the meetings.

The Email Prioritization project for Outlook in the Office365 suite enables users to categorize incoming emails according to their own criteria. This functionality assists users in managing their inbox more efficiently by providing categorized emails as the output.

The AI-assisted Pattern Detection project utilizes AI technologies to analyze system logs and identify unusual patterns that indicate potential issues. This integration generates alerts and reports that inform human operators of the detected anomalies, facilitating timely intervention.

2_use_case_name: Report Summarization by commercial GenAI platform
x2_summary_text: Commercial GenAI platforms like ChatGPT and Google Gemini can summarize documents containing non-sensitive information. These platforms generate concise summaries based on the content of provided paragraphs or documents.

The project focuses on utilizing AI-assisted techniques in Google's search engine to enhance the efficiency of processing search requests. The result is the delivery of relevant search results to users.

Document Digitization by Adobe Pro utilizes advanced technology to convert scanned documents into digital format. The resulting output is searchable digital data, enhancing accessibility and usability.

The autocorrect feature in MS Word leverages AI to enhance the quality of written communications by suggesting corrections. This results in improved accuracy in the output of words and sentences in written documents.

The AI-assisted real-time collaboration tool leverages natural language processing (NLP) to analyze inputs from team members and deliver real-time statistics. It generates outputs that include summaries and statistical data derived from the contributions of multiple users, facilitating enhanced team collaboration.

The project focuses on enhancing presentation design using MS PowerPoint by offering multiple visually appealing design suggestions based on the content provided. Users can choose from these curated design options to improve the aesthetics of their presentations.

2_use_case_name: Data modeling and visualization by MS Excel
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on utilizing MS Excel's data analysis toolkits for data modeling and visualization. It leverages AI-powered features to enhance data understanding and presentation, yielding machine learning models and statistical analyses accompanied by visual representations.

2_use_case_name: News from commercial publisher such as Google News
x2_summary_text: Major news publishers like Google News curate news articles based on users' preferences and their recent browsing history. This results in more personalized news feeds tailored to individual interests.

2_use_case_name: Travel Route Optimization by Google Maps and Apple Maps
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on the travel route optimization capabilities of Google Maps and Apple Maps, utilizing algorithms and live traffic data to enhance travel efficiency. It aims to provide users with tailored, optimal routes that save time based on their preferences and real-time conditions.

The AI-Powered Travel Booking project utilizes algorithms to analyze customer preferences and optimize travel accommodations on major booking websites like hotels.com. This process streamlines the search for travel options, saving time and potentially offering better deals. Ultimately, the service generates a curated list of accommodations for customers to select from and book.

The Face ID feature in iPhones utilizes AI technology to enable secure unlocking through facial recognition. This advanced feature enhances user security by allowing access to the device solely with the owner's face.

2_use_case_name: AI to Improve Public Access to the Administrative Appeals Process
x2_summary_text: The project aims to implement an AI-powered chatbot on the DAB's website to enhance public access to the administrative appeals process by helping appellants identify the appropriate division for their appeal. This will streamline the adjudication process, improve customer experience, and assist diverse populations, including the deaf and hard-of-hearing as well as individuals with limited English proficiency, without the need for intermediaries. By providing instant and accurate filing information and facilitating direct e-file connections, the chatbot will increase the DAB's productivity and optimize resource allocation.

The AI Use Policy Tool is developed to enhance the quality review process of DAB decisions, ensuring compliance with standards and protecting sensitive information. It facilitates faster identification of data trends requiring further analysis and ensures that DAB decisions align with the prohibition on the use of generative AI. This tool aims to reinforce public confidence in the integrity and legality of DAB determinations.

2_use_case_name: Resources to Assist the Advisory Board In Identifying AI Tools for Use In An Adjudication Environment
x2_summary_text: The project aims to assist the Advisory Board in identifying AI tools that can enhance the adjudication process by analyzing large datasets efficiently. By utilizing AI and machine learning, the Board seeks to identify trends and streamline case processing, decision issuance, and quality review, ultimately improving the Agency's operational effectiveness.

2_use_case_name: 356H ML Facility Supply Chain Role Classification
x2_summary_text: The 356H ML Facility Supply Chain Role Classification project automates the extraction of supply chain roles from unstructured text submissions related to facilities. By improving the efficiency of evaluating these submissions, it reduces processing time and provides data stewards with a streamlined interface for verifying and determining the identified roles.

2_use_case_name: AI Tool for Risk-based FAR Review & Decision Support
x2_summary_text: The AI Tool for Risk-based FAR Review & Decision Support enhances the Field Alert Report review process by delivering risk-based intelligence and insights, incorporating a Human-in-the-Loop approach. It streamlines reviews by summarizing risk profiles and utilizing machine learning to classify FAR risks into low, medium, and high categories, while highlighting problem clusters, rare events, and source variables.

The Analytics-Driven Supplement Evaluation (ASE) project utilizes AI to enhance the triage and staff assignment process for reviewing post-market Change Being Effected (CBE) supplement submissions. By employing a Convolutional Neural Network alongside a rules-based approach, the AI system effectively summarizes submitted information to assist reviewers in making informed decisions on CBE 30/0 supplemental submissions.

2_use_case_name: Augmenting death and cause of death ascertainment in observational data sources
x2_summary_text: The project aims to enhance the assessment of mortality in electronic health records by employing Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques to extract and improve the quality of mortality data, including the date and cause of death. This augmentation supports research efforts within the Sentinel system to develop probabilistic estimates for causes of death, thereby enhancing the reliability of mortality as a study endpoint.

CLAT (Computerized Labeling Assessment Tool) enhances the manual review of drug labeling through the use of computer programming, image processing, and AI. It helps identify labeling deviations by comparing drug labels against FDA regulations, guidances, and standards, ultimately improving efficiency and reducing the risk of medication errors in the labeling process. By automating the detection of issues such as missing information and color differentiation, CLAT supports standardized labeling across various drug types.

2_use_case_name: Empirical evaluation of EHR-based signal detection approaches
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on enhancing Electronic Health Record (EHR) signal detection through Natural Language Processing (NLP) and advanced tree-based scan statistic (TBSS) methods. By extracting data from unstructured clinical notes, it aims to improve the identification of health outcomes and streamline the manual detection process.

The FAR-based Facility Signal Detection Tool objectively identifies problem clusters associated with flagged signals. This identification aids in the triage and review process, enabling targeted actions and potential CMS inspection activities when necessary.

The MedWatch Dashboard is designed to enhance the monitoring and identification of product risks by analyzing MedWatch reporting patterns and content. It facilitates efficient and objective risk-based assessments of product quality and utilizes time series analysis and topic modeling to flag potential risks and summarize relevant comments for review staff.

The Quality Surveillance Dashboard (QSD) analyzes unstructured text from documents and integrates it with existing data to create a comprehensive dashboard for assessing CDER regulated manufacturing facilities. It facilitates efficient, objective, and risk-based evaluations by identifying and presenting relevant keywords and phrases in context.

2_use_case_name: Scalable automated NLP-assisted chart abstraction and feature extraction tool
x2_summary_text: This project focuses on developing a scalable automated tool for chart abstraction and feature extraction using natural language processing (NLP) to enhance the usability of electronic medical records in pharmacoepidemiology studies. Through a case study examining montelukast use among asthma patients and associated neuropsychiatric events, the project aims to implement a comprehensive approach for accurately identifying outcomes and covariates from unstructured EHR data. The tool will facilitate large-scale data analysis by leveraging advanced analytic methods to extract relevant health information efficiently.

The project aims to extract Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Controls (CMC) changes from unstructured annual report submissions to create a comprehensive repository for further analysis. The extracted data is visualized in a dashboard, facilitating downstream human analysis and supporting information extraction from unstructured documents.

The project focuses on extracting references to Drug Master Files (DMFs) from marketing application submissions, both structured and unstructured. It involves parsing content from various forms such as the 356H form and eCTD modules to identify and present DMF references in a structured format for analysis. The extracted data, displayed on a dashboard, aims to create a comprehensive inventory of application to DMF references, assisting the Office of Pharmaceutical Quality (OPQ) in reviewing applications that previously lacked these references.

2_use_case_name: Artificial Intelligence-based Deduplication Algorithm for Classification of Duplicate Reports in the FDA Adverse Event Reports (FAERS)
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on developing an artificial intelligence-based deduplication algorithm to efficiently identify and remove duplicate reports in the FDA Adverse Event Reporting System (FAERS). It utilizes natural language processing to extract relevant clinical features from unstructured text narratives, integrating this information with structured data for enhanced duplicate identification. The optimized algorithm processes both historical and incoming submissions to streamline data mining analytics.

2_use_case_name: Development of automation tools and data warehouse to facilitate BE assessments
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on developing automation tools and a data warehouse to streamline the bioequivalence assessment process for Abbreviated New Drug Application (ANDA) submissions. By reducing manual data entry efforts, the tools will prepare, format, and export pharmacokinetic data for analysis, enabling reviewers to efficiently conduct evaluations using pre-written SAS codes while generating draft documents alongside firm-submitted eCTD tables. This initiative aims to enhance data collection and information retrieval without impacting the reviewer's evaluative responsibilities.

The DMF Facilities project focuses on extracting facility references and supply chain roles from Type II Drug Master File submissions, which may contain both structured and unstructured documents. The parsed data is organized into a structured format for analysis, helping OPQ identify discrepancies between facilities reported in marketing applications and those disclosed in DMFs. The end goal is to create a comprehensive inventory of facilities linked to DMF submissions and their corresponding applications, supported by a user-friendly dashboard for further analysis.

The Four Part Harmony Identification project aims to enhance the accuracy of language in deficiency reports submitted by staff. By streamlining this process, the project will decrease verification time and alleviate staff workload, ensuring compliance with MDUFA requirements.

2_use_case_name: Information Visualization Platform (InfoViP) to Support Analysis of adverse event reports
x2_summary_text: The Information Visualization Platform (InfoViP) enhances post-market surveillance by utilizing AI to prioritize and analyze adverse event reports. It employs Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) algorithms to extract relevant data from unstructured narratives and integrate it with structured data, thereby improving the efficiency of preparing and analyzing such reports. This tool also facilitates case series analyses, data visualization, and classifications based on information quality.

The project aims to enhance the efficiency of Vaccine Adverse Events Reporting System (VAERS) analyses by utilizing a large language model (LLM) to generate customized query outputs. It focuses on building the capacity to enable reviewers to perform ad-hoc VAERS queries effectively.

2_use_case_name: Pharmacovigilance machine learning to detect excess safety signal
x2_summary_text: The project utilizes machine learning algorithms to enhance pharmacovigilance by detecting excess safety signals in post-market adverse event reporting. The technology aids the FDA in identifying rare adverse events that manual reviews might overlook, generating potential safety signals for further investigation through statistical analysis.

The objective of Module 3 Facilities was to identify and extract information about drug manufacturing facilities from unstructured data in marketing application submissions. This process aimed to create a comprehensive inventory of drug facilities, with the extracted data visualized in a dashboard for further human analysis. The project facilitates information extraction from unstructured documents.

2_use_case_name: OPPQ Policy Bot (AKA Policy and Guidance Documents Search)
x2_summary_text: The OPPQ Policy Bot is an AI-enabled tool designed to assist policy staff in efficiently searching through regulations and guidance documents. By enabling quick identification and querying of previously published policy materials, it ensures consistency in policy development and response to inquiries, while providing links to relevant documents for further human review.

The project focuses on extracting data from unstructured sources to create an inventory of drug packaging materials and their suppliers, aiding staff in drug supply chain analysis. The gathered information will be displayed on a dashboard for further analysis. This initiative enhances the efficiency of information extraction from unstructured documents.

2_use_case_name: Process Large Amount of Submitted Docket Comments
x2_summary_text: The project involves the development of an AI/ML tool within CBER/HIVE that streamlines the downloading and processing of large volumes of docket comments, thereby enhancing the efficiency and accuracy of regulatory reviews. Additionally, it generates customized outputs for VAERS queries to facilitate the work of reviewers.

The project involves analyzing unstructured industry submissions to identify indicators of Real World Data/Evidence (RWD/E) for congressional reporting. Extracted data will be presented in a dashboard to facilitate further human analysis, including tagging documents that contain relevant RWD and RWE.

The project involves extracting Regulatory Starting Materials (RSMs) and their suppliers from unstructured industry submissions in Module 3 to build an inventory that reveals the upstream supply chain. The data extracted is then displayed in a dashboard for further analysis, facilitating information extraction from unstructured documents.

The Resource Capacity Planning project aims to enhance the forecasting of human drug review program submissions and the associated FDA workload. By improving these forecasts, the project intends to optimize fee revenue and adjust fees to adequately fund the necessary resources for managing the expected workload. This initiative focuses on predicting workload submissions across major user fee programs to support informed fee-setting for human drug review programs.

The Supply Chain Resilience Program focuses on forecasting demand for medical devices and supplies across various scenarios, including natural disasters and public health emergencies. This program enhances the ability to predict the necessary quantities of critical devices, ensuring better preparedness and response in times of crisis.

The AI Audit Resolution Assistant (AIARA) aims to streamline the Single audit resolution process for HRSA auditors, which have surged due to COVID-19 funding. By incorporating generative AI and a vector database of Single audit documents, AIARA will enhance the efficiency of audit reviews and the creation of Management Decision Letters, ultimately allowing auditors to handle more cases effectively. Success will be gauged by the increased number of audits processed by each auditor, facilitated by improved technological capabilities and reduced cognitive load through chatbot support.

The Knowledge Navigator project aims to develop an AI model that answers complex questions regarding the Application and Program Guidance (APG) for loan repayment and scholarship programs. This proof of concept generative AI large language model will assist analysts and call center agents in providing accurate information to applicants, potentially reducing call volume and the need for a large call center staff. If successful, the Knowledge Navigator could be extended to directly serve applicants and participants.

The Policy Assistant (PA) is a Generative AI tool developed by HRSA to efficiently create first drafts of essential policy documents such as APGs, NOFOs, and budget documents. By utilizing large language models and advanced editing features, PA aims to streamline the drafting process, reduce time spent on document creation, and enhance the quality of the final outputs through critical analysis and refinement. The project incorporates cloud-based services and natural language generation technologies to improve the overall policy-making workflow.

Scholar Match (SM) is an AI-driven platform designed to improve the evaluation and placement process of National Health Service Corps (NHSC) and Nurse Corps scholars in underserved communities across the U.S. By utilizing machine learning, recommendation systems, and data analytics, SM optimizes candidate placements to meet both organizational needs and candidate satisfaction. This innovative approach aims to enhance resource allocation and workforce efficiency in critical health areas.

Scholarship Insight is a project aimed at enhancing the evaluation process of scholarship essays for the NHSC and Nurse Corps programs by developing a Generative AI program to assist human reviewers. This AI will analyze previous essays and scoring rubrics to conduct an initial assessment, improving both fairness and efficiency in the application process. The system will provide detailed insights into essay strengths and weaknesses while ensuring that human graders adhere to appropriate scoring standards through a combination of advanced technologies.

The Site Application Analysis (SA) project aims to enhance the review process for NHSC, STAR, and Nurse Corps Site Applications by integrating AI and machine learning technologies. This initiative will streamline the evaluation of complex documents, enabling faster and more accurate reviews while freeing BHW Regional Analysts to concentrate on more strategic tasks. The implementation will utilize cloud-based services, recommendation systems, natural language understanding, and text analysis.

2_use_case_name: A Cluster-Based Machine Learning Approach for Evaluating Factors Associated with Plasma Neurodegenerative Biomarkers
x2_summary_text: The project aimed to enhance the prediction of incident dementia by integrating health-related risk factors with plasma neurodegenerative biomarkers in a diverse population. Utilizing data from the Age, Gene/Environment Susceptibility – Reykjavik Study over a 20-year follow-up, it analyzed approximately 450 common health-related factors alongside relevant biomarkers of neurodegeneration and inflammation. The AI use case is now retired and no longer active.

The AccessGUDID Data Validation project utilizes an AI system designed to enhance data quality assurance for medical device metrics by detecting anomalies in both structured and unstructured data. By identifying issues such as inconsistent units of measurement and unusual device dimensions, the AI flags potential problems for human review without directly altering the data. This integration within the FDA's workflow aims to streamline the data validation process, reduce manual effort, and improve the integrity of the AccessGUDID database, ultimately fostering better decision-making and enhancing public health and safety regarding medical devices.

2_use_case_name: AI Solution for Image Duplication Detection
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on developing an AI solution for detecting image duplications in microscopic images generated by NIA researchers. With each publication producing 100 to 200 TIFF files, the manual verification process currently in use is inefficient and error-prone, necessitating an automated system to enhance research quality and credibility. This AI solution aims to streamline the identification of duplicate images across multiple publications.

2_use_case_name: AI Solution for Research Funding Gap Analysis (RF-GAP)
x2_summary_text: The AI Solution for Research Funding Gap Analysis (RF-GAP) aims to identify and address funding and publication gaps in NIH-funded research using text-mining and artificial intelligence techniques. By analyzing data from NIH and external sources, NIA will improve funding allocation, provide insights into research trends, and equip program officers with customized dashboards for efficient monitoring of research portfolios. This initiative seeks to enhance decision-making, refine funding strategies, and maximize the impact of NIH-funded research.

2_use_case_name: AI/ML for Study Section Prediction in NICHD
x2_summary_text: The AI/ML for Study Section Prediction project aims to classify NIH grant applications into appropriate Study Sections within the NICHD's Scientific Review Branch. Utilizing human-in-the-loop development, it allows for human evaluation and modification of model outputs, enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of grant application alignment. The project leverages data from the NIH IMPAC II system and aims to improve the review process, thereby furthering NIH's mission in scientific discovery and health advancement.

2_use_case_name: AI-enabled landscape analysis of New Approach Methodologies (NAMs) in biomedical research literature
x2_summary_text: The project employs AI-enabled landscape analysis to evaluate New Approach Methodologies (NAMs) in biomedical research, aiding the NIH Common Fund's strategic planning for resource investment. By utilizing generative AI for literature searching and extraction, the study identifies trends, gaps, and opportunities related to NAMs, with methods applicable to other systematic literature reviews.

The Applying for Grants Chat Bot is designed to assist prospective grantees by providing instant and comprehensive information about various grants, including eligibility, deadlines, and documentation requirements. It guides users through the application process, recommends grant writing resources, and helps track application status while addressing common questions. Overall, the chatbot simplifies and enhances the grant application experience, making it more efficient for users seeking funding.

The project focuses on using the DEXTR automated extraction tool to identify and capture research citations related to the Division of Translational Toxicology (DTT) and the National Toxicology Program (NTP). By utilizing accessible published literature and an evidence-based approach, it aims to assess the impact and effectiveness of DTT and NTP research, which is valuable for prioritizing future research efforts. The system is FEDRAMP certified and ensures data privacy by not using personal or demographic information.

The Assisted Referral Tool (ART) helps assign appropriate scientific areas for grant applications by recommending relevant study sections based on the application's scientific content. Users input their application text and receive a list of "Strong" and "Possible" study section matches without any data being stored or persisted. The tool is designed solely to benefit users in the review process.

2_use_case_name: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) Classification Model for Children using Deep Neural Network
x2_summary_text: The Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) Classification Model aimed to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of diagnosing ASD in children around the age of 10 using a deep neural network trained on Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) hand tracking data. By processing four 3-dimensional vectors obtained during cognitive and motor tasks, the model provided a binary classification output indicating whether a child exhibited signs of ASD or typical development. This AI use case has since been retired and is no longer in use.

2_use_case_name: Automated annotation of study data using knowledge organization systems
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on automating the annotation of study data in environmental health research using knowledge organization systems. This automation aims to facilitate the systematic review processes and enhance the integration of extracted information with other structured datasets, thereby supporting predictive model development and improving analyses of chemical effects on biological systems.

The Division of Translational Toxicology (DTT) at NIEHS is focused on enhancing public health through innovative data and knowledge development. The project aims to create automated, model-based processes for extracting data from published tables, thereby saving time and effort for teams involved in evaluating studies, such as epidemiology reviews and hazard assessments, ultimately improving health effect conclusions.

2_use_case_name: Automated Basic-Applied Categorization of extramural grants
x2_summary_text: The project involves the development of a machine-learning algorithm to categorize NIMH-funded extramural research projects as basic or applied research. The algorithm uses data from past grant applications and will suggest categorizations for new grants, which can be reviewed and edited by NIMH staff. The categorization will be used for internal analysis and annual reporting, without influencing funding decisions or utilizing personally identifiable information.

2_use_case_name: Automated extraction of study methods and assessment of reliability
x2_summary_text: This project aims to automate the extraction and evaluation of study methods from environmental health research to enhance the systematic review process and assess the quality of published studies. Using both supervised and unsupervised methods, it focuses on identifying studies with reliable methods that adhere to regulatory guidelines, reducing the time and effort required for manual assessment. The outcomes will support evidence-based conclusions and inform future research and policy decisions.

2_use_case_name: Automation of Receipt & Referral Process of NIDDK grant applications
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on automating the receipt and referral process for NIDDK grant applications, which currently involves a labor-intensive manual review of 100 to 500 applications each week. By implementing AI and Natural Language Processing tools, the automation aims to efficiently stratify applications according to specific business rules, significantly reducing the time required for program and referral staff by over 3000 hours annually. The system will provide real-time tracking and recommendations for program class codes, thereby enhancing the referral process.

2_use_case_name: Best Match: New relevance search for PubMed
x2_summary_text: Best Match is a relevance search algorithm developed for PubMed, enhancing the search experience for users accessing the world's largest biomedical library. By utilizing advanced machine-learning techniques and analyzing past user searches, it prioritizes the most relevant biomedical literature among over 37 million citations, moving beyond traditional date-sort methods. This innovative approach aims to improve the efficiency and quality of information retrieval for millions of users globally.

The Biomedical Citation Selector (BmCS) is a project by the National Library of Medicine (NLM) that automates the selection of journal articles for the MEDLINE database, which is focused on biomedicine and life sciences. This automation standardizes article selection and significantly reduces processing time, resulting in more efficient indexing and hosting of relevant biomedical information for public access.

2_use_case_name: Chatbot for researchers to find data sets for environmental health research efforts
x2_summary_text: This project aims to develop a chatbot that utilizes large language models to help researchers efficiently locate relevant data sets for environmental health research. It will source descriptions from NIH and federal data catalogs, producing periodically updated recommendations ranked by relevance. The tool is designed to enhance research efforts by streamlining the process of finding high-quality data sets.

The Clinical Trial Predictor is an AI tool developed to assist NIGMS extramural officers by predicting whether grant applications may involve clinical trials, based on the analysis of their titles, abstracts, and research details. It employs a combination of natural language processing and machine learning algorithms to enhance the efficiency of identifying potential clinical trial content in applications submitted to funding announcements that do not permit such trials. The AI's output is solely for awareness purposes, allowing officers to investigate further; it does not make any decisions regarding the applications.

2_use_case_name: ClinicalTrials.gov Protocol Registration and Results System Review Assistant
x2_summary_text: The ClinicalTrials.gov Protocol Registration and Results System Review Assistant project seeks to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of reviewing clinical study records through the implementation of AI technology. The AI classifier analyzes free-text descriptions of study endpoints to predict the presence of specific issues, aiding in the evaluation process. This initiative aims to improve the accessibility and utility of clinical research information for public and professional audiences.

The Collections Summarization Chatbot is an AI-powered tool designed to provide concise summaries and detailed answers about objects within the NLM Digital Collections. Utilizing the Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) framework on AWS, the chatbot activates when users spend an extended period on a resource page, generating context-specific responses based on the content and metadata of the collection objects being viewed. This initiative aims to enhance user interaction and accessibility within NLM's digital services.

2_use_case_name: Computed Author: author name disambiguation for PubMed
x2_summary_text: The National Library of Medicine (NLM) developed a machine-learning method for author name disambiguation in PubMed, which contains over 37 million citations for biomedical literature. By scoring features to distinguish between papers with similar author names and using agglomerative clustering, the method effectively groups papers by the same authors. This tool, now integrated into PubMed, improves the accuracy of author name searches, addressing the common issue of name ambiguity that can result in irrelevant search results.

The COVID-19 Pandemic Vulnerability Index Dashboard generates risk profiles, known as PVI scorecards, for each U.S. county based on continuously updated data. Its purpose is to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 on vulnerable populations by facilitating equitable resource allocation and local intervention strategies. The dashboard utilizes location-specific infection rates, population metrics, and health vulnerabilities to produce data visualizations and vulnerability assessments.

The CSR Public Chatbot (CPC) is designed to efficiently provide answers to questions from potential applicants and reviewers regarding NIH peer review policies and procedures. It delivers responses along with links to official government web pages to ensure users can verify the information, accompanied by a disclaimer about the accuracy of the source materials. This tool aims to streamline the inquiry process without overwhelming users with excessive links.

The DAIT AIDS-Related Research Solution (DAIT ARR) utilizes natural language processing to categorize and prioritize incoming HIV/AIDS grant applications, predicting their relevance and research areas. After grants are awarded, DAIT reviews the projects to identify those that are AIDS-related, enabling the NIH's Office of AIDS Research to provide additional funding where applicable. This systematic approach improves the efficiency of grant reviews and enhances the alignment of research funding with AIDS-related initiatives.

The Detecting Overlapping Science (DOS) tool identifies potential duplicate funding by analyzing grant applications submitted to the NIH. It provides real-time reports highlighting pairs of applications that may represent overlapping research funding. This tool aims to prevent the allocation of duplicate resources to similar projects.

2_use_case_name: Detection of Implementation Science focus within incoming grant applications
x2_summary_text: The project aims to streamline the grants management process by utilizing natural language processing and machine learning to evaluate incoming grant applications. It calculates an Implementation Science score to predict whether a proposal involves Implementation Science and assigns applications to the appropriate division for oversight and administration. This technology enhances the efficiency of grants management and ensures proper categorization of applications.

DEXTR is an automated data extraction tool designed to streamline the literature review process by efficiently extracting data from published studies. It utilizes natural language processing, regular expressions, and large language models to enhance accuracy and efficiency while reducing the manual burden of data extraction. The tool is continuously optimized to support various use cases, ultimately improving the speed and comprehensiveness of scientific data processing.

2_use_case_name: Division of International Services Customer Service Chatbot
x2_summary_text: The Division of International Services has developed a customer service chatbot that provides accurate responses to general immigration policy questions for both foreign nationals and administrative officers. Utilizing a local database of frequently asked questions and relevant policy information, the chatbot aims to reduce the volume of manual inquiries to the division, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in information dissemination.

The NLM is piloting the use of artificial intelligence to enhance the accessibility of its website, ensuring compliance with Section 508 standards. This initiative aims to streamline the identification and resolution of accessibility errors, reduce manual evaluation costs, and improve overall user experience for a broader audience. The AI tool will work alongside existing web content management systems and will deliver accessibility issue reports, suggested code fixes, and implementation task lists for the development and IT departments.

2_use_case_name: Enhancing Responses to Customer Questions about NLM Products
x2_summary_text: NLM is developing an application utilizing OpenAI's GPT models to automatically respond to technical questions about its products, based on data from NIH/NLM web domains. This AI-driven tool aims to enhance customer service by providing accurate and timely responses, thereby improving efficiency and user satisfaction. The application will operate behind NIH's firewall and integrate with existing knowledge bases to deliver real-time answers without direct customer interaction.

2_use_case_name: Environmental health research annotation for model development
x2_summary_text: This project aims to create annotated datasets from diverse environmental health studies to facilitate the development of AI and machine-learning models that improve data identification and extraction efficiency. By addressing the scarcity of relevant training datasets in toxicology and environmental health research, the initiative will support literature assessments and enhance the effectiveness of such models. The output will be an annotated corpus in formats like BRAT, tailored to support these advancements.

2_use_case_name: Expansion of Generative AI (GenAI) Caption Generation for all Collections Videos
x2_summary_text: The project aims to expand the existing Generative AI caption generation workflow to include all videos in the NLM Digital Collections, automating the creation of captions for videos lacking them. By integrating with current video processing systems, the initiative seeks to enhance the consistency and accuracy of captions while achieving cost savings by reducing dependence on third-party vendors.
