The focus will remain solely on video content within the Digital Collections, ensuring standardized workflows.

2_use_case_name: Federal IT Acquisition Reform Act (FITARA) Tool
x2_summary_text: The Federal IT Acquisition Reform Act (FITARA) Tool developed by NIAID classifies contract statements of work (SOW) documents to determine their relevance to IT initiatives. This classification aids in clarifying and revising SOWs in alignment with FITARA requirements.

The project involves utilizing Generative AI tools, such as AWS Rekognition and AWS Bedrock, to generate metadata for approximately 75,000 still images in the NLM Digital Collections that currently lack descriptions. By identifying concepts and embedded text within these images, the AI will enhance their searchability and discoverability, ultimately improving access to medical and scientific resources. The generated metadata will be integrated into existing NLM metadata management systems to support research and public health initiatives.

The Grant Application Subject-Matter Classification Tool utilizes natural language processing to automatically classify grant applications based on the content of their abstracts, thereby improving the efficiency of the NIEHS grant administration process. It analyzes keywords to assign appropriate scientific categories and route applications to program officers with relevant expertise. The tool is trained on historical human-classified data and operates independently without integration with other datasets.

The HIV-related grant classifier tool is a front-end application designed for scientific staff to input grant information, which it then processes using an automated algorithm to classify HIV-related grants. Utilizing natural language processing, the tool assigns scientific topics and routes applications to the appropriate Program Officer based on the content of their abstracts. This system enhances the efficiency of the grant administration process by providing a predictive categorization, improving the allocation of applications to experts in relevant fields.

NLM is pilot testing an AI system to assist Customer Service Representatives in drafting responses to inquiries. The AI will generate draft responses based on customer inquiries and publicly accessible biomedical information, without making final decisions or communicating directly with customers. The project aims to improve response metrics, customer satisfaction, and the efficiency of the customer service department.

2_use_case_name: Improving Metadata Retrieval and Transformation for Metadata Management
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on enhancing the efficiency and accuracy of metadata retrieval and transformation for the Dataset Catalog, which facilitates access to biomedical datasets. By developing an interface that automates the collection and formatting of metadata from external repositories through AI, the National Library of Medicine aims to streamline internal metadata management processes. The anticipated outcomes include resource savings, improved data quality, and better management of the Dataset Catalog, while maintaining human oversight for critical curation tasks.

The Internal Referral Module automates the assignment of grant applications to program officials within the NIH Extramural Research Program, replacing the manual spreadsheet process currently in use. Utilizing AI and natural language processing, the system streamlines internal referrals by efficiently managing inputs such as grant applications and producing outputs like assignments to program officers and classifications for organizational units. This initiative aims to enhance decision-making and operational efficiency in grant management.

The project utilizes Generative AI to create and distribute maintenance and IT system outage alerts for NIDCD staff. This tool aims to streamline the communication process, reducing the time staff spend crafting email alerts by automatically providing details such as the affected system, building, day, and time of the outage.

The JIT Automated Calculator (JAC) is a tool developed to help NIGMS evaluate the total funding support of Principal Investigators (PIs) to ensure they are not financially over-resourced while applying for additional grants. By utilizing natural language processing (NLP), JAC analyzes Just-In-Time (JIT) Other Support forms, enabling accurate determination of outside funding received by PIs. This ensures NIGMS can make informed funding decisions based on the financial landscape of investigators.

The Large Language Automation project aims to streamline various tasks related to grant applications and research by automating the extraction and analysis of resource sharing plans, generating summaries for different types of documents, and creating training materials and FAQs. It involves integrating Microsoft Azure AI with UiPath to enhance compliance checks for grant applications, as well as automating email communications using data from existing Excel worksheets. The project focuses on improving efficiency and accuracy in managing grant-related documentation and research insights.

2_use_case_name: Leveraging User-Generated Content for Digital Behavioral Interventions
x2_summary_text: The project aims to utilize AI-driven text classification technology to categorize smoking-related tweets into six specific categories, such as quitting strategies, while assessing their sentiment and the presence of sarcasm, irony, and emojis. By employing the BERT pre-trained language model and ChatGPT for classification, the project will analyze a large volume of publicly available tweets to identify effective messaging for smoking cessation interventions. The ultimate goal is to evaluate tweets that are positive and devoid of irony or sarcasm for their potential impact on target audiences.

The LLM Support for Admin Services project seeks to integrate large language models (LLMs) into administrative operations to improve efficiency, accuracy, and productivity. By automating repetitive tasks such as data analysis and documentation drafting, the project aims to reduce the administrative workload and enable personnel to focus on strategic initiatives. Additionally, LLMs will enhance communication consistency and facilitate faster response times to inquiries, ultimately optimizing administrative workflows and organizational performance.

2_use_case_name: Mapping Sequence Data to Research Outcomes
x2_summary_text: The project involves a proof-of-principle analysis aimed at mapping sequence records from NLM-managed repositories to relevant downstream research products. By examining sequence records and associated citations indexed in PubMed, the analysis seeks to inform operations and prioritize resources, resulting in text summaries that indicate the presence or absence of identified research products.

2_use_case_name: Medical Text Indexer-NeXt Generation (MTIX) MEDLINE Indexing
x2_summary_text: The Medical Text Indexer-NeXt Generation (MTIX) is a machine learning-based system designed to automate the indexing of MEDLINE citation records using Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) terms. By implementing a multi-stage neural text ranking approach, MTIX enhances information retrieval in PubMed while addressing the challenges posed by the increasing volume of biomedical literature, thereby providing cost-effective and timely indexing solutions. The system takes PubMed citation data as input and outputs relevant MeSH terms for the articles.

MetaMap is a program developed to connect biomedical literature with concepts from the Unified Medical Language System Metathesaurus. It utilizes natural language processing (NLP) to identify and map these concepts, facilitating access to biomedical knowledge.

The MicroStrategy evaluation aims to identify software that delivers a business intelligence, reporting, and visualization interface for Azure DevOps and OneStream systems. The software must feature strong development capabilities for creating manually-generated reports, as well as AI functionalities that enable end-users to autonomously generate reports. The expected outcome is the production of data-driven business intelligence dashboards based on financial data from OneStream and project management data from Azure DevOps.

MTIX is a machine learning-based system designed for the automated indexing of MEDLINE articles using Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) terms. It employs a multi-stage neural text ranking approach to enhance efficiency in indexing, resulting in a more cost-effective and timely process for managing references in the world's largest biomedical library.

NanCI is a mobile application designed for biomedical scientists to connect with their peers, discover relevant scientific papers, and explore career-building events. Utilizing machine learning algorithms, the app personalizes recommendations to enhance user experience and facilitate professional networking.

The NBS Virtual Assistant is an AI-powered chatbot designed to enhance user engagement and provide personalized support for the NIH Business System (NBS), which is NIH's financial system. By streamlining service desk operations, the assistant effectively manages routine inquiries and offers self-service options, alleviating the workload on IT support.

2_use_case_name: NCI-DOE Collaboration, MOSSAIC project (Modeling Outcomes using Surveillance Data and Scalable AI for Cancer)
x2_summary_text: The MOSSAIC project, a collaboration between the NCI and DOE, utilizes deep learning and natural language processing to analyze population-based cancer data from the SEER program, improving the efficiency and accuracy of cancer data collection. Through tools such as the pathology-coding API implemented in 22 SEER registries, MOSSAIC aims to provide near real-time cancer incidence reporting by automating the extraction of relevant data from unstructured clinical texts. This initiative addresses the challenges posed by manual data review, ultimately enhancing the understanding of cancer trends in the US.

NHLBI Chat is a secure tool that allows NHLBI staff to access the Azure OpenAI API for generative AI applications in their daily activities. The platform enables users to input text via a chat interface on a website, receiving text-based responses in return.

The NIAID GenAI Toolkit consists of the GenAI Chat and Document Bot, which are Azure-hosted applications utilizing large language models from the Azure OpenAI Service. These tools are designed to enhance the efficiency of NIAID employees by assisting with tasks such as content generation, summarization, and drafting emails based on user input and uploaded documents.

The NIAMS AI Chatbot Pilot aims to create a secure environment for NIAMS staff to enhance their research capabilities, assist with writing, generate scientific and IT code, summarize meeting minutes, and learn about AI applications in their workflows. This pilot will also evaluate the cost-effectiveness of developing an in-house chatbot compared to existing NIH Enterprise solutions like MS Copilot and OpenAI ChatGPT, and serve to establish a tiered business case for chatbot usage among staff. User interactions will generate text-based outputs, including summaries and recommendations, tailored to frequency of use.

2_use_case_name: NICHD RPAB AI/ML Application Referral System
x2_summary_text: The NICHD RPAB AI/ML Application Referral System utilizes advanced AI/ML technologies to predict the appropriate extramural branch for new NICHD grant applications, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in the referral assignment process. It incorporates a human-in-the-loop framework, allowing for human oversight and adjustments to model outputs. The system aims to reduce the workload on Subject Matter Experts by streamlining internal referral processes without impacting existing NIH systems.

2_use_case_name: NLM-Chem: towards automatic chemical indexing in PubMed articles
x2_summary_text: NLM-Chem is an automatic tool developed by the National Library of Medicine (NLM) to improve chemical indexing in PubMed articles by utilizing advanced natural language processing and deep learning techniques. This initiative aims to streamline the time-consuming and resource-intensive manual indexing performed by expert indexers, ultimately enhancing literature retrieval and information access in the biomedical field.

2_use_case_name: NLM-Gene: towards automatic gene indexing in PubMed articles
x2_summary_text: NLM-Gene is an automatic tool developed by the National Library of Medicine to streamline the process of gene indexing in PubMed articles. Utilizing advanced natural language processing and deep learning methods, it aims to enhance literature retrieval and information access within the MEDLINE database, which is critical for biomedical research. The initiative seeks to reduce the time and resources currently required for manual gene indexing by expert indexers.

The NLP Automated Referral project incorporates natural language processing and machine learning algorithms into eRA's Internal Referral Module, enabling the automatic assignment of applications to program officers based on various application attributes and historical data. This system operates in the AWS cloud and improves efficiency by minimizing delays in referrals while reducing the workload for staff, allowing them to focus on more valuable tasks. Moreover, it provides program officers with a curated list of the three most relevant NIH institutions for each application to aid in determining the appropriate Institutional Center fit.

The OCIO GenAI Advisor is a pilot project designed to enhance productivity by using Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and user-provided data to answer questions. It aims to explore specific use cases, data requirements, and address security and privacy concerns. When utilized effectively, it can significantly reduce the time needed to find accurate information and generate meaningful responses for complex inquiries in various formats.

The OIT Help Desk Chatbot is a proof of concept project aimed at enhancing productivity by utilizing Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to answer user inquiries effectively. Its implementation can potentially reduce ticket resolution times, empower users, and generate comprehensive responses related to security, architecture, PMO policy, and reports. The chatbot leverages publicly available help desk data and user-provided NIST policy PDFs, operating in natural language for prompts and outputs.

2_use_case_name: Person-level disambiguation for PubMed authors and NIH grant applicants
x2_summary_text: The NIH Office of Portfolio Analysis developed an AI-based disambiguation solution to accurately link researchers to their associated grants and outputs, such as articles and patents. Using article-level metadata, the system processed 24.5 million unique papers to associate them with 16 million unique author names, employing a neural network model to clarify whether author-publication pairs referenced the same individual. This initiative enhances data-driven decision-making within the biomedical research landscape.

The Portfolio Analysis Summarization Tool (PAST) utilizes Power BI to create an interactive platform for program staff to analyze grant data effectively. By generating concise AI-driven summaries of grant-related texts such as Titles, Abstracts, Specific Aims, and Research Strategies, the tool addresses the challenges of processing extensive narratives within grants due to limited time and high information volume. The project aims to enhance the understanding of custom research portfolios to better support program staff and other stakeholders within the institute.

A machine learning model has been created to assist NIA Division Staff by providing Program Classification Code (PCC) suggestions based on IMPAC II data. The model outputs the top three PCC suggestions for a selected council date, allowing users to filter results by IC/OrgCode and Program Officer names. This solution streamlines the processing and assignment of PCCs for a large volume of applications during each council round.

The RCDC AI Validation Tool is designed to ensure the accuracy and completeness of NIH's research funding category reports. By enhancing transparency in the reporting of grants and contracts, the tool aims to provide the public with reliable data on NIH-supported research across various categories.

2_use_case_name: Remediate Adobe .pdf documents to be more accessible
x2_summary_text: The project aims to enhance the accessibility of Adobe PDF documents by ensuring they meet Section 508 standards. To address the time-consuming and specialized nature of manual remediation, NLM is employing AI technology to improve the accessibility of these files for users reliant on assistive technology. As a result, the improved PDFs will be more user-friendly for a broader audience.

2_use_case_name: Research Performance Progress Report (RPPR) Report Comparison
x2_summary_text: The National Institute on Aging (NIA) aims to streamline its grant application review process, which currently involves a time-consuming and error-prone manual comparison of grant documents. By utilizing grants data from the QVR, the project will enable the identification of duplications and overlaps in grants across different years, thereby improving efficiency and resource allocation. Each Program Officer manages a substantial number of grants, necessitating a more effective solution for oversight of approximately $4 billion in funding.

The Scientific Summaries Tool is designed to assist the NIAID DIR team in generating justifications for personnel actions related to physicians, scientists, and veterinarians. By utilizing inputs such as scientific publications and prior justifications, the tool will facilitate the quick preparation of tailored justifications for investigators in specific research fields. The final output will be a comprehensive scientific summary that supports various personnel decisions.

2_use_case_name: Semantic group prediction in the UMLS Metathesaurus
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on developing AI methods, including neural networks and heuristics, to predict the semantic groups of new terms for integration into the UMLS Metathesaurus. The hybrid system aims to enhance the efficiency and consistency of UMLS concept editing and quality assurance, ultimately reducing the time required to add new concepts. It processes new concepts, which are typically phrases, and outputs their associated semantic groups, supporting the annual UMLS update.

The Similarity-based Application and Investigator Matching (SAIM) system utilizes natural language processing (NLP) to identify non-NIH grants awarded to NIGMS Principal Investigators, helping NIGMS assess the total support received by these investigators. This tool is designed to ensure that funding is allocated to those who require additional resources, thereby preventing oversaturation of funding for already well-supported researchers.

2_use_case_name: SingleCite: Improving single citation search in PubMed
x2_summary_text: SingleCite is an advanced search algorithm aimed at enhancing single citation searches in the PubMed database, which is managed by the National Library of Medicine (NLM). By predicting the likelihood of a retrieved document being relevant to a user's query, SingleCite significantly improves the effectiveness and success rate of locating specific documents in this extensive biomedical library.

The SRDMS NLP COI project aims to enhance NIAID's grant review process by using natural language processing to identify potential conflicts of interest between grant reviewers and applicants. This tool streamlines the detection of COIs, thereby improving the integrity and efficiency of the scientific review conducted in various research areas managed by NIAID.

The Stem Cell Auto Coder automates the classification of Stem Cell Research subcategories, significantly reducing the time and effort involved in manual coding. Utilizing natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML), it accurately predicts categories such as human embryonic, non-human embryonic, and various induced pluripotent stem cells. This innovation enhances the efficiency of NIGMS-funded research efforts.

The Study Section Clustering Tool (SSCT) organizes grant applications into groups of similar scientific fields to facilitate the formation of new study sections. Designed to reflect the current state of science, the tool generates lists of recommended study section groupings based on the text of the applications, while final decisions are made by subject matter experts.

2_use_case_name: Synonymy prediction in the UMLS Metathesaurus
x2_summary_text: The project aims to develop AI approaches, specifically neural networks, to predict synonymy among biomedical concepts within the UMLS Metathesaurus, facilitating the integration of new concepts. This system is designed to interact solely with new and existing concepts in the Metathesaurus, enhancing the efficiency and consistency of the editing process. Preliminary results suggest that the AI system can effectively support the integration of new terms, potentially reducing the time required for updates.

2_use_case_name: TB Case Browser Image Text Detection
x2_summary_text: The TB Case Browser is a tool developed by the NIAID TB Portals Program that utilizes AWS Recognition's AI service to identify and detect text in images, particularly focusing on potential Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and Protected Health Information (PHI) within tuberculosis data. If the text detection exceeds a set threshold, the tool alerts the user, requiring them to confirm their decision before proceeding with the image upload.

The Tech Support Chatbot is designed to serve the ORS/ORF community by offering an interactive customer service interface for inquiries about OIIT technology services and for OIIT staff to receive technical assistance while troubleshooting. By enhancing the efficiency of information delivery and addressing administrative questions, the AI improves support for both users and internal teams. The chatbot utilizes a local database for data input and provides responses in various formats, including text, images, and data.

The Tool for PO Lookup Assignment (TPAL) enables NIGMS Program staff to efficiently identify and assign appropriate Program Officers (POs) and NIH Institute Centers (ICs) for project proposals using natural language processing and machine learning. By analyzing the project description inputted by users, TPAL predicts the top three most relevant POs and ICs, even when NIGMS is not among the top recommendations. This automation supports Division Directors, Branch Chiefs, and Program Officers in finding the right contacts for project discussions and proposal submissions.

The Transformative Research Award Anonymization Check (TRAAC) is a tool designed to assess the anonymization of NIH Director's Transformative Research Awards grant applications by detecting identifying information in the Specific Aims and Research Strategy sections. It automatically screens applications, highlights potentially compromising text, and organizes findings into spreadsheets and annotated PDF files. This process facilitates efficient evaluations by NIH staff and the external scientific community regarding the preservation of applicant anonymity.

2_use_case_name: Machine learning pipeline for mining citations from full-text scientific articles
x2_summary_text: The NIH Office of Portfolio Analysis has developed a machine learning pipeline that identifies freely accessible scientific articles by harvesting full-text PDFs and converting them to XML. It utilizes a Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) recurrent neural network model to distinguish between reference text and other content, with the recognized citations subsequently processed through a Citation Resolution Service. This system enhances access to scientific literature without requiring institutional library subscriptions.

2_use_case_name: Machine learning system to predict translational progress in biomedical research
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on developing a machine learning system that predicts the likelihood of a research paper being cited in future clinical trials or guidelines, thereby allowing for real-time assessment of translational progress in biomedical research. This prediction is based on the scientific community's early reactions to the paper. The methodology and results are detailed in the publication by Hutchins et al. (2019).

2_use_case_name: Assessing developing possible version of "HHSGPT" for OIDP-specific internal use
x2_summary_text: The project aims to develop a custom, knowledge-based version of "Chat GPT" for internal use by OIDP to enhance operational efficiencies in HIV-related national strategies. Named Ask ABE! (v3.0.0-alpha.1), the AI-driven tool functions as a digital librarian, helping staff access and utilize resources from HIV.gov while maintaining security, privacy, equity, and risk management principles. It will allow OIDP staff to ask questions, create content, and refine existing materials using a tailored dataset, including NIH HIV guidelines.

2_use_case_name: Informal generative AI research for OIDP's HIV.gov
x2_summary_text: The informal generative AI research for OIDP's HIV.gov focuses on monitoring new AI tools and policies, as well as their impact on HIV-related content delivery. Conducted by an ORISE fellow in collaboration with the HIV.gov communications team, the findings are reviewed weekly to explore potential applications that could enhance outreach, such as synthesizing content into narrated videos. This initiative aims to inform and guide strategic planning for improved communication efforts.

2_use_case_name: Presenting/providing technical assistance on HIV.gov's cautious & transparent use of generative AI
x2_summary_text: OIDP's HIV.gov provides technical assistance through workshops, one-on-one training, and limited labs focused on the cautious and transparent use of generative AI for creating communications content. These activities emphasize federal guidance and best practices, with AI-generated content clearly marked as "Created by AI, Reviewed By Humans." Over 500 individuals have been trained through these initiatives, enhancing understanding of both generative AI and related HIV programs.

The HHSGPT Pilot is an internal generative AI tool being utilized by select OIDP staff for various tasks such as writing, editing, brainstorming, and drafting related to infectious diseases and HIV policies. Team members have employed this tool to evaluate national strategies, including the 2026-2030 vaccine and viral hepatitis strategies, while tracking its effectiveness in reducing labor burden and identifying notable findings through an Excel reporting system. The tool generates suggestions and edits to assist in the organization's tasks, streamlining workflows and enhancing productivity.

HHSGPT is an AI-powered chatbot integrated with Azure, designed to enhance productivity for data scientists and policy analysts within the HHS organization. It automates repetitive tasks, allowing human agents to concentrate on more complex activities while providing instant insights and assisting in the creation of policy documents. Currently, it is in the pilot phase across the entire HHS organization.

The DECIDE project aims to streamline the review process of grantee organizations' progress in reducing health disparities for SAMHSA's Office of Behavioral Health Equity by developing an AI-based tool. This tool will automate the extraction and comparison of data from various sources, enhancing the accuracy of grantee reports and significantly reducing the administrative burden on staff. Ultimately, DECIDE will enable faster feedback to grantees regarding their demographic data reporting and progress towards health equity goals.

The document drafting and editing tool developed for SAMHSA employees aims to enhance productivity and improve the quality of internal and public-facing documents. By functioning as a writing assistant, it will help users structure their thoughts, create outlines, and proofread text, ultimately facilitating clearer and more effective communication. This tool operates similarly to a standard large language model chatbot, allowing employees to perform specific writing tasks efficiently.

The document summarization tool is designed to help SAMHSA employees quickly ingest and summarize large volumes of information, improving efficiency in grantmaking and management. It allows users to upload documents for automatic summarization while incorporating enhanced data privacy measures to protect sensitive information. The tool will not utilize any SAMHSA-provided input as training data, ensuring confidentiality remains intact.

The SAMHSA.gov team plans to implement "Kendra," a smart search tool, on store.samhsa.gov to enhance user access to behavioral health information, addressing current search limitations. Kendra will improve search accuracy and speed by scanning all documents in the store, while strictly adhering to security protocols to protect sensitive information. It is important to note that Kendra is not a generative AI system and does not create AI-generated responses.

Ginnie Mae employs machine learning algorithms, such as clustering and genetic techniques, to analyze counterparty risk profiles of mortgage issuers in its program. This approach enhances the identification of data patterns and potential risk areas, allowing Ginnie Mae staff to concentrate their subsequent analyses effectively.

Ginnie Mae employs machine learning models to analyze Master Sub-Servicer transaction data monthly, improving the detection of data inconsistencies and exceptions. This automated analysis streamlines the review of numerous transactions, resulting in enhanced efficiency and accuracy in reporting processes while effectively identifying data anomalies.

2_use_case_name: Automating Draft Counterparty Credit Narrative Reports
x2_summary_text: Ginnie Mae is automating the creation of draft counterparty credit narrative reports for mortgage issuers using Natural Language Generation (NLG). This technology applies coded rules to analyze financial data and generate written narratives, enhancing processing efficiency and minimizing manual errors. The project aims to streamline the initial steps in counterparty credit reviews.

The Voice of the Customer application, developed by the Office of the Chief Financial Officer's Customer Experience Team, leverages advanced voice transcription and text analytics to analyze customer feedback from surveys, calls, and chats. This tool enables HUD to extract valuable insights to enhance program and service delivery, ultimately improving customer experiences. Additionally, a data analytics dashboard presents this information in clear metrics, such as customer satisfaction rates across various interaction topics.

The Quantitative Text Analysis project involves examining large volumes of text to identify patterns such as frequently occurring words and common word clusters. The results are presented through charts and graphs that highlight the most common words, their clustering, and the overall sentiment associated with the text.

OPA is utilizing Google Translate for translating information on HUD's public-facing websites, enabling users to access content in Spanish and other languages through an "Español" button. This approach is a temporary measure to enhance language access in accordance with HUD’s Language Access Plan and Executive Order 13166, while a permanent solution is being developed. The Google Translate integration is free and does not involve customization.

2_use_case_name: NextGen Advanced Methods: Air Traffic Control System Command Center (ATCSCC) Webinar Speech2Text and Analysis
x2_summary_text: The NextGen Advanced Methods project focuses on leveraging innovative technologies like machine learning, artificial intelligence, and advanced data analytics to enhance the FAA's air traffic flow management. Specifically, it aims to convert live conversations from the Air Traffic Control System Command Center webinars into text using deep learning, followed by natural language processing for analysis and review of air traffic management content.

2_use_case_name: NextGen Data Analytics: Letters of Agreement
x2_summary_text: The NextGen Data Analytics project aims to enhance the accessibility and standardization of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and Letters of Agreement (LOA) within air traffic control. By employing modern data analytics and machine learning, the project seeks to digitize and streamline these documents, making them readily available to stakeholders such as flight planners. This initiative will facilitate more efficient flight planning and support advancements in noise abatement procedures and time-based flow management in the National Airspace System (NAS).

2_use_case_name: AEGIS: Autonomous Exploration for Gathering Increased Science
x2_summary_text: AEGIS is an autonomous system designed for planetary rovers that enhances targeting and data collection through advanced computer vision. It identifies scientifically relevant targets in the environment and autonomously measures them using remote sensing instruments. Initially implemented in the MER Mission, AEGIS is currently utilized in the MSL Mission and is set to be deployed in the M2020 Mission.

ASPEN Mission Planner is a modular application framework leveraging AI techniques to support diverse planning and scheduling tasks. It includes reusable components such as a modeling language, resource management, temporal reasoning, and a graphical interface. ASPEN has been utilized in various space missions, including the Modified Antarctic Mapping Mission and ESA's Rosetta Orbiter, to enhance science optimization from scientific sensors.

The Compressed Large-scale Activity Scheduling and Planning (CLASP) project is a sophisticated long-range scheduler designed for optimizing the orientation and operational timings of pushbroom instruments in space-based and aerial missions. It enhances the scheduling process by maximizing the coverage of target points while managing memory and energy usage through advanced geometric computations using the SPICE ephemeris toolkit. CLASP supports mission planning across various projects, including the NISAR and ECOSTRESS missions, by enabling simulations that inform multiple aspects of mission design and expected scientific outcomes.

2_use_case_name: Enhanced AutoNav for Perseverance Rover on Mars
x2_summary_text: The Enhanced AutoNav system for the Perseverance Rover autonomously plans safe navigation paths on Mars using advanced technologies, including tree search decision-making, Dijkstra algorithm for global path planning, stereo processing for 3D terrain reconstruction, and Approximate Clearance Evaluation (ACE) for safety checks. This system enables the rover to drive autonomously across the Martian landscape, ensuring safe and efficient exploration.

The Mars2020 Rover, named Perseverance, is designed to enhance future rovers with onboard autonomy and advanced scheduling capabilities, including path planning, onboard science, image processing, terrain classification, fault diagnosis, and location estimation. The rover utilizes a non-backtracking scheduler that incrementally constructs feasible activity schedules while accounting for necessary maintenance and operational constraints. To improve the scheduler's robustness, a Copilot system employs Monte Carlo stochastic analysis to adjust scheduling parameters based on mission priorities.

MLNav is a project that enhances the path planning capabilities of rovers by employing machine learning-based heuristics, while ensuring safety through traditional collision checking methods. It is integrated with the Mars 2020 mission's Enhanced AutoNav system and has been tested using real Martian terrain data in a simulator. The system utilizes a U-net architecture trained on simulation-generated terrain data to provide optimized path planning recommendations for the Mars 2020 Rover.

2_use_case_name: Perseverance Rover on Mars - Terrain Relative Navigation
x2_summary_text: The Perseverance Rover utilizes Terrain Relative Navigation (TRN) through dual cameras and machine vision to enhance its path planning capabilities. This system employs convolutional neural networks, physics-based evaluations, and advanced techniques like random forests and Approximate Clearance Evaluation (ACE) to navigate the Martian terrain effectively. The TRN also contributed to the precision landing of the rover during its entry, descent, and landing on Mars, with plans for even more sophisticated artificial intelligence and machine learning methods for future missions.

SPOC (Soil Property and Object Classification) is a convolutional neural network that classifies terrain types from rover images to enhance driving safety. It is trained on labeled images gathered from various Mars rovers, with annotations provided by citizen scientists through the AI4Mars project. The system is deployed in MSL's ground operations and is being considered for onboard testing on the Mars 2020 rover.

The Volcano SensorWeb project employs a network of sensors interconnected via software and the internet to monitor and respond to volcanic activity and other environmental phenomena. Using a flexible, modular architecture, it enables automated satellite observations triggered by low-resolution sensors for improved data collection. The system is currently focused on monitoring the Earth's 50 most active volcanoes, as well as conducting experiments related to flooding, wildfires, and cryospheric events.

2_use_case_name: NASA OCIO STI Concept Tagging Service
x2_summary_text: The NASA OCIO STI Concept Tagging Service is an API designed to provide access to topic models generated from the Scientific & Technical Information concept training repository. It adheres to established API standards to facilitate the integration and utilization of these models. This service aims to enhance the accessibility of scientific and technical information through effective tagging.

The Autonomous WAiting Room Evaluation (AWARE) project utilizes a security camera and YOLO Machine Learning model to monitor and count individuals waiting for service at Langley's Badge & Pass Office. When the number of people exceeds a set threshold, automated alerts via text and email are generated to request additional assistance at the service counters. The project aims to improve service efficiency by providing real-time data on customer counts in the waiting area.

The Mars2020 onboard planner for the Perseverance rover constructs a feasible activity schedule in a priority-first manner, utilizing a non-backtracking approach that determines valid placement intervals while accounting for the rover's operational needs. To address potential brittleness from its non-backtracking nature, a Monte Carlo-based stochastic analysis is employed for setting meta parameters, such as activity priority and temporal constraints. Additionally, the project encompasses broader research and engineering initiatives aimed at enhancing onboard autonomy for future rovers through various applications, including path planning and terrain classification.

2_use_case_name: SensorWeb: Volcano, Flood, Wildfire, and others.
x2_summary_text: The SensorWeb Project utilizes a network of sensors and satellite observations to create a flexible and modular system for monitoring natural disasters such as volcanoes, floods, and wildfires. By integrating low resolution, high coverage sensors with high resolution instruments, the project enhances global surveillance and response capabilities for environmental phenomena. This innovative approach facilitates customized monitoring and data collection, significantly improving temporal resolution and offering comprehensive insights into the Earth's most active geological and climatic events.

The Global Seasonal Mars Frost Maps project generates comprehensive frost maps of Mars using five remote sensing datasets, processed through various data science techniques, including CNNs. These maps provide valuable insights into the seasonal distribution of frost on the Martian surface. The resulting frost maps are publicly accessible on the JMARS platform.

The Purchase Card Management System (PCMS) utilizes a machine learning model to evaluate purchases and determine if they should be classified as taggable assets or chemicals. It provides metadata tagging recommendations to streamline asset tracking and compliance.

The New Technology and Software Reporting (NTR) application utilizes a machine learning model to classify reported new technologies into specific categories, such as Aerospace or Robotics. This automated categorization streamlines the reporting process and enhances the organization of technology classifications.

ServiceNow GenAI "Now Assist" is a FedRAMP High certified platform designed to enhance digital transformation in customer service. It automatically generates content such as responses and work notes, while offering intelligent recommendations to boost productivity and expedite delivery. Additionally, it features chatbots that comprehend human language to facilitate quick issue resolution.

The Budget Area Topic Classification Tool employs a pre-trained BERT model to categorize proposals into one of eight budget areas, utilizing a semi-supervised approach based on pre-tagged CISE proposals. The model is trained to understand the multi-label structure of the data, with its performance evaluated using an 80/20 train-test split. It produces a numerical vector of probabilities that indicates the likelihood of a proposal belonging to multiple categories, allowing for the determination of final classifications based on a set cut-off value.

The AI voice-over project utilizes a commercial-off-the-shelf system from Wellsaid to generate temporary voice overs, which will eventually be replaced by human recordings. This approach enables the agency to bypass the design and development processes typically required from federal or contract personnel, minimizing concerns related to AI policy.

The Creative Services team at OLPA will utilize Adobe Photoshop's AI-powered tools to enhance the editing process for photos and graphics. This includes a specific focus on retouching portraits to achieve improved visual quality.

The Resubmit Checker analyzes a list of proposal IDs to identify and score similar proposals previously submitted to NSF. This tool aids in evaluating proposals for potential return without review, ensuring consistent merit review, and examining broader resubmission trends.

The AWS Assisted Software Development project aims to enhance developer productivity and code quality by integrating AI-driven tools, such as AWS CodeWhisperer, Amazon Q, and Bedrock, into DIS Developers' IDEs, Jenkins automation, and Bitbucket. This pilot serves as a foundation for implementing Secure AI Assisted Development at NSF.

2_use_case_name: Mine Potential Reviewer's Area of Expertise
x2_summary_text: The project involves using Airtable, a low-code platform integrated with Open AI, to trial the AI's capability in matching potential reviewers to their areas of expertise. TIP has received approval for various use cases with Airtable, which is certified as secure by the NSF OCIO Security Team, ensuring data privacy.

The project utilizes Airtable for managing reviewer volunteers and recruitment, focusing on maintaining a database that includes only public PII such as names and professional expertise. Airtable AI will analyze potential reviewers' LinkedIn profiles to identify and update their expertise, while also searching the existing potential submitters database to associate each submitter with their institution's state.

2_use_case_name: Enhancing TIP Awards: Efficient Tagging for the 10 Key Technology Areas (KTA)
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on improving the tagging process for TIP Awards to align with the 10 Key Technology Areas (KTA) mandated by the CHIPS and Science Act. This enhancement aims to provide better insights into TIP's investment portfolio, ensuring efficient categorization and tracking of awards within these critical technology domains.

2_use_case_name: Data Access Alternatives: Artificial Intelligence Supported Interfaces
x2_summary_text: The project aims to develop and pilot an AI-backed interface, such as a chat bot, to improve user interactions with federal statistical data. By leveraging machine learning, it seeks to provide direct answers to user queries, thereby enhancing the current methods of obtaining information through search engines or email communication with federal staff. The initiative is designed to facilitate easier access to public statistical data from federal agencies.

The project involves processing Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests, with an emphasis on selecting tools that can assist in sorting these requests efficiently. Currently, no specific tool has been chosen, and the team is in the exploratory phase to identify suitable options.

2_use_case_name: Alt text Generator for Images in NSF's Media Hub
x2_summary_text: The project involves integrating ChatGPT with the National Science Foundation's Digital Asset Management (DAM) system to automatically generate alt text for images. This initiative aims to enhance the accessibility of digital communication products, such as nsf.gov, for individuals using assistive technology.

2_use_case_name: Exploring the use of BERTopic Modeling for a portfolio analysis
x2_summary_text: The project investigates the applicability of BERTopic modeling, a natural language processing technique, for conducting portfolio analysis. It aims to assess how this method can enhance insights and understanding in analyzing diverse investment portfolios.

2_use_case_name: Open-source topic identification for the Public Engagement with Science Initiative data analysis.
x2_summary_text: The project involves using unsupervised natural language processing (NLP) techniques to identify topical themes in responses to the NSF public engagement questionnaire for the Public Engagement with Science Initiative. An AI system will be developed to create a clustering model that can analyze all responses, while RTI STEM education experts will manually align the research topics with NSF research programs when applicable.

2_use_case_name: Hand-written text extraction using Textract for the Public Engagement with Science Initiative
x2_summary_text: The project aims to utilize AWS Textract, a commercial off-the-shelf product, for extracting handwritten text from postcards related to the Public Engagement with Science Initiative. It will convert open format responses to science and engineering questions, along with demographic data, into machine-encoded text. This process will facilitate easier data analysis and improve engagement outcomes.

The "Ask NSF Initial Pilot" project aims to evaluate the feasibility of developing a chatbot using an AI platform to quickly address general inquiries based on existing documents. This pilot will test the hypothesis of rapid chatbot creation and its effectiveness in providing information.

The USA Class project aims to create an application that streamlines the development of position descriptions (PDs) for managers and HR specialists, addressing the common issue of lengthy and inefficient processes. By utilizing large language models and a curated PD library, the application will suggest draft content, significantly reducing the time required for PD creation and enhancing the quality of the documents produced. Ultimately, this project seeks to improve HR processes, talent acquisition, and organizational effectiveness while achieving cost savings for agencies.

Copilot for Microsoft 365 is an AI-powered tool designed to enhance productivity and creativity within the Microsoft 365 suite. It utilizes large language models and integrates with user data to assist in summarizing content, drafting emails, analyzing data, and automating tasks, among other features. While it aids users by generating initial drafts and insights, the responsibility for validation and editing remains with the user.

The Insight AI application serves as decision support software for Disability Program adjudicators, enhancing the quality, speed, and consistency of their decisions. By analyzing free text from disability cases, it delivers real-time alerts on potential quality issues and offers case-specific reference information, thereby increasing decision quality and minimizing human error. The application identifies 43 quality flags to highlight inconsistencies, omissions, or non-compliance with policy in disability decisions.

The Intelligent Medical Language Analysis Generation (IMAGEN) project employs AI to enhance the visualization and searchability of clinical content within medical records, thereby improving the efficiency and accuracy of disability determinations. It includes document annotations that aid in navigating medical records by highlighting patient encounters, tests, dates, and relevant information, alongside identifying possible impairments and SSA Medical Listing Codes.

The Duplicate Identification Process utilizes AI to identify, flag, and mark duplicate cases, streamlining the review process for hearings. This technology significantly reduces the time needed for case review by minimizing redundancy.

2_use_case_name: Handwriting Recognition of Forms; Intelligent Document Processing Platform - Forms Classification and Data Extraction
x2_summary_text: The handwriting recognition project focuses on an intelligent document processing platform that classifies, identifies, and extracts data from structured and semi-structured forms with printed and handwritten fields. It enhances automation, minimizes clerical errors, and decreases customer wait times. The extracted data is output in JSON format for easy integration with downstream systems via API and other methods like queues.

The Modernized Development Worksheet (MDW) project utilizes AI to analyze data during case development, enhancing the categorization process. This improvement leads to reduced processing and customer wait times by efficiently labeling and organizing new or updated MDW requests.

The Anomalous iClaim Predictive Model utilizes AI to identify high-risk claims that require further review by Operations. It generates risk scores for recently submitted iClaims to facilitate the adjudication process.

2_use_case_name: Pre-Effectuation Review / Targeted Denial Review Models
x2_summary_text: The Pre-Effectuation Review and Targeted Denial Review Models utilize AI to identify claims with a high likelihood of error, ensuring they are referred for further review. This approach effectively reduces the occurrence of incorrect benefits payments by assigning probability scores through an integrated mainframe process.

The Representative Payee Misuse Model utilizes AI to detect potential fraud by representative payees, effectively reducing instances of misuse. It generates numerical scores that indicate the likelihood of representative payee fraud, allowing for targeted reviews.

The Continuing Disability Review Model uses AI to assess disability cases for their likelihood of medical improvement, enhancing the accuracy of continuing disability reviews (CDRs). The system assigns numerical scores to each case, categorizing them into low, medium, or high probability of improvement. This approach aims to identify cases that may warrant further review.

The Social Security Income Redetermination Model utilizes AI to identify cases of overpayment in Supplemental Security Income (SSI) that are most likely to yield significant financial recoveries. The model prioritizes these cases for technician review by generating numerical scores reflecting both the likelihood and the estimated amount of overpayment for each individual.

2_use_case_name: Proactive Triage and Analysis of Hearings (PATH)
x2_summary_text: The PATH project utilizes AI to identify and flag claims with a high likelihood of favorable outcomes for human adjudicators to review. It provides sorted case listings that prioritize claims based on their chances of success in on-the-record hearings. The goal is to streamline the adjudication process and enhance decision-making efficiency.

The Quick Disability Determinations Model is designed to streamline the screening of initial disability applications by identifying cases with a high likelihood of favorable determinations and readily available medical evidence. It generates probability model scores for different scoring services, including the Scoring Service for Allowance, Scoring Service for Processing Time, and an overall QDD Score. This prioritization facilitates expedited case processing.

Mobile Wage Reporting (MOBWR) utilizes AI technology to extract text and data from scanned images of pay stubs or payroll documents. This process enables quicker processing of essential information such as gross pay and pay date, streamlining wage reporting.

The SSA 800# Public Question & Answer Bot provides responses to callers' inquiries using approved FAQs from SSA.GOV, available in both English and Spanish. By addressing questions directly, the bot reduces wait times for callers needing agent assistance and delivers answers that mirror the language found on the SSA FAQs webpage.

The project involves developing a generative AI model to analyze transcripts from the Social Security Administration's National 800 Number. This model will provide insights into caller intent, call resolution, and topics discussed, helping to identify policy and process pain points. Ultimately, the goal is to enhance customer service, reduce unnecessary calls, and decrease wait times.

The PolicyNet Plain Language Search Engine utilizes learning to rank functionality, leveraging user feedback to improve search result relevance based on thumbs up/thumbs down data. Set to be implemented in FY25, this system aims to enhance information retrieval for all internal SSA components, ultimately supporting better customer service by helping users find relevant SSA policies, procedures, and instructions more efficiently.

The project involves creating transcripts from recorded audio of disability hearings through speech-to-text technology. This process aims to accurately convert spoken language into written form for documentation and accessibility purposes. The final output is a comprehensive transcript of the hearings.

The Customer Insight Tool is a survey analysis platform that evaluates sentiment and categorization within feedback. Its features include machine translation for text conversion, sentiment analysis for classification into negative, positive, and neutral categories, and automated categorization of related terms. Additionally, it identifies explicit suggestions and mentions of customer effort from feedback text.

2_use_case_name: Benefit and Earnings Public Use File
x2_summary_text: The Benefit and Earnings Public Use File project creates high-fidelity synthetic data on benefits and earnings for use by external researchers. This initiative aims to support policy research and decision-making while ensuring the protection of individual privacy. The resulting synthetic microdata file is designed specifically for public access by policy researchers.

2_use_case_name: Therapy Chatbot - Text-Based Mental Health Support for SSA Employees
x2_summary_text: The Therapy Chatbot is a text-based mental health support tool designed for SSA employees, providing accessible, AI-driven conversations on their personal devices. It generates synthetic text responses to engage users in therapeutic dialogue and support.

The Agency Support Companion (ASC) chatbot utilizes a generative AI model to provide content creation, summarization, and research capabilities. It delivers responses to user inquiries while also generating management information reports for executives.

The project focuses on the intelligent generation of modernized code by utilizing AI techniques like cluster analysis, pattern matching, and programming language models. It efficiently analyzes and processes data to produce structured, standardized, and maintainable code, transforming legacy code into a modern programming language. The approach leverages AI to enhance the quality and maintainability of the generated code.

2_use_case_name: Data Governance Product (DGP) -  Data cataloging and predictive analysis of data assets.
x2_summary_text: The Data Governance Product (DGP) utilizes an AI engine for automating the discovery, classification, and curation of data assets, enhancing data cataloging and predictive analysis. It incorporates Natural Language Processing (NLP) to allow non-technical stakeholders to participate in rule creation by converting plain text into regular expressions. The product delivers efficient search results for data catalogs and facilitates user interactions through plain English conversations for technical rule formulation.

2_use_case_name: Product Service Code Automation ML Model
x2_summary_text: The Product Service Code Automation ML Model was a proof-of-concept project designed to utilize machine learning to analyze unstructured procurement data and automatically identify commodity and service types. However, the project has been retired and is no longer active.

2_use_case_name: Tailored Integration Logistics Management System (ILMS) User Analytics
x2_summary_text: The Tailored Integration Logistics Management System (ILMS) User Analytics project aimed to enhance user experiences by utilizing transactional data and planned transactions to provide customized analytics. It focused on mining real-time user actions and clicks for deeper insights. However, this pilot project has been retired and is no longer in production.

The project aims to enhance analytics within the Integrated Logistics Management System (ILMS) by creating a machine learning model to identify patterns of potentially anomalous activity in property and procurement. This initiative will involve collecting and analyzing data related to such activities.

The project focuses on enhancing translation workflows by utilizing machine-based tools, which provide initial rough translations. These machine outputs are then meticulously post-edited by professional human translators to ensure the highest quality of the final product. This approach combines the efficiency of AI with the expertise of human review to optimize translation accuracy.

The FOIA Web ML Document Indexer project aims to develop a machine learning algorithm that will generate index metadata for documents in the Department's online FOIA Library. This enhancement will improve document classification and search accuracy by creating a series of prepopulated metadata entries.

BudgetChat AI Tool aims to consolidate budget documents to enhance the ease of searching and summarizing financial information. This tool will streamline access and analysis of initiatives spanning multiple years and programs, with all summarized data being verified and reviewed by humans for accuracy.

2_use_case_name: Travel.state.gov (TSG) Content Refinement with AI Text Editor
x2_summary_text: The Travel.state.gov (TSG) project involves refining public-facing content on International Travel Safety and Security using an AI text editor. The goal is to improve readability by simplifying the language, after which the rewritten content will undergo human review and editing.

The Predictive Analytics Platform is designed to support AI research and development by utilizing services like Azure AI Services and Azure Machine Learning. It will host various AI use cases, allowing users to model and implement predictive analytics solutions effectively. The platform aims to enhance the development capacity for individual AI use cases.

2_use_case_name: Consular Affairs Photo Quality Service (PQS) / FaceVACS
x2_summary_text: The Consular Affairs Photo Quality Service (PQS) utilizes FaceVACS technology to automatically assess the quality of passport photos during the Online Passport Renewal process. This system provides instant feedback to applicants, prompting them to retake or upload new photos when necessary to ensure compliance with requirements. If an acceptable digital photo cannot be obtained, applicants may submit a physical photo through standard procedures, leading to improved outcomes for the renewal process.

2_use_case_name: Innovation and Transformation Measurement and Prediction
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on measuring and predicting the impacts of changes in consular services on various outcomes, including efficiency and customer experiences, through machine learning and statistical modeling. By understanding these causal relationships, Consular Affairs aims to foresee the effects of service changes on customers and employees, ultimately leading to improved outcomes.

2_use_case_name: Evaluating Customer Feedback and Sentiments with AI
x2_summary_text: The project aims to utilize Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLM) to analyze unstructured text data derived from customer feedback. It focuses on sentiment analysis, categorization, and summarization to extract actionable insights that can drive customer improvement initiatives.

2_use_case_name: Translation of Consular Content using AI
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on using AI translation models to enhance the capacity of the Consular Affairs (CA) department to deliver website content in customers' preferred languages. It aims to ensure accurate and comprehensible translations while reducing the resources required for traditional translation methods.

The Travel.State.Gov (TSG) project involves the implementation of a new chatbot and an enhanced search feature on the TSG website, which processes existing FAQs and resources. The chatbot offers predefined responses to user inquiries, resulting in improved outcomes for website visitors.

CodeGen is an AI-assisted application that integrates with Large Language Models (LLMs) to streamline IT application development. It offers a secure API suite that accelerates the processes of code generation, translation, analysis, optimization, and debugging for developers, ultimately leading to improved software development outcomes.

The Violence Against Civilians Model is a machine learning tool designed to predict mass civilian killings worldwide by analyzing open-source political, social, and economic datasets. It generates quarterly and yearly forecasts of related indicators to aid in conflict prevention efforts.
The Automated Damage Assessments project utilized AI and machine learning to analyze commercial satellite imagery for damage evaluation. It has since been retired.

The Automated Burning Detection project involved daily scans of moderate resolution commercial satellite imagery to identify anomalies in the near-infrared band. This project has been retired and is no longer active.

Senturion Alpha is a simulation tool designed to analyze political dynamics by mapping key decision makers according to their positions on an issue spectrum and identifying their influences. It estimates how the policy positions of competing interests will evolve over time based on stakeholder interactions. This model aids in understanding complex decision-making processes within various contexts.

The Mass Mobilization Model is a machine learning forecasting tool designed to predict mass mobilizations, such as protests and riots, across countries worldwide. It utilizes open-source datasets related to political, social, and economic factors to provide annual estimates.

The Apptio project involved using the Working Capital Fund (IRM/WCF) to bill bureaus for consolidated services and develop cost models to assist them in budgeting for future fiscal years. Apptio's capabilities included extrapolating future values through various formulas. This project has now been retired.

2_use_case_name: DT Data Analytics and Assessment (DAA) AI Use Case ITCP data harvest
x2_summary_text: The DT Data Analytics and Assessment (DAA) project focuses on utilizing AI to analyze unstructured text from essential DT documents. The goal is to create structured data that indicates compliance with DT data governance and FAM-related policies. This initiative aims to enhance the organization’s data management capabilities.

The ServiceNow AI-Powered Virtual Agent project aimed to integrate a chatbot into existing applications for improved user support and data access. The AI technology was sourced from ServiceNow's Platform as a Service (PaaS). This project has since been retired.

The POA&M Orchestration project aims to automate the opening and closing of Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&Ms) in response to log and vulnerability data from each Federal Information Security Modernization Act (FISMA) system. This orchestration will enhance efficiency and ensure timely updates to compliance documentation.

2_use_case_name: NLP for Foreign Assistance Appropriations Analysis
x2_summary_text: This project utilizes Natural Language Processing (NLP) to enhance the analysis of Foreign Assistance Appropriations by automating the extraction of earmarks and directives from the annual appropriations bill. Previously, this extraction process was conducted manually, making it time-consuming and inefficient. The implementation of NLP streamlines data extraction, improving efficiency and accuracy.

The project involved developing a custom Natural Language Processing (NLP) model designed to recommend tagging information and detect mismatched data on ForeignAssistance.gov. It effectively identifies potential mismatches and provides suggested tags to enhance data accuracy and organization.

2_use_case_name: Creating Persistent Virtual Reality Personas for dynamic training
x2_summary_text: The EdTech Innovation Lab team is developing a system that integrates various AI tools to create persistent virtual reality personas for use in training exercises. These personas will be stored and allow for interaction during dynamic VR training scenarios. The goal is to enhance the training experience by providing consistent and engaging virtual characters.

2_use_case_name: FSI Enterprise Operations - Gaming and Simulations
x2_summary_text: In FY 2024, the bureau initiated a pilot program focused on enhancing experiential learning through gaming and simulations. This program will involve complex scenarios presented in various target languages to better meet educational needs. The plan includes the development and implementation of these simulations.

FSI is implementing a continuous learning strategy focused on enhancing content generation, analytical tasks, and overall efficiency in content development. This initiative is part of an AI action plan approved by the Front Office, aimed at achieving improved outcomes in productivity.

2_use_case_name: Enhancing Training Effectiveness in FSILearn Using AI
x2_summary_text: The project aims to enhance employee learning experiences in FSILearn by utilizing AI within the Cornerstone Learning Management System. The AI will analyze key data related to learning behaviors, such as course completions, quiz scores, and engagement levels, to create personalized learning paths for users. This approach is designed to improve overall training effectiveness.

2_use_case_name: J Reports Data Collection & Management Tool (DCT)
x2_summary_text: The J Reports Data Collection & Management Tool (DCT) is an AI-driven research assistant that enhances the quality of Congressional reports while significantly reducing the time required for their production. It automates summarization, translation, and categorization of user-submitted content into a searchable database, allowing for efficient retrieval and organization of research materials. Additionally, the DCT employs optical character recognition (OCR) to convert images and documents, further streamlining the data management process.

The TIP Report Translation AI system offers informal, unofficial translations of materials related to the annual Trafficking in Persons report, streamlining the process for staff. Each translated document includes a watermark indicating its unofficial status and requires human verification, review, and editing before use. This tool enables researchers and drafters to concentrate on essential report tasks like identifying and addressing data gaps.

The FOIA 360 AI Matching Tool is designed to enhance the Department of State's Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) process by identifying similar requests and documents to reduce duplication. Additionally, it analyzes current and new requests to identify patterns, ultimately improving response times for the public.
StateChat is an enterprise chatbot developed by the Department that utilizes Generative AI technology. It provides textual responses in a chat interface to facilitate user interactions.

The Crisis Campaign Cable Analytics project utilized optical character recognition and Natural Language Processing to analyze Department cables, aiming to identify gaps and trends in crisis training and enhance post-crisis preparedness. The project has since been retired.

2_use_case_name: NLP to pull key information from unstructured text
x2_summary_text: The project utilizes natural language processing (NLP) to extract key information, such as country names and agreement dates, from unstructured text in PDF documents. It aims to create a dataset containing this crucial information to facilitate data analysis and retrieval.

2_use_case_name: ECA Program Management and Outreach - Summarization
x2_summary_text: The ECA Program Management and Outreach project involves utilizing approved Large Language Models to generate artifacts for leadership and visiting delegations based on accurate datasets. Draft summaries will be created and subsequently reviewed by human experts to ensure quality and relevance.

Storyzy focuses on enhancing the accuracy of detecting synthetic content, which is computer-generated data that resembles real-world data. The project aims to improve the outcomes related to the identification and management of such content.
The Optical Character Recognition project involved extracting text from images by utilizing standard Python libraries, with websites serving as data sources. The project has since been retired.

The project involved analyzing text through topic modeling, which clustered documents based on the frequency of word usage. It was applied to digital media articles and social media posts, utilizing Python libraries for implementation. This project has now been retired.

The project involved using statistical models to forecast expected outcomes, specifically focusing on COVID case projections and the analysis of violent events linked to tweets. This initiative has since been retired.

The Deepfake Detector is a deep learning model designed to classify images of faces as either real or fake, identifying synthetically generated faces created by Generative Adversarial Networks. This project has been retired.

SentiBERTIQ was a sentiment analysis project that utilized a fine-tuned multilingual BERT model to identify and extract subjective information from text. The model was trained on 2.2 million labeled tweets in English, Spanish, Arabic, and traditional Chinese. The project has since been retired.

The TOPIQ project utilized Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) to automatically categorize text documents into topics for analytical review. It extracted topics from documents and assigned probabilities indicating the likelihood of each document belonging to a specific topic. The project has since been retired.

The Text Similarity project involved calculating cosine similarity scores to identify and group identical or nearly identical texts for analysts to review. The project has since been retired and is no longer active.
The Image Clustering project utilized a pretrained deep learning model to create image embeddings, followed by hierarchical clustering to group similar images. The project has been retired.
The Louvain Community Detection project focused on clustering nodes within a social network into communities based on similarities. This project has since been retired and is no longer active.

Fast Text Word Builder was an AI-based tool designed to identify similar terms and phrases derived from a root word, enhancing A&R's ability to construct effective search queries for data collection. The project has since been retired.

The Digital Media Analytics Platform leverages open-source neural machine translation models to convert global media articles and public foreign social media posts into English. This platform also conducts trend analysis based on the translated content.

2_use_case_name: Geospatial Mapping of Historical Survey Data
x2_summary_text: The project involved creating an interactive geospatial map using PowerBI, based on cleaned and collected historical survey data from Pollfish, which included all statistically significant results. The project has since been retired.

2_use_case_name: AI Tools to Enhance PD Workflows
x2_summary_text: The project aims to enhance Public Diplomacy workflows by integrating AI tools, specifically ChatGPT licenses, in accordance with Department policy. The initiative seeks to streamline processes and improve efficiency within the department's operations.

LEO is a project designed to address frequently asked inquiries related to budgeting. It provides clear and concise answers to common budget-related questions. This initiative aims to streamline information access for users seeking assistance with budget office inquiries.

The Collections Chatbot project developed a self-service FAQ chatbot for taxpayers, focusing on payments and financial relief topics, with additional topics in development for future incorporation. The chatbot utilizes a natural language processing (NLP) intent engine to classify user inquiries into specific intents, providing predetermined responses based on a set of trained models, ensuring accuracy and consistency. The system is designed to maintain reliability in controlled environments by only delivering responses tied to predefined topics, avoiding the generation of new or ad-hoc answers.

Systran Translation Software is a commercial language translation tool that utilizes a neural network-based engine to translate documents from Non-English to English and vice versa, primarily for IRS staff who need assistance in evaluating case work. The software does not store any documents and allows users to augment translations with domain-specific dictionaries and translation memories. The translated content can be reviewed on a graphical user interface or exported for further use.

The Automated Underreporter (AUR) Voicebot enhances taxpayer interaction by authenticating users through "Shared Secrets" and providing account-related information after authentication. It offers confirmations of responses, case statuses, and facilitates requests for additional response time when eligible. Additionally, the system can route inquiries to the appropriate service areas or escalate to live agents as needed.

The Employee Resource Center (ERC) Chatbot project provides IRS employees with self-service access to frequently asked questions about various administrative topics through a natural language processing (NLP) and AI-driven Intent Engine. This tool classifies user inquiries into predefined categories and delivers accurate, consistent responses based on predetermined content without generating new responses. It ensures precision in a controlled environment by only pulling answers from established topics.

2_use_case_name: Robotic Process Automation for Form 941-X Extraction
x2_summary_text: The Robotic Process Automation project aims to intelligently extract data from scanned Form 941-X documents using Artificial Intelligence and Intelligent Document Processing. It enhances character recognition and involves human verification when confidence scores are low, ultimately increasing the speed, volume, and accuracy of data extraction while clearing backlogs. By automating this process, data transcribers can process forms more efficiently than manual methods.

The Taxpayer Services Chatbot project developed an AI tool that utilizes Natural Language Processing (NLP) and AI algorithms to provide taxpayers with self-service answers to questions about refunds and the Advanced Child Tax Credit. The chatbot classifies user inquiries into predetermined topics and delivers consistent, accurate responses based on predefined content, ensuring reliability in providing information within a controlled environment. The system does not generate new answers, maintaining adherence to established business logic and topics.

2_use_case_name: Winnie Chatbot for Employee IT FAQs
x2_summary_text: The Winnie chatbot project provides IRS staff with a self-service tool for answering IT-related FAQs using Natural Language Processing (NLP) and AI algorithms to classify user inquiries. The chatbot's responses are predetermined by content owners and do not involve Generative AI, ensuring that only accurate and consistent information is delivered based on predefined topics. This system is designed for controlled environments, prioritizing precision and reliability in the provided answers.

2_use_case_name: DATA Act Bot for Procurement Data Matching
x2_summary_text: The DATA Act Bot automates the verification of IRS Federal Procurement Data System (FPDS) reporting against contract documents using supervised learning and natural language processing. It enhances operational efficiency by ensuring the consistency and accuracy of contract metadata, such as dollar amounts and contract dates, by validating that the reported contract spending information aligns with official documents. The performance of the validation models is measured using F1 accuracy scores for each specific data element.

The Taxpayer Services Form 1040 Voicebot project implements an interactive voice response system that allows taxpayers to check their individual tax information and is capable of directing them to appropriate customer service representatives. Utilizing natural language processing and AI algorithms, the voicebot classifies taxpayer inquiries into specific intents, providing predetermined responses based on established business logic. This AI tool enhances taxpayer access to information and support during both filing and non-filing seasons.

2_use_case_name: Where's My Refund and Where's My Amended Return Voicebot
x2_summary_text: The Where's My Refund (WMR) and Where's My Amended Return (WMAR) voicebots are designed to assist taxpayers in obtaining status updates on their refunds and amended tax returns. Utilizing an Intent Engine powered by natural language processing and AI algorithms, the voicebots classify taxpayer inquiries and provide predetermined responses based on established business logic. This project aims to enhance taxpayer engagement by streamlining the process of accessing refund and amended return information.

2_use_case_name: Simulation of the Nation (SimoN) Synthetic Data Engine
