WestLaw is a generative AI-assisted legal research tool that enhances the efficiency of legal work for FHFA. It utilizes AI technology to search for and summarize legal information, streamlining the research process.

x2_summary_text: The Public Comments Summarization and Topic Classifications Pilot Project aims to efficiently summarize and classify public comments received by the FHFA during comment processes. Several Python modules have been installed to facilitate artificial intelligence and machine learning projects. These modules provide essential tools and libraries for developing and implementing AI/ML solutions.

The project involves the installation of various R modules that enhance capabilities for artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML). These modules provide essential tools and functions to facilitate the development and implementation of AI and ML solutions.

x2_summary_text: The Body Worn Cameras Data Management System transcribes and redacts audio recordings, labeling them as "unverified" until reviewed and approved by an OIG member. The Earnings Calls Analysis project examines company transcripts to extract key words, terms, and themes. It includes a suite of time series indicators that track the evolution of language and categorize topics over time.

The project focuses on enhancing the iterative data quality process through anomaly detection. It aims to generate suggested messages related to the data quality of specific subsets of firm-submitted data by leveraging historical messages that address similar issues. This approach is intended to facilitate better data quality management and consistency.

The Consumer Complaints Explorer project aims to enhance the classification of consumer complaints by implementing topic modeling techniques. It analyzes the gamma value, assigns a topic number, and identifies the top five terms related to each narrative for improved categorization. This project facilitates better understanding and management of consumer complaints.

The project focuses on enhancing graphic design processes to improve efficiency in image processing. It aims to streamline workflows and optimize the handling of images for better productivity and output quality.

The Regulatory Data Analysis project focuses on enhancing data quality for stakeholders by providing predicted percentile level values for comparison with current reported values. This allows analysts to accurately assess discrepancies and improve decision-making based on reliable data.

The project involves utilizing a decision tree to analyze deposits data, aiming to enhance process efficiency and data quality. It entails calculating predetermined variables and filtering them to detect potential outliers in the reporting data.

The project involves developing a random forest model to analyze call report data in order to determine which reported categories most effectively predict a bank's inclusion on novel banking activity lists. The model identifies relevant call report line items that correlate with banks on internal supervisory lists and classifies banks based on their statistical similarity to those engaged in novel activities.

The project focuses on processing financial news to extract relevant insights. It includes the development of interactive dashboards to visualize and analyze the data effectively. This initiative aims to enhance the understanding of financial trends and events through accessible and informative presentations.

The project develops a traditional machine learning natural language processing model to assess bank performance using data from news articles and other inputs. The outcomes of this model are incorporated into the bank's quality control processes.

The project involves analyzing bank review letters by generating statistics based on their length and the frequency of common financial terms. The Writing Quality Analysis Model is a natural language processing (NLP) tool designed to assist leaders in evaluating the writing quality and consistency of documents. It generates an analysis score that reflects the consistency of the writing style, enabling users to improve their communication standards.

The Comment Review System (CRS) is an electronic platform developed by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System to manage and process public comments on regulatory proposals. It utilizes artificial intelligence and traditional machine learning natural language processing techniques to enhance efficiency in comment review, including features such as text summarization, entity identification, and duplication detection. The system ensures thorough review of all comments while offering tools for text matching and note-taking based on metadata.

The Trading Desk Grouping project involves categorizing trading desks by their specific descriptions. Each desk is assigned an asset class type to facilitate organization and analysis. This classification aims to enhance the clarity and efficiency of trading operations.

The project focuses on labor market analysis by estimating key factors influencing employment trends. It utilizes time series data to measure the frequency and quantity of layoffs, providing insights into workforce dynamics.

The Entity Name Matching Tool is designed to enhance process efficiency by assisting analysts in comparing reported entity names against a comprehensive database of legal entity names. This tool streamlines the name matching process, ultimately facilitating better decision-making and analysis.

The Time Reporting Tool automates the classification of individual work activities, generating detailed reports based on the categorized list of activities by time. This tool enhances efficiency by streamlining the tracking and reporting of work-related tasks.

The Threshold Monitoring project aims to improve the monitoring of limit thresholds and actual values, facilitating quicker collaboration among analysts. It provides tools to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of this monitoring process.

The Supply and Demand Tool monitors and projects resource and supply demand by utilizing predefined rule sets. It enables users to track resource fluctuations and determine outcomes based on these rules.

The Outlier Detection project utilizes traditional AI techniques to identify and synthesize information from various firms. It focuses on delivering relevant insights and data to enhance decision-making processes. The Earnings Call Topic Model is designed to classify various topics discussed during earnings calls. It systematically analyzes and organizes information, enhancing the understanding of key themes and insights shared in these calls.

The Bank Performance Monitoring project utilizes an econometric model to enhance off-site risk analysis by incorporating historical ratings. This model supports the evaluation of bank performance and assists in identifying potential risks effectively.

The project involves developing a network management platform that automatically detects network configuration issues. It provides real-time notifications to administrators to facilitate quick responses and resolutions. The goal is to enhance network reliability and performance.

The Bank Exam Quality Control project employs a traditional machine learning NLP model to analyze bank ratings by utilizing data from news articles among other inputs. The outcomes generated by the model serve as a component for ensuring quality control within the banking sector.

The Recommendation Engine connects users with relevant content by analyzing their view history and the viewing patterns of similar users. It offers two main features: recommending similar documents based on the currently viewed document, and suggesting new documents based on the user's past viewing history. This enhances user experience by providing personalized content suggestions.

The Risk Rating Model for Community Banks aims to enhance the risk classification framework used to categorize these banks based on their risk levels. It utilizes statistical methods for variable selection to inform the model, allowing for a more tailored examination intensity that aligns with the identified risks.

The Risk Rating Model aims to identify factors that can predict the likelihood of adverse outcomes for banks, enabling them to be categorized into High-, Moderate-, and Low-risk tiers for review. The model employs statistical methods for variable selection to enhance its predictive accuracy.

The Automatic PSC Classification project aims to categorize uncategorized complaints received by the FTC from various sources, which contain diverse comments. This system will automatically assign Product and Service Codes (PSC) to these complaints, streamlining the classification process and improving data organization.

The project aims to address the challenge of consumers submitting multiple complaints for the same issue through various channels, which hampers Law Enforcement's efficiency in identifying leads. By grouping duplicate complaints, the initiative will streamline and enhance the search process for investigators, ultimately improving response times and data management. This approach will facilitate better tracking of recurring issues reported by consumers.

The chatbot provides round-the-clock support for IdentityTheft.gov and ReportFraud.gov, operating unattended outside of business hours. During business hours, users have access to assisted chat services. This setup ensures continuous assistance for identity theft and fraud reporting.

x2_summary_text: The AI Pilot Project at NARA aims to automate the screening and redaction of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in digitized archival records, enhancing both speed and accuracy while safeguarding privacy. 2_use_case_name: Identification of Potentially Manipulative Trading Activity in Registrant Data
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on identifying potentially manipulative trading activity within registrant data for further examination. It utilizes a system that highlights significant activities of interest for review by an examination team.

2_use_case_name: Testing of Various AI Algorithms and Models
x2_summary_text: The project involves testing various AI algorithms and models to evaluate their potential for improving examiner efficiency, productivity, and effectiveness. Currently, the project is in the planning phase, with specific details yet to be determined.

2_use_case_name: Using Natural Language Processing Techniques to Search and Analyze Certain Filings
x2_summary_text: The project utilizes Natural Language Processing techniques to search and analyze a corpus of unstructured filings. It assists staff in their examination efforts by providing relevant results from the analyzed data. This system enhances the efficiency and effectiveness of filing assessments.

2_use_case_name: Using Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence Techniques to Predict Entities With Certain Risk Characteristics
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on employing Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence techniques to analyze data and predict entities that exhibit specific risk characteristics. The results generated by this system will aid staff in enhancing their examination processes by providing valuable predictive insights.

The project focuses on developing parsing logic to enhance the efficiency of searching and analyzing disclosure text in various filings. This initiative will assist staff in better navigating and interpreting specific filings.

2_use_case_name: Identification of Potentially Manipulative Activity in Certain Accounts
x2_summary_text: The project involves creating a system that identifies accounts exhibiting potentially manipulative activity for further examination. It screens specific behaviors and flags accounts for review by an examination team.

2_use_case_name: Using AI to Help with Coding-Related Tasks/Questions
x2_summary_text: This project utilizes AI to assist staff with coding-related tasks across a selected range of programming languages. It serves as both a practical tool for generating code and an educational resource, providing textual explanations about the coding logic and usage.

2_use_case_name: Optical Character Recognition (OCR) for Records Analysis
x2_summary_text: The Optical Character Recognition (OCR) project facilitates the extraction of relevant information from digital image files for ENF staff, thereby expediting their investigations. It generates a text string containing all recognizable text from the images.

USAGM is implementing Microsoft Copilot to boost productivity and collaboration among its internal teams. This tool utilizes generative AI within the Microsoft 365 suite to automate tasks such as document drafting, content summarization, and meeting scheduling, allowing employees to concentrate on more valuable work. The initiative aims to enhance operational efficiency by integrating AI across various workflows related to collaboration and content management.

The Automated Transcription Generation project utilizes generative AI to improve efficiency and accessibility in USAGM's media workflows. By incorporating Latakoo and OpenAI's Whisper technology, the system accurately transcribes content in real-time and integrates it into USAGM’s media asset management system, making the content easily searchable and accessible for future purposes.

The project utilizes AI technology integrated with a content management system to help journalists enhance the quality of their articles. It automatically generates multiple title options, creates SEO-friendly tags, and provides succinct summaries to boost user engagement. Journalists are able to review and customize AI-generated suggestions to align with their objectives.

The Automated Translations initiative utilizes AI within the content management system to enhance the efficiency of multilingual content production for USAGM's networks. By generating draft translations for articles in over 50 languages, the AI tool facilitates content reuse among language teams while ensuring accuracy and cultural sensitivity. This approach is essential for providing high-quality, localized content to a global audience.

An AI-powered agent is being developed to improve user support for the CMS by responding to natural language inquiries. It will provide customized guidance and solutions derived from the CMS's internal help documentation.

The project pilots AI tools integrated with a content management system (CMS) to generate multi-article summaries, smart search responses, and interactive highlights focused on mobile-first users. These tools enhance content discoverability and user engagement by creating accessible widgets, such as concise summaries, while offering interactive formats that improve comprehension of long-form articles. Overall, the initiative aims to provide a seamless user experience across various digital platforms.

The Automated Text Narration project focuses on using AI-generated audio to improve accessibility and engagement with long-form articles. An integrated audio player will enable users to listen to content, offering a more convenient and flexible way to consume information.

The Automated Metadata Generation project leverages AI to create descriptive metadata, including content summaries and SEO tags. This initiative seeks to streamline cataloging processes, enhance content discoverability, and minimize manual labor involved in metadata production.

The Microsoft Copilot integration aims to enhance efficiency and streamline administrative tasks through the use of AI-generated text and text-based summaries. This project focuses on leveraging advanced AI capabilities to improve productivity and support users in various administrative functions.

Relativity One focuses on enhancing efficiency and streamlining administrative tasks through the use of text-based summaries and AI-generated text. The project aims to optimize information processing and improve productivity in various applications.

Lookout for mobile security employs AI and machine learning to identify and mitigate cyberattacks in real-time. It offers threat intelligence services encompassing data forensics, incident response, and research, alongside a comprehensive dashboard for monitoring activities and reports.

Qualys Cloud Detection and Response employs AI to identify real-time threats, including malware, ransomware, and unauthorized access. It features a dashboard for monitoring activities and generating reports, providing real-time alerts for detected issues.

2_use_case_name: Crowdstrike Falcon Threat Detection and Response
x2_summary_text: Crowdstrike Falcon employs AI to provide real-time detection and response to cybersecurity threats, including malware and ransomware. It features a monitoring dashboard that delivers real-time alerts and detailed reports on security activities.

2_use_case_name: Exiger Due Diligence IQ (“DDIQ”) Research Software
x2_summary_text: Exiger's Due Diligence IQ (DDIQ) research software enhances the efficiency of analyzing individuals and companies for potential partnerships with USTDA. The AI reviews and consolidates relevant publicly available information, such as news reports, into a unified data set for Exiger's analysts to review and refine. This platform streamlines the due diligence process by providing an organized overview of research subjects.

The Evolv WDS - OSSO project utilizes heat map technology to detect the heat signatures of known weapons. It focuses on identifying areas of interest that produce heat indicators matching the heat signatures associated with various types of weapons. This approach aims to enhance security measures by effectively pinpointing potential threats.

The VA Chat Copilot, known as Meta Pilot, is a generative AI interface designed to enhance administrative efficiency for VA employees. Users can upload documents and interact with the tool to receive various outputs, such as draft emails, communications, summaries, and project templates, as well as answers to document-related queries.

The Avigilon Camera/Search Function in the OSSO project enhances security video surveillance by enabling users to search for points of interest within the video footage. This feature allows users to efficiently retrieve specific video or images based on their search criteria.

2_use_case_name: CareCentra Next Level Personalized AI Health Coach
x2_summary_text: The CareCentra Next Level Personalized AI Health Coach is an evidence-based AI solution designed to enhance healthcare quality and minimize alert fatigue among veterans. Through precision nudging, it utilizes personalized behavioral change algorithms to determine the optimal timing and communication channels for each individual veteran. The project aims to improve health outcomes by tailoring interventions to specific needs.

SafePointe WDS - OSSO is a weapon detection software project that utilizes heat map technology to identify objects that emit heat signatures associated with various types of weapons. The software is designed to pinpoint areas of interest based on these heat indicators, enhancing security measures and threat detection capabilities.

GE Xeleris V utilizes AI technology to enhance the accuracy of organ segmentation for quantitation and dosimetry calculations. The Q.Thera AI feature significantly reduces user processing time by an average of 58%, streamlining the calculation of patient dosimetry.

The Genesys Cloud Contact Center project enhances staff efficiency by providing knowledge-based recommendations, conversation summarization, and automating quality assurance metrics. This allows employees to respond more swiftly to customer needs, reduces time spent on information retrieval and repetitive tasks, and enables a greater focus on customer interactions. The system primarily supports staff in managing customer engagements and streamlines processes like scoring quality forms and routing customers based on intents.

The Verkada Camera - OSSO project enhances physical security camera solutions by incorporating an advanced video search function. This feature utilizes AI to search for and retrieve relevant video and image footage stored within the camera system.

The GE Signa Artist MRI system utilizes the AIR™ Recon DL deep-learning-based reconstruction algorithm to produce high-quality images with improved clarity. By effectively eliminating noise and ringing from raw images, this technology enables faster scan times—reducing them by up to 50%—and enhances the overall workflow, positively impacting patient experiences.

The project utilizes Google Cloud Platform's CCAI and Dialogflow technologies to enhance self-service options for veterans through virtual voice and chat agents. It focuses on implementing text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-text (STT) functionalities to improve interaction and accessibility.

2_use_case_name: Axon Body Camera and DMS - OSSO
x2_summary_text: The Axon Body Camera and DMS project aims to enhance the search capabilities of the data repository, improve redaction processes for evidence, and optimize license plate recognition within the Fleet System. This will lead to more effective results when accessing case files, evidence lockers, and various digital media. Overall, the project focuses on achieving greater efficiency and accuracy in managing and processing critical data.

The GE Logic E10 ultrasound system features several automated assistants designed to enhance imaging efficiency and accuracy. The Auto Preset Assistant optimally configures settings for specific anatomies, while the Auto Abdominal Color Assistant adjusts color flow parameters based on the detected organ. Additionally, the Auto Renal Measure Assistant automatically measures kidney dimensions, contributing to improved clinician decision support and reduced workflow errors.

The Smart AI Bot Assistant project aims to enhance the efficacy of crisis calls for the Veterans Crisis Line by employing machine learning and natural language processing to offer real-time resource prompts and streamline documentation for responders. By analyzing keywords and sentiments, the AI will facilitate improved communication between crisis responders and their supervisors, ultimately optimizing workflow and providing responders with necessary downtime. This initiative will be developed and refined in collaboration with VA experts and crisis line staff.

The Siemens YSIO Max project focuses on enhancing radiology digital image quality through innovative technologies. It features bone suppression capabilities that eliminate the need for dual exposures and Diamond View technology that enhances image contrast and detail. Overall, the project aims to improve the clarity and quality of radiological images.

2_use_case_name: Enterprise Precision Scanning and Indexing (EPSI) Next: Enhancing Healthcare Services for Veterans
x2_summary_text: The Enterprise Precision Scanning and Indexing (EPSI) Next project aims to enhance healthcare services for veterans by utilizing generative AI to summarize and create notes from patient health records. This AI-generated output will streamline the indexing workflow for the EPSI product, improving efficiency in healthcare documentation.

2_use_case_name: Nursing Proficiency Coach & Nurse Proficiency Evaluator...and beyond!
x2_summary_text: Two custom GPTs, the Nurse Proficiency Writer and the Nursing Proficiency Coach, have been developed to enhance nurses' understanding of performance standards and assist them in creating effective ePerformance submissions. These tools evaluate self-input against over 600 functional statements, identify areas for improvement, and generate summaries of accomplishments, ultimately saving time and improving submission quality without affecting staff ratings. The initiative aims to address proficiency gaps among the 90,000+ registered nurses and streamline the evaluation process for supervisors.

The Parable 3D Wound Care Management System automates wound measurement using computer vision to create 3D polygon mesh representations, eliminating the need for manual measurements. This contactless approach reduces the risk of infection and improves the accuracy and consistency of measurements, allowing clinicians to focus more on patient care and wound analysis. The system provides comprehensive volumetric data, including length, width, surface area, depth, and volume, enhancing the overall healing process for patients.

2_use_case_name: VEO Virtual Analyst Proof of Concept
x2_summary_text: The VEO Virtual Analyst Proof of Concept aims to demonstrate generative AI capabilities in customer experience insights and service delivery processes. It will offer a development environment where users can interact with dummy data to create and refine generative AI tools. The resulting Virtual Analyst tool will enhance services for veterans by delivering data-driven responses to inquiries about machine learning models and customer experience metrics.

The GE Portable Critical Care Suite 2.x is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in managing critical care patients. It aims to improve healthcare outcomes through enhanced monitoring and support capabilities. Detailed information about the device is available in FDA documentation.

The Patient Care Systems Integration Program (PCSIP) aims to enhance care access for Veterans by increasing the capacity of Veterans Affairs Medical Centers (VAMCs) by up to 20% without additional staffing or resources. Key benefits include significant reductions in charting time, improved patient flow and scheduling efficiency, and enhanced management of surgical and behavioral health cases. The program utilizes AI and integrated documentation systems to streamline administrative processes and ensure instant access to relevant patient information at the point of care.

The Billing Claims Prediction AI aims to assist Revenue Operations by flagging the propensity to bill based on historical user activity. It was trained on data from the Third Party Community Care Billing and related Facility Revenue Activity Codes between 2021 and 2023, utilizing 1.2 million accounts from Florida Caribbean Consolidated Patient Account Center (FCCPAC). The model provides decision support to users in determining the billability of encounters.

2_use_case_name: ScienceLogic Artificial Intelligence Operations (AIOPS) Software Subscriptions with Maintenance and Professional Support Services.
x2_summary_text: The ScienceLogic AIOps software subscription, coupled with maintenance and professional support services, is designed to monitor the performance of cloud applications. This solution allows the Virginia agency to identify the causes of outages and provides a swift response and resolution, ultimately preventing future incidents across its entire domain.

The software assists VA clinicians by interpreting clinical Electrocardiogram (ECG) tracings and integrates with the CPRS system to include patient demographics on the ECG print-out. It generates a list of notable findings that are subsequently reviewed by a licensed provider, often resulting in confirmation of the machine's interpretations.

The Appointment Comments Categorization project aims to provide patients with relevant alerts regarding their mental or physical health when signing up for appointments. Currently, the focus is on mental health, with the model designed to generate alerts such as "Timely_Alert_Needed, 0.xxxxx" to notify patients of immediate needs.

TeraRecon is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in their decision-making processes, thereby enhancing healthcare outcomes. Its approval is documented in FDA records, which outline its specifications and capabilities.

The Ambient AI scribe project aims to address the challenges of clinical documentation by utilizing AI to generate consistent and high-quality summaries of medical encounters. This technology seeks to alleviate the burden on physicians, enhance their job satisfaction, and reduce the time spent on electronic health records, thereby decreasing physician burnout. The Veterans Affairs (VA) is set to pilot these AI solutions at its Medical Centers following a successful AI Tech Sprint.

The Pension Optimization Initiative (POI) aims to automate the processing of Pension and Survivor claims by partnering with a Managed Services Provider, with a target of automating 75% of claims while maintaining or exceeding current manual processing quality. The initiative outlines scenarios where applications are submitted either directly by claimants or via automated matches with government agencies, leading to streamlined data extraction, claim processing, and delivery of benefits notifications. The overall objective is to enhance efficiency and accuracy in the claims process for Veterans and Beneficiaries.

2_use_case_name: Limited Use of Azure Speech Services in PETALS Platform
x2_summary_text: The PETALS Platform incorporates Azure Speech Services for specific functionality, allowing it to read and verbally confirm a participant's first name or numerical step count during program engagement. This implementation serves to validate user input through audio feedback during telephone interactions.

Medallia is a customer experience management platform that utilizes AI, specifically natural language processing (NLP), to analyze survey comments from Veterans. The platform identifies potentially at-risk individuals concerning homelessness and mental health by flagging relevant comments, which then triggers the creation of a case for the Crisis Line and Homeless Program to review and take appropriate action.

The AGFA Dose Monitor system is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in monitoring patient doses during medical imaging procedures. Its primary objective is to enhance healthcare outcomes by ensuring accurate dose management and providing valuable data to healthcare providers. Further details and specifications can be found in the FDA documentation.

The Volpara Imaging Patient Hub is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in improving healthcare outcomes. This device is documented in the FDA records, highlighting its capabilities and regulatory approval.

The Identity Governance and Administration (IGA) project aims to enhance access management within the VA workforce by leveraging AI to assess risk levels of access requests. The IGA tool will automate the approval process for low-risk requests and flag higher-risk cases for manual review, while also providing a dashboard to display risk scores and sending notifications for requests that require attention. This system is designed to reduce potential risks associated with access management.

The VET-HOME Contact Center AI project aims to enhance the situational awareness of VA customer service agents by utilizing AI tools to summarize and contextualize incoming queries from Veterans. The initiative involves training custom AI co-pilots on existing contact center CRM data to proactively present relevant information during conversations, ultimately improving service delivery to Veterans in need.

The Beckman Coulter DxH 800 is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians and enhance healthcare outcomes. It is documented in detail in FDA submissions, providing insights into its operational capabilities and intended uses.

UIPath Document Understanding utilizes Optical Character Recognition and AI document processing to extract data from both computer-generated and handwritten documents. This tool enhances automation by accurately providing data for use in various applications, aiding in decision-making for agents assisting veterans.

The Purchase Card dashboards utilize advanced data analytics to enhance oversight of purchase card spending by identifying potential fraud, waste, and compliance issues. The model generates expected received dates for items and flags transactions that deviate from these expectations, thereby streamlining the investigation process for purchase card managers. This system allows analysts to focus on specific flagged cases rather than reviewing entire datasets, improving efficiency in identifying anomalies.

Roche Digital Pathology is designed to assist pathologists in diagnosing pathology cases through the analysis of slide images. This technology enhances diagnostic accuracy and efficiency by providing valuable insights from the images analyzed.

2_use_case_name: Activity recognition using wearable sensors for use in closed loop deep brain stimulation systems
x2_summary_text: This project focuses on developing a classifier that utilizes data from wearable sensors, such as accelerometers and gyroscopes, to accurately recognize and classify various daily activities, including walking and sitting. The real-time recognition of these behaviors can enhance closed-loop deep brain stimulation systems and has potential applications in several fields.

The VCA & PPMS Chatbot is a virtual agent created to assist field staff with inquiries about VCA and PPMS. It offers quick access to a comprehensive list of frequently asked questions and resources, enabling users to obtain necessary information efficiently and at any time.

The AgileMD eCART Clinical Deterioration Model is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to support clinicians in identifying patient deterioration and enhancing healthcare outcomes. It utilizes data analytics to provide timely insights, improving decision-making in clinical settings. Further details can be found in the FDA documentation for the device.

PINGOO.AI is an educational informational app designed for veterans with diabetes. It utilizes a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) model to deliver up-to-date and trustworthy information through a language model interface. The app aims to address the specific needs of diabetic veterans by providing relevant and accessible information.

2_use_case_name: Persyst 14 EEG Review And Analysis Software
x2_summary_text: Persyst 14 EEG Review and Analysis Software offers comprehensive tools for the computer-assisted review of EEG data, ensuring accurate and efficient analysis. It features customizable parameters for seizure detection, spike detection, EEG signal trending, artifact reduction, and monitoring. The software is widely utilized in both public and private hospitals.

2_use_case_name: Computer Aided Detection (CADe) of Neoplasia during Colonoscopy - “GI Genius”
x2_summary_text: GI Genius™, a computer-aided detection module from Medtronic, utilizes artificial intelligence to enhance the detection of colonic mucosal lesions during colonoscopy. Cleared by the FDA in April 2021, the device integrates with existing endoscopic equipment, providing real-time identification and highlighting of suspected neoplastic lesions. Studies indicate that GI Genius™ significantly increases adenoma detection rates, potentially reducing colorectal cancer incidence and mortality, particularly among Veterans.

Digizens is a behavioral prediction model designed to facilitate the creation of clinical trials without requiring actual patients or their information. It generates behavioral analyses and predictions by analyzing messaging and circumstances.

2_use_case_name: TrueFidelity CT Deep Learning Image Reconstruction
x2_summary_text: The TrueFidelity CT Deep Learning Image Reconstruction project utilizes advanced deep learning techniques to enhance the quality of CT images. Its primary function is to reduce noise, resulting in clearer and more accurate imaging. This improvement aims to facilitate better diagnostics and analysis in medical imaging.

The Pangaea project aims to develop a predictive model for chronic diseases in Veterans, utilizing current treatment guidelines. This model will identify chronic diseases and recommend appropriate treatment modalities before referral to specialty services.

AIDOC is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in their decision-making processes and enhance healthcare outcomes. The device is detailed in FDA documentation, which outlines its intended use and regulatory approval.

Cogitativo predicts chronic diseases by leveraging a data model built from historical Veteran profiles. The output is generated based on unique profiles, though the method of data acquisition remains unspecified.

2_use_case_name: Analytics, Data, and Decision Support Unified Platform (ADDSUP)
x2_summary_text: The Analytics, Data, and Decision Support Unified Platform (ADDSUP) leverages AI enhancements to streamline contract and line item searches, enabling users to quickly filter and obtain relevant information. This tool aims to enhance decision-making by providing rapid access to data, ultimately supporting cost avoidance efforts. Users can generate lists of contracts or line items based on their specific search criteria.

iCAD ProFound AI is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in improving healthcare outcomes. It employs advanced artificial intelligence technology to enhance diagnostic accuracy and efficiency in clinical settings. The device has documented approvals and specifications as outlined in FDA documentation.

2_use_case_name: VA Section 508 Office URL Ownership Prediction Model
x2_summary_text: The VA Section 508 Office URL Ownership Prediction Model is designed to identify the administrative agency responsible for various URLs, thereby streamlining the process of ensuring accessibility compliance. This AI system produces two key outputs: the predicted agency owner and a prediction score, while also utilizing manually structured scripts to facilitate data organization for quarterly review. By implementing this model, the 508 Office significantly decreases the time and effort required to coordinate URL ownership with VA Administrations.

Circle CVI42 is a software designed to enhance the efficiency of post-processing and reporting for Cardiac MRI and Cardiac CT images by automating the segmentation of cardiac structures. It generates key metrics such as ejection fraction, strain, stroke volume, and coronary calcium score, all of which are thoroughly verified by cardiologists for precision. Furthermore, physicians have the ability to modify these outputs before they are included in the patient's chart.

2_use_case_name: National Cemetery Administration (NCA) Automated Claims Processing
x2_summary_text: The National Cemetery Administration (NCA) is implementing an AI-driven automated claims processing system to enhance efficiency in handling benefits applications, starting with the Pre-Need and Presidential Memorial Certificate programs. The Hyperscience platform utilizes optical character recognition, natural language processing, and machine learning to extract data, integrate with existing VA systems, and automate tasks such as data entry, document creation, and status updates. This project aims to streamline NCA's workload and may expand to include additional benefit programs in the future.

The VA CART Adenoma Detection project utilizes Natural Language Processing (NLP) to extract adenoma status from VistA colonoscopy surgical pathology reports for CART Veterans. The results indicate adenoma status as either 0, signifying no evidence of adenoma, or 1, indicating the presence of adenoma in the reports.

The Call Center Knowledge Navigator is designed to assist call center agents by providing quick answers to their questions, supported by cited references from VA-provided procedural materials. This tool aims to enhance response times by efficiently identifying relevant information and summarizing procedures, while also allowing agents to access the source material for further verification.

2_use_case_name: National Training Team | Schools — FAQ Dashboard
x2_summary_text: The FAQ Dashboard for the National Training Team aggregates and categorizes thousands of questions submitted during monthly Office Hours with School Certifying Officials. It features a "top ten" list highlighting the most frequently asked topics along with sentiment scores for better understanding of the inquiries' context.

2_use_case_name: National Training Team | Schools — FAQ Dashboard
x2_summary_text: The National Training Team is developing a FAQ Dashboard for schools that will organize thousands of questions into specific categories. The model will generate sample questions related to each category and offer suggested answers based on prior responses to similar inquiries. This initiative aims to enhance the efficiency of responding to frequently asked questions in educational settings.

2_use_case_name: Audit of Service Connection Designations Associated with Prescriptions
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on auditing service connection designations linked to prescriptions to identify and mitigate waste, fraud, and abuse in the healthcare system. It aims to streamline processes and improve the accuracy of prescription management. The goal is to enhance efficiency and ensure that resources are used effectively.

PsychCorpCenter is a program designed to provide multiculturally sensitive scoring of cognitive assessments to enhance the accuracy of diagnostic impressions. It processes input data from providers about specific Veterans or patients and generates detailed reports based on that information.

ReflexAI is an AI-driven simulation platform designed to enhance the training of responders for the Veterans Crisis Line by offering tailored, high-quality practice and immediate feedback. The platform, hosted on the secure VA Enterprise Cloud, provides training staff with access to simulation content and real-time feedback that evaluates training effectiveness and tracks individual progress.

2_use_case_name: Prostate Cancer, Genetic Risk, and Equitable Screening Study (ProGRESS) - Prostate Cancer Risk Prediction Model
x2_summary_text: The Prostate Cancer, Genetic Risk, and Equitable Screening Study (ProGRESS) develops a risk prediction model to categorize participants into low, average, or high prostate cancer risk using machine learning and various data sources. This classification is included in a comprehensive report that provides genetic information and screening recommendations to both participants and their VA healthcare providers, facilitating shared decision-making about prostate cancer screening. The study aims to enhance precision in prostate cancer screening interventions.

2_use_case_name: Using AI to enhance/augment classification of reported patient safety events, and to proactively identify patient safety vulnerabilities and potential areas of improvement
x2_summary_text: This project utilizes AI to improve the classification of reported patient safety events and to proactively detect vulnerabilities in patient safety. The system enables statisticians to identify trends and anomalies, allowing for timely intervention to prevent the escalation of new or increased safety events. Additionally, it enhances the classification of event types for more effective monitoring.

2_use_case_name: App feedback model for NLP tasks
x2_summary_text: The project aims to leverage Natural Language Processing (NLP) to automate the analysis of app feedback by identifying named entities, detecting profanity, and removing stop words from text reviews. Utilizing spaCy's en_core_web_sm model, the system processes reviews from both external platforms like Google and Apple stores and internal sources such as FeedbackUI and VA Mobile. The primary users are the OCC Data Science Team, while the target audience includes mobile application developers and other stakeholders interested in analyzing user sentiment and feedback.

The TERA Memorandum Automation project employs natural language processing (NLP) algorithms to assist Veteran Service Representatives (VSRs) in completing the TERA Memorandum form for Veteran Disability Claims. By auto-populating answers using evidence stored in Claims Evidence, the system significantly reduces the time spent on manual document reviews and streamlines the claim processing workflow. The output includes a response with a confidence score and links to relevant documents for further manual review.

The XtractOne project aims to modernize the weapons detection system (WDS) for VA Police by centralizing reporting and enhancing operational efficiency through a SaaS solution. This advanced system allows for better monitoring, quicker response to security incidents, and efficient manpower allocation. It employs machine learning to continuously improve detection capabilities, thereby increasing safety within VA facilities.

2_use_case_name: Using AI to weekly monitoring of any harms resulting from the use of newly implemented electronic health record system – FEHR across VA
x2_summary_text: The project employs AI to conduct weekly monitoring of potential harms associated with the newly implemented electronic health record system (FEHR) across the VA. This monitoring aims to identify and classify harm categories, providing insights that will enhance the EHR system's functionalities and ultimately prevent and mitigate patient safety events.

Our involvement with Podimetrics is confined to receiving and processing escalation reports from their SmartMat system. We act as a conduit for sharing these reports with the appropriate clinicians to enhance care for Veterans, without engaging in the development or decision-making processes of their proprietary technology. Our role is strictly supportive, focusing on data transfer and integration for effective clinical follow-up.

2_use_case_name: Thematic Analysis of Chief Resident in Quality and Patient Safety (CRQS) Capstone Projects Using BERT Modeling
x2_summary_text: The project utilizes BERT modeling to conduct a thematic analysis of Chief Resident in Quality and Patient Safety (CRQS) capstone projects, aiming to identify key themes and trends. The findings will be used to enhance the national curriculum for quality and patient safety in healthcare by informing curriculum development and improvement strategies.

2_use_case_name: My HealtheVet VSignals Main Improvement Summary
x2_summary_text: My HealtheVet is the VHA patient portal that allows Veterans to refill medications, communicate with care teams, access medical records, and view appointments. To improve user experience, the portal collects over 26,000 surveys monthly, utilizing AI to summarize and categorize open-text responses for identifying trends and feature requests. This process enhances the identification of issues and prioritization of resources while ensuring the privacy of Veterans' feedback.

The ESD-Speech Sentiment and Analytics project leverages AI technology to analyze the speech sentiment of internal customers to enhance service quality at the Enterprise Service Desk. It generates various reports and dashboards for ESD leadership and Tier 1 vendor partners to evaluate service quality, allowing for the analysis of 100% of contacts rather than the current 2% assessed through manual methods.

The Privacy Act Automation Services (PAA) System automates the processing of Privacy Act requests, significantly reducing the wait time for Veterans to receive their records and minimizing the support needed from VA staff. Utilizing AI and machine learning, the system improves document identification, data extraction, and automated redactions while incorporating Human in the Loop (HITL) and Government in the Loop (GITL) roles for quality assurance. Final outputs are reviewed for accuracy and completeness before being released to the requesters.

The project aims to conduct sentiment analysis on text reviews from various sources, classifying them as positive, negative, or neutral. Utilizing a fine-tuned model based on an open-source framework, the system processes reviews from both external sources like the Google and Apple app stores and internal platforms such as FeedbackUI and VA Mobile. The primary users are the OCC Data Science Team, with stakeholders such as mobile application developers benefiting from insights into user sentiment and feedback.

ESD-Predictive Intelligence aims to utilize Machine Learning on existing ticketing data to enhance the efficiency of resolving internal customer issues by decreasing mean time to resolution and improving ticket routing accuracy. The project will generate outputs such as pre-populated assignment groups in ServiceNow, facilitating better ticket routing and providing dashboards for Incident Management teams to identify potential major incidents promptly.

The AI Health Coach project combines a traditional Health Coach with AI technology to enhance patient adherence to health protocols. The Health Coach provides evidence-based nudges using a pre-selected decision tree, while the AI analyzes engagement levels to optimize the frequency of these nudges. This approach aims to improve overall health outcomes for users, particularly Veterans.

Verathon Prime Plus is a bladder scanner that incorporates AI technology to enhance the detection of bladder size and shape. Its primary goal is to improve measurement accuracy for medical assessments. The device provides assisted outputs that aid healthcare professionals in making informed decisions.

The App Feedback Categorization Model aims to classify review texts into distinct categories such as Tech, Usability, Content, Idea, and Other to enhance trend identification and analytics capabilities. It utilizes a fine-tuned open-source model trained on review data from external sources like Google and Apple stores, as well as internal VA mobile applications. The primary users are the OCC Data Science Team, who will manage and maintain the categorization pipeline.

2_use_case_name: LINQ and  LINQ II Loop Recorder
x2_summary_text: LINQ and LINQ II Loop Recorders are implantable heart monitoring devices that continuously monitor heart rhythm and rate. The collected data is remotely transmitted and recorded for interpretation by medical providers, facilitating timely analysis and intervention.

2_use_case_name: VA.gov Chatbot: Use of AI for summative and/or intent classification of Va.gov content
x2_summary_text: The VA.gov Chatbot employs Natural Language Understanding technology to interpret and respond to Veterans' inquiries. The future plan aims to enhance the chatbot's capabilities by integrating advanced AI services, allowing it to address a wider range of questions with improved accuracy and facilitate proper routing for channel escalations. This will enable the chatbot to better understand user intent and generate relevant responses effectively.

The Zio Patch Heart Monitor is a wearable device that tracks heart rate and rhythm for a duration of up to 14 days. It is designed to diagnose arrhythmias and other electrical conduction issues in the heart.

2_use_case_name: Caller intent classification using Google Dialogflow (VoiceBot)
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on developing a VoiceBot using Google Dialogflow to enhance call center efficiency by classifying caller intent. This AI-driven solution aims to expedite triage, improve caller-to-agent matching, and automate routine tasks without agent involvement, primarily serving Veterans in navigating to the appropriate support. Conversational scripts, including intents and entities, will be stored in databases standard to VA call centers.

Ordr SCE Analytics utilizes advanced AI and machine learning technologies to classify local networked devices for accurate inventory management while employing non-invasive passive classification techniques. This approach identifies unique behavior patterns of devices without the need for disruptive active scanning methods, ensuring minimal impact on sensitive IoT devices. The system forwards only essential network device metadata to the SCE Analytics server, discarding sensitive information like PHI to maintain data privacy.

The Machine Algorithm for Report Surveillance (MARS) tool is designed to identify federal EHR incident reports submitted by end-users that may impact patient safety. By complementing the existing manual review process, MARS generates a list of ServiceNow tickets that need human validation to confirm their potential patient safety implications.

PHAIMIS is an AI-powered inventory management system designed to centralize and optimize inventory processes within the VA Pharmacy Service. By integrating AI and data analytics, the system will provide real-time notifications, demand forecasting, procurement strategy optimization, and dynamic inventory thresholds, ultimately enhancing the user experience and workflow efficiency. Additional features may include anomaly detection alerts.

The Silverberry Surgery Planning AI project focuses on enhancing the perioperative process by utilizing multiple AI agents. These agents will assist with various tasks such as surgical planning systems (SPS), inventory management of supplies, personnel requirements, and patient planning. The aim is to streamline operations and improve efficiency in surgical environments.

2_use_case_name: ICU CIS/ARK PDF Medical Entity and Clinical Scoring Extraction (PHI 3.5 LLM)
x2_summary_text: The ICU CIS/ARK project focuses on extracting clinical data elements from unstructured clinical notes and converting them into structured and semi-structured formats. It maps these extracted elements to standardized terminologies like SNOMED, LOINC, ICD-10, and RxNorm, facilitating downstream analytics processes and integration with clinical information systems.

BlueTeam AI offers network monitoring solutions that ensure governance and compliance for the use of LLM Generative AI in enterprises. It restricts the output to only approved data categories and notifies users of any violations.

2_use_case_name: OAWP Investigative, Analytics, and Reporting Capabilities
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on developing an audio transcription application utilizing Azure AI Speech Services to facilitate the creation of transcripts for OAWP investigators. Additionally, the Compliance Analytics and Reporting Division aims to implement supervised machine learning to classify external oversight entity reports and is exploring the use of deep learning models for data analysis, trend identification, and anomaly detection.

The Multi-Modal Digital Image Exchange - AI (MDIE-AI) project develops an AI-driven orchestration layer that automates the processing of computer vision models using saved DICOM diagnostic images. It generates a summary PDF of the results for review, which can be directly accessed from the DICOM file.

2_use_case_name: VA Supply Chain Knowledge Management Dashboard
x2_summary_text: The VA Supply Chain Knowledge Management Dashboard project aims to enhance internal knowledge management and learning capabilities by utilizing existing Power BI tools to analyze publicly available documentation, such as congressional reports. By implementing advanced data analysis tools and dynamic dashboards, the project facilitates improved collaboration and risk mitigation within the VALOR mission, ensuring effective capture and sharing of knowledge. The initiative focuses solely on publicly accessible data and does not involve any individual information, further emphasizing its safety and rights non-impacting nature.

The project aims to evaluate clinical outcomes in patients with skin diseases utilizing asynchronous teledermatology for research and quality improvement (QI) purposes. Dermatology progress notes will be classified into six distinct categories: Resolved, Improved, Unchanged (clinically significant), Unchanged (not clinically significant), Worse, and No outcome stated.

TryOpenAI is designed to enhance the efficiency and satisfaction of VA employees by automating basic administrative tasks and improving communication. It assists users in drafting emails, summarizing documents, streamlining meeting minutes, and generating templates for routine outputs. Additionally, it supports creative and technical problem-solving, research assistance, and learning opportunities within various contexts.

Lyssn for Mental Health is an AI-driven tool designed to enhance adherence to evidence-based practices in Behavioral Health, specifically targeting methodologies like Motivational Interviewing. By analyzing recordings or transcripts of provider-patient sessions, Lyssn automatically generates clinical quality metrics that assess various aspects of counseling effectiveness, patient-centered communication, and fidelity to therapeutic techniques such as Cognitive Behavioral Therapy.

2_use_case_name: 3M/Solventum 360 Encompass Computer Assisted Coding - Auto Suggestion
x2_summary_text: The 3M/Solventum 360 Encompass project aims to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of medical coding by providing coders with suggested ICD 10, CPT, and HCPCS codes based on clinical documentation from outpatient, inpatient, or surgery encounters. This AI-driven auto suggestion system is designed to facilitate timely and precise coding, ultimately improving the overall medical coding process.

Vivid IQ is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in their decision-making processes and enhance healthcare outcomes. This device has been documented in FDA submissions, confirming its safety and efficacy for use in clinical settings.

2_use_case_name: Vivid E80/ Vivid E90/ Vivid E95
x2_summary_text: The Vivid E80, Vivid E90, and Vivid E95 are FDA-cleared medical devices designed to assist clinicians in enhancing healthcare outcomes. These devices utilize advanced technology and are documented in the FDA's official records for their effectiveness and compliance.

The Payment Redirect Fraud (PRF) model is designed to detect potentially fraudulent direct deposit changes made by criminals targeting Veterans' benefit payments. By analyzing data, the model identifies referrals with the highest likelihood of fraud, allowing investigators to review and address these cases. The model outputs include sensitive Veteran information and direct deposit bank account details in both R data and Excel file formats.

EchoPAC is an FDA-cleared medical software device designed to assist clinicians in enhancing healthcare outcomes. It includes both a software-only version and a plug-in, as outlined in the FDA documentation. This technology aims to improve diagnostic capabilities in medical settings.

2_use_case_name: Using Partially Observed Markov Decision Process to Implement a Response to Intervention Framework for Veterans with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
x2_summary_text: The project utilizes a Partially Observed Markov Decision Process (POMDP) model to enhance personalized treatment for veterans with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). This approach aims to minimize or eliminate PTSD symptoms efficiently, leading to reduced treatment costs and a faster return to civilian life for veterans compared to existing practices.

The project utilizes Microsoft Power Automate and AI to streamline transport scheduling for eligible veterans by extracting information from request forms in PDF format attached to emails. This information is then automatically populated into an Excel spreadsheet, capturing essential data points such as request dates, veteran details, trip logistics, and facility addresses. The goal is to enhance the efficiency of coordinating transport services through automation.

2_use_case_name: IVC Access Transformation Transformative Care Modalities VA Health Connect Using Machine Learning to Evaluate First Contact Resolution (FCR)
x2_summary_text: The IVC Access Transformation project aims to enhance performance metrics for First Contact Resolution (FCR) within the Clinical Triage core service at VA Health Connect by utilizing machine learning techniques. The model classifies clinical triages as resolved or not resolved, enabling effective analysis of FCR without impacting medical decisions or using sensitive Veteran data.

The ECG system software is a commercially available tool designed to assist healthcare professionals with the interpretation of electrocardiograms. It generates ECG tracings and offers readings on various ECG parameters, enhancing diagnostic accuracy.

The Avicenna ICH project leverages AI technology to detect potential intracranial hemorrhage (ICH) in CT head exams, enhancing diagnostic speed and accuracy. It processes DICOM format CT images from VHA facilities and outputs results to the National Teleradiology Program's Picture Archive Communication System for review by radiologists. Future enhancements will include the generation of DICOM structured reports for integration with the PACS Powerscribe dictation software.

Densitas Density AI combines quantitative mammographic density measurements with a qualitative breast density scale aligned with the ACR BI-RADS Atlas. It processes DICOM mammography image data from VHA facilities to facilitate and enhance mammographic diagnoses. The outputs include DICOM objects stored in the NTP PACS for radiologist review, with plans to integrate structured reports for dictation software in the future.

CLARUS is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist healthcare professionals and enhance patient outcomes. It is documented in the FDA records, providing detailed information about its approval and intended use in clinical settings.

Riverain ClearRead CT is an AI tool designed to analyze chest CT exams and identify various types of pulmonary nodules, particularly for lung cancer screenings. It enhances image clarity by suppressing vessels and normal lung structures, improving nodule visibility, and allows for the comparison of nodules across different examinations. Managed by the VHA National Teleradiology Program, the system generates DICOM outputs for radiologist review and is either hosted in the VA Enterprise Cloud or on-premise servers.

Clinical Key is a search platform designed for clinicians to access current evidence-based medical practices. It provides summaries of medical literature and answers to medical questions based on user search prompts, enhancing decision-making in clinical settings.

The ACS NSQIP Risk Score is a clinical decision support tool that evaluates surgical risk for patients. It generates a risk assessment based on specific input values provided by healthcare providers. This system aids in informed decision-making regarding surgical procedures.

Avicenna LVO is an AI system designed to detect large vessel occlusion in the anterior intracranial circulation using Head CT Angiography exams. It processes DICOM Head CT image data from VHA facilities and produces DICOM objects for review by diagnostic radiologists, with plans for future integration of structured reports into the VHA NTP PACS Powerscribe dictation software.

Ysio Max is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in their workflows and enhance healthcare outcomes. Transpara Breast Care utilizes artificial intelligence to analyze digital mammograms for patterns indicative of breast cancer, aiming to enhance the speed and accuracy of cancer detection. The system processes DICOM mammography images submitted by VHA facilities and generates outputs for further review by Diagnostic Radiologists. Upcoming enhancements will include structured reports integrated with VHA's Powerscribe dictation software.

XIDF-AWS801, also known as the Alphenix Workstation, is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians and enhance healthcare outcomes. It is detailed in FDA documentation, providing guidelines and specifications for its use in medical settings.

The AI system aids in identifying coding errors, optimizing performance, and generating creative solutions across a range of tasks including coding, math problems, and in-depth analysis. Its outputs aim to provide clear explanations, detailed code reviews, and engaging discussions, all designed to improve coding skills and foster learning.

This project focuses on creating synthetic non-personally identifiable information (non-PII) test data leveraging Generative AI. Workflow Box is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians and enhance healthcare outcomes. Its effectiveness and safety are documented in FDA filings, which detail its approval and intended uses in medical settings.

2_use_case_name: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale for DSM-5 (CAPS-5) Clinician Training Simulator
x2_summary_text: The CAPS-5 Clinician Training Simulator offers three immersive online courses tailored for clinicians, trainees, researchers, and examiners to enhance their skills in administering and scoring the CAPS-5. WellDoc BlueStar is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to support clinicians in managing patient care and enhancing healthcare outcomes. The WAVE Clinical Platform is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist healthcare professionals and enhance patient outcomes. VX1 and VX1+ are FDA-cleared medical devices designed to assist clinicians in providing better healthcare outcomes. 2_use_case_name: Sybil - Lung Cancer Prediction Model by MIT
x2_summary_text: The Sybil lung cancer prediction model, developed by MIT, is designed to personalize screening protocols by identifying high-risk patients for earlier intervention and minimizing the screening burden on low-risk individuals. It analyzes low-dose CT scans of the lungs and generates a JSON output that predicts the likelihood of developing cancer over the next six years, with annual predictions provided.

eCaremanager is a software developed by Philips that integrates clinical, physiological, and demographic data from patients in the National TeleCC Program to generate acuity scores and alerts. The system helps identify patients needing intervention, promoting timely treatment to restore health.

VUNO Med-DeepBrain is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in diagnosing and treating patients, thereby improving healthcare outcomes. The device utilizes advanced technology to enhance clinical decision-making, as outlined in the FDA documentation.

Policy AId is a generative AI application designed to streamline the time-consuming policy lookup process within the VA by utilizing a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) approach. The application allows users to input policy-related questions and receive relevant answers sourced from Medical Center reference materials, enhancing efficiency and employee satisfaction. It also standardizes meeting minutes according to the Dayton governance structure and provides interactive feedback with links to associated medical center publications.

The Volta AF-Xplorer is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in diagnosing and treating healthcare conditions, ultimately aiming to enhance patient outcomes. The Biotronik Home Monitoring System collects data from patients with implanted cardiac monitors and transmits it for clinician review through a secure web platform. Using proprietary AI technology, the system classifies transmitted data into true arrhythmias and false positives for conditions like atrial fibrillation and bradycardia, thus enhancing diagnostic accuracy and patient care. This system is utilized by the VA National Cardiac Device Surveillance program and local VA clinics to better evaluate patient health.

2_use_case_name: Synthetic Data Generation:  Experimenting with OpenSource, Third Party and GenAI
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on generating synthetic patient clinical and demographic data using open-source tools, third-party software, and generative AI. Its primary goal is to enhance the agility of research and operational development processes. The generated data will facilitate experimentation while maintaining privacy and security standards.

The CareLink home monitoring system enables patients with implanted cardiac monitors to transmit data to clinicians for evaluation via a secure web platform. Using proprietary AI deep learning algorithms, the system accurately distinguishes between true arrhythmias and false positives, specifically eliminating incorrect atrial fibrillation and pause events. This technology is utilized by the VA National Cardiac Device Surveillance program and local VA clinic providers to enhance patient care and monitoring.

Nuance Dragon Medical One is a voice-to-text technology that allows healthcare professionals to enter documentation into electronic health records efficiently. This system converts voice-generated content into clinical documentation, streamlining the documentation process in medical settings.

2_use_case_name: Stratification Tool for Opioid Risk Mitigation (STORM) predictive model
x2_summary_text: The Stratification Tool for Opioid Risk Mitigation (STORM) is a predictive model designed to estimate the risk of suicide or overdose-related healthcare events among patients within the VA healthcare system. It utilizes patient data to identify those at elevated risk, facilitating referrals to interdisciplinary teams for clinical case reviews and treatment recommendations, which have demonstrated a reduction in all-cause mortality by 22% for very high-risk patients. STORM also supports clinicians in risk assessment prior to prescribing opioids and promotes coordinated care for patients with complex needs, ultimately aiming to enhance decision-making and mitigate adverse outcomes related to opioid exposure.

Vitrea CT Brain Perfusion is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in evaluating brain perfusion and ultimately enhance healthcare outcomes. The device utilizes advanced imaging technology to provide critical information that aids in the diagnosis and treatment of various neurological conditions. Detailed information about the device can be found in the FDA documentation linked above.

2_use_case_name: Deep-Learning approaches to develop candidate lists of terms for use in text searches
x2_summary_text: The project focuses on utilizing deep learning techniques to enhance candidate term lists for text-matching algorithms used in identifying relevant concepts within free-text medical records. By leveraging large language models and word-embedding methods, the approach aims to generate more comprehensive and unbiased term lists that undergo expert review for accuracy. Ultimately, this process seeks to improve the sensitivity and efficiency of clinical concept extraction from medical notes.

The Vereos PET/CT is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to assist clinicians in diagnosing and treating medical conditions more effectively. It enhances healthcare outcomes by providing advanced imaging capabilities, as outlined in the FDA documentation. 2_use_case_name: Recovery Engagement and Coordination for Health – Veterans Enhanced Treatment (REACH VET) 1.0 predictive model
x2_summary_text: The Recovery Engagement and Coordination for Health – Veterans Enhanced Treatment (REACH VET) 1.0 model is a predictive tool that analyzes patient medical records to assess the risk of suicide within the upcoming month. Since its national implementation in 2017, REACH VET has been associated with increased treatment engagement and reduced rates of mental health crises among participating Veterans.
The project involves a FDA-cleared medical device designed to aid clinicians and enhance healthcare outcomes. Detailed information about the device can be found in the FDA documentation.

The system operates within approved VA IT boundaries, ensuring compliance with regulations, and facilitates the identification of veterans in need of additional resources without impacting decision-making related to treatment or health assessments.

2_use_case_name: Post discharge 30-day readmission or death prediction model to select patients for expedited postdischarge clinic follow-up.
x2_summary_text: This project involves the development of an AI-powered prediction model designed to identify patients at high risk of readmission or death within 30 days post-discharge, thereby informing their follow-up care. The model serves as a supplementary tool for clinicians, providing insights based on various factors that may not be readily available during discharge discussions, ultimately aiming to reduce readmission rates and mortality through more systematic and timely follow-up care for vulnerable patients. Utilizing an XGBoost system, the model outputs probabilities that assist in clinical decision-making regarding expedited follow-up appointments.

2_use_case_name: Using Artificial Intelligence to Predict Suicide
x2_summary_text: This project utilizes artificial intelligence to predict suicide risks among veterans by identifying two critical factors: access to guns and active opioid use disorder (OUD). Through natural language processing, the AI algorithms analyze clinical notes to flag patients who may have these risk factors, providing mental health clinicians with valuable insights to inform their care. The initiative aims to enhance suicide prevention efforts by enabling timely interventions tailored to the unique circumstances of veteran patients.

RayStation 11B is an FDA-cleared medical device designed to support clinicians in their practice and enhance healthcare outcomes. The device is detailed in FDA documentation, emphasizing its safety and efficacy in clinical settings.

2_use_case_name: Identify access to genetic testing in Veterans with breast cancer.
x2_summary_text: The project aims to enhance access to genetic testing for Veterans with breast cancer by allowing stakeholders in the National Oncology Program to effectively identify Veterans who have not received standard care access to germline genetic testing. The system is designed to work within compliant IT boundaries while ensuring it does not create or exacerbate existing inequities in healthcare access.

This initiative is designed to enhance care delivery and support efforts to address disparities, without impacting patient safety or rights.

This enhancement is expected to reduce the number of unaddressed alerts and enable users to take appropriate actions more effectively. The integration of a large language model will facilitate a clearer understanding of alerts and encourage prompt resolution.

The project involves using Adobe Creative Cloud to create nursing education presentations. This includes developing animations and generating AI art to enhance the visual appeal and effectiveness of the educational material.

The project utilizes AI to analyze 14 days of heart rhythm data, effectively identifying and narrowing down periods of abnormalities. It produces a report that lists various detected heart rhythm irregularities for clinicians to interpret and make informed recommendations.
